src: Enye yeengxaki eziqhelekileyo xa kuzanywa ukutshintsha imuvi ekwifomathi ye-DVD yingxaki yokusika imifanekiso. Uninzi loomabona kude lwenziwe ngendlela yokukholisa uluntu ngokubanzi. Ngeso sizathu, yonke into oyibonayo kumabonakude isikwe imida, ngaphezulu, ezantsi kunye namacala. Oku kwenziwe ukuze kuqinisekiswe ukuba umfanekiso ugcwalisa isikrini sonke. Oku kubizwa ngokuba yi-overscan. Ngelishwa, xawusenza i-DVD, imida yayo, futhi ukuba ibinemibhalo yotoliko ezisondele kakhulu ezantsi, zisenongaveli.
mt: 1 of the 2 discs in the game is scratched. This is a common problem with DVDs. All the information on the disc is on the top, bottom, left and right. This is done to ensure that the image is centered on the screen. This is called overscan. When you play the DVD, the image is on the top, bottom, left and right. It is not centered.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Icebo le-Melika belithembhele ekuhlaseleni okuvela kwiindawo ezintathu ngamaxesha adibanisiweyo. uJenerali John Cadwalder wayehlasela nekampu yase-Bhritane, ukuze kublokwe konke ukuqiniswa. Unjengele James Ewing wahamba namajoni ayi-700 wawela umlambo e-Trenton Ferry waza wathathela kuye ulawulo lweblorho ephezu kwe-Assunpink Creek ukuze athintele nawaphi amajoni otshaba ukuba abaleke. Umkhosi ohlasela utshaba onamadoda ayi-2Â 400 aza kunqumla kumlambo kwiimayile ezilithoba kumantla eTrenton, uze wohlukane ube ngamaqela amabini, elinye libe phantsi kukaGreene kanti elinye libe ngaphantsi kukaSullivan, ukuze bahlasele ngaphambi kokuthi qheke kwelanga.
mt: 1. The British general, John Cadwalder, was in charge of the camp. 2. James Ewing marched 700 men to the Trenton Ferry, where they crossed the Assunpink Creek to attack the Hessians. 3. A force of 2,400 men crossed the Assunpink Creek at two fords, one at the Greene and one at the Sullivan, to attack the Hessians before they could retreat.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: "Emva kokuthatyathwa kwayo YIndlu yowiso mthetho ngeJuly 4, idrafti ebhalwe ngesandla yasayinwa nguMongameli weNdlu yowiso mthetho John Hancock noNobhala uCharles Thomson yathunyelwa kubashicileli abakufuphi bevenkile ka John Dunlap. Ngobusuku phakathi kwe-150 no-200 yekopi zenziwe, ezaziwa ngoku zizi-""Dunlap broadsides"". Ukufundwa kokuqala kolu xwebhu kwakunguJohn Nixon eyadini yeHolo lokuZimela ngoJulayi 8. Enye yathunyelwa eGeorge Washington ngoJulayi 6, eyathi mayifundwe nemikhosi yakhe eNew York ngoJulayi 9. Ikopi yayo yafika eLondon ngoAgasti 10. I-25 Dunlap ebanzi ebisaziwa ukuba ikho zezona kopi zindala zoxwebhu. Ikopi ebhalwe ngesandla yokuqala khange isinde."
mt: "After being engrossed by the House of Representatives on July 4, the drafti was signed by President of the House John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson. It was printed by John Dunlap. Between 150 and 200 copies were printed, known as the ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first copy was printed by John Nixon on July 8. It was signed by George Washington on July 6, and was read to his troops in New York on July 9. It arrived in London on August 10. 25 Dunlap copies are known to exist."
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: AbaKolonisi, bakubona esi senzo, basose babiza ukuba siphinda phindwe. Amajoni aqinisa izikhundla zangaphambili aquka iirejimeni zokuqala nezesithathu zeNew Hampshire zamadoda angama-200, phantsi kweeColonels uJohn Stark noJames Reed (bobabini kamva baba ziinjengele). Amadoda kaStark athatha iindawo zawo ngasecingweni kwicala elingasentla kwendawo awayekuwo amaKoloniyali. Xa umsinga wavula umsantsa ngakumlambo i Mystic River nangakumantla e peninsula,bakhawuleza balwandisa ucingo ngelitye elifuthsane elilidonga ngasentla eliphela ekupheleni kwamazi olwandle oluncinci. u-Gridley okanye u-Stark ubekhe ipali emva kobala amanyathelo (30 cm) ukusuka ecingweni wayala esithi kungabikho mntu odubulayo bengeka gqithi abesiqhelo.
mt: 1. The colonists, seeing the enemy, were dismayed. The militia, under the command of Colonels John Stark and James Reed (later known as the "Fighting" colonels), took their positions on the high ground overlooking the British. When the British crossed the Mystic River and landed on the peninsula, they were met by a hail of musket fire (30 cm) from the colonists on the high ground. 2. Gridley or Stark gave the order to fire.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: I-China yakudala yayinendlela eyahlukileyo yokubonisa amaxesha ahlukeneyo; Inqanaba ngalinye lase China okanye usapho ngalunye olwalusemagunyeni lwaluludidi olwahlukileyo. Kwakhona phakathi kobukumkani ngabunye kwakukho iminyaka engazinzanga yamaphondo ohlukeneyo. Elona laziwa kakhulu kula maxesha yayilixesha leThree Kingdoms epoch elenzeka iminyaka engama-60 phakathi kweHan neJin Dynasty. Ngalamathuba imfazwe embi yayiqhubeka phakathi kwabasebukhosini belwela itrone. Ixesha leThree Kingdoms lelona kwabulawa abantu abaninzi ngalo kwimbali yeTshayina Yakudala, abantu abaninzi bafa belelwa ukuhlala kwesona sihlalo siphakamileyo kwibhotwe eliphezulu eXiâan.
mt: 1. China has a long history of recording events; one of the earliest Chinese dynasties was the Qin Dynasty. However, there are no records of the Qin Dynasty in the Three Kingdoms era. The Three Kingdoms era was overshadowed by the Han and Jin Dynasties. The Three Kingdoms era was marked by a lot of warfare between the various states. ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient Chinaâs history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xiâan.

src: Iimbovane zihamba zize zihlale kwiindawo zazo ngamaxesha ahlukileyo i. Ngexesha lokuzula, iimbhova zihambha ebusuku ziphumule emini. Kuqala ixesha lokufuduka kule ndawo xa ukutya kunciphile. Ngeli xesha, kuye kwenziwe iindlwana zethutyana eziye zitshintshwe yonke imihla. Ukumatsha ngakunye okanye uhamba olunobundlobongela kudla ngokuthatha malunga neentsuku eziyi-17.
mt: 17 days after the crash, the bodies were found in the wreckage. The first day of the search was at night, and the bodies were found in the morning. The bodies were then taken to the morgue.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Abanintsi baqaphela izingqi kwimbonakalo nakwizimbo ezithi zixhomekeke ikakhulu kubukho be saykile ezi endogenous nophuhliso lwazo kwixesha lwendalo. Isingqisho samaxesha ngamaxesha, ezingeyompendulo nje kwimiba yangaphandle yamaxesha athile, sele sibhalelwe izinto ezininzi eziphilayo, nee ibhaktiriya, ifungi, izityalo kunye nezilwanyana. Iiwotshi zebhayoloji zizenzela ii-oscillator eziza kuqhubeka nokuhamba zijikeleza mahala nokuba akukho zimpawu zangaphandle.
mt: 1. The brain is a complex organ that is composed of billions of neurons and glial cells. The neurons are the primary information-processing cells of the brain, and the glial cells provide support and nutrition, maintain homeostasis, form myelin, and modulate synaptic transmission. 2. The brain is divided into two hemispheres, which are connected by the corpus callosum. The hemispheres are further divided into four lobes: the frontal, parietal, occipital, and temporal lobes. 3. The brain is protected by the skull, which is composed of several bones that are fused together. The skull is lined with a layer of meninges, which are composed of three layers: the dura mater, arachnoid mater, and pia mater. 4. The brain is bathed in cerebrospinal fluid, which is produced by the choroid plexus and circulates throughout the ventricles and subarachnoid space. 5. The brain is connected to the spinal cord by the brainstem, which is composed of the medulla oblongata, pons, and midbrain. 6. The brain is connected to the rest of the body by the cranial nerves, which are composed of twelve pairs of nerves that exit the brain and innervate various structures in the head and neck. 7. The brain is composed of billions of neurons, which are the primary information-processing cells of the brain. Neurons are composed of a cell body, dendrites, and an axon. 8. The brain is composed of billions of glial cells, which provide support and nutrition, maintain homeostasis, form myelin, and modulate synaptic transmission. Glial cells are composed of astrocytes, oligodendrocytes, microglia, and ependymal cells. 9. The brain is composed of billions of synapses, which are the points of contact between neurons. Synapses are composed of a presynaptic terminal, synaptic cleft, and postsynaptic terminal. 10. The brain is composed of billions of neurotransmitters, which are chemicals that are released by neurons and bind to receptors on other neurons. Neurotransmitters are composed of acetylcholine, dopamine, serotonin, norepinephrine, and gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA).
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Ingqokelela yohlobo olunye lwezinto kummandla othile kuthiwa ngabemi bakhona. Xa bonke abantu befana ngokweempawu ezithile, oku kubizwa ngokuba yi-monomorphic. Xa abantu ngabanye beveza iintlobo ezohlukileyo zomkhwa othile kuthiwa ba-polymorphic.
mt: 1. The other half of the story is that the people who are affected are all male. When all the men are affected, it is called monomorphic. When the men and women are affected, it is called polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Ukhenketho lwabatyeleli olusekelwe kwindalo lutsala abantu abanomdla wokutyelela ngenjongo yokubuka indalo kuquka izityalo kunye nezilwanyana zasendle. Imizekelo yokwenzekayo esaythini iquka ukuzingela, ukuloba, ukufota, ukubukela iintaka, ukundwendwela kwiipaki nokufunda ngolwazi lwendalo. Umzekelo kukundwendwela, ufote kwaye ufunde nge organgatuangs e orneo.

ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: INtsasa nganye, abantu bashiya iidolophana zelizwe ezimotweni besiya kwiindawo zabo zokusebenza kwaye badlulwe kwabanye abadawo abasebenza kuyo yindawo abasandula ukuyishiya. Kule shuttle yothutho eguqukayo wonke umntu ngandlela thile uqhagamshelene, kunye nenkxaso, inkqubo yothutho esekwe kwiimoto zabucala. Isayensi ngoku ibonakalisa ukuba icarbon economy ithe ya dilodja kwi biosphere ukusuka kwenye yemo zayo ezizinzileyo ebexhasa ukuguquguquka koluntu kwiminyaka ezizigidi ezibini ezedlulayo.
mt: 1,000 people were evacuated from their homes and workplaces and taken to other workplaces. This shuttle was designed to carry all people at once, and the workplace was designed to be a carbon economy in the biosphere, which is now being converted to a carbon-free economy.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Iatom ingathathwa njengenye yesiseko se-matter. Yinto enobugocigoci kakhulu, ngokwemodel kaBohr eyenziwe yalula inenyukliyasi esembindini ejikelezwa zi-electrons, into ebufana neeplanethi ezijikeleza ilanga - jonga iFigure 1.1. I-nucleus inamalungu amabini - i-neutron kunye neeproton. IProtoni zine positive electric charge ngelixa I neutrons zingena charge. Ezi electrons zine ne-gative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Ngokombono zonke ikhompyutha ezisetyenziswayo kulemihla zixhomekeke ekudlalisweni ngolwazi olukhowudwe ngohlobo lwamanani ebinary. Inani eliyi-binary linganamanani amabini ukutsho oko 0 okanye 1, yaye la manani abizwa ngokuba zii-binary digits â okanye ii-bits xa zisetyenziswa kulwimi lokuquza ngeekhompyutha.
mt: 2011 was a year of binary, as the world celebrated the 10th anniversary of the World Wide Web. A binary digit is a bit, which can be either 0 or 1, and is used to represent numbers in computers.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: "Ii-blog zinokunceda ukuphucula ukubhala kwabafundi. Nangona abafundi besoloko besiza namava abo e-blog anegrama engatshongo khona, kunye nokungakwazi ukubhala amagama achanileyo, ukuba kwabantu abazakukufunda oko, kudla ngokuyitshintsha loo nto. Kuba abafundi bahlala bengabaphulaphuli abanento yokuthetha, umbhali webhlogi uqalisa ukusebenzela ukuphucula indlela yokubhala ukuze aphephe ukugxekwa. Kwakhona ukubhloga ""kunyanzela abafundi ukuba babe nolwazi ngakumbi malunga nehlabathi elibangqongileyo."" Isidingo sokondla umdla wabaphulaphuli siyabakhuthaza abafundi ukuba babe nobukrelekrele kwaye banomdla (Toto, 2004). Ukubhloga sisixhobo esikhuthaza intsebenziswano, kwaye kukhuthaza abafundi ukuba bandise ukufunda nangaphaya kwesiko lesiqhelo leskolo. Ukusetyenziswa ngokufanelekileyo kweeblogi ""kunokuxhobisa abafundi ukuba babe nohlalutyo ngakumbi kwaye bagxeke; ngokuphendula ngenkuthalo kwizixhobo ze-Intanethi, abafundi banokuchaza isikhundla sabo kwimeko yemibhalo yabanye kunye nokuchaza ezabo izimvo kwimicimbi ethile (Oravec, 2002)."

ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Unxibelelwano oluqhubekekayo lukhuthaza ixesha lokucinga kunye nokuphendula kwabanye. Ivumela abafundi ukuba bakwazi ukusebenza ngesantya abasifunayo baze balawule isantya semfundiso. Ukongezelela, kukho imiqathango yexesha kusenokwenzeka ukuba lona ixesha lokusebenza libe bhetyebhetye. (Bremer, 1998) Ukusetyenziswa kwe-Intanethi kwenza abafundi bakwazi ukufikelela kwinkcazelo ngamaxesha onke. Abafundi banagakwazi ukunikezela imibuzo kubafundisi nangeliphi na ixesha futhi balindele iimpendulo ezikhawulezileyo, kunoba balinde ukudibana ubuso ngobuso.
mt: 1. This is a collaborative learning environment that allows students to practice the skills they are learning. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet allows students to access information at any time. Students can ask questions of instructors and receive feedback, and they can practice skills in a step-by-step manner.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Ngokuqhelekileyo ngeli xesha, iKirby Muxloe castle yeyona ndlu inqatyisiweyo kunenqaba yokwenyani. Iifestile zayo ezirhuwkileyo namadonga ayo anciphileyo ebengenokwazi ukumela uhlaselo oluqinilileyo kangangexesha elide. Ngoo-1480, apho ulakhiwo kwayo laqalwa ngoo-Hastings, ilizwe belinoxolo kwaye nokhuselo belufane ludingeke nxamnye namaqelana abagulukuthu abazulayo.
mt: 1480, when it was built, Kirby Muxloe castle was a small, square, stone-built keep. It was built by Hastings, the earl of England, and was probably intended as a hunting lodge. It was destroyed by fire in 1480, and was never rebuilt.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Ngotshintsho lokubaleka ihafu usuka kwi kota yemayile, isantya siya singabaluleki kangako kwaye unyamezelo lusesona sidingo. Kakade iklasi yokuqala ihafu ye mayile, indoda enokubetha imizuzu emibini, makube kanti inesantya esifanelekileyo, kodwa unyamezelo kufuneka luhlakulwe kuzo zonke iingozi. Okunye ukubaleka i-cross country ngexesha lobusika, udibanise nokujima umzimba wangasentla, lulungiselelo olungileyo lokulungiselela ixesha lokubaleka.
mt: 1. The first class of the year, a girl who is pregnant, is absent. All absences must be reported. 2. A cross-country run is scheduled for tomorrow. Students must wear appropriate clothing and shoes. 3. A student who is absent from school must bring a note from his/her parent/guardian.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Ngotshintsho lokubaleka ihafu usuka kwi kota yemayile, isantya siya singabaluleki kangako kwaye unyamezelo lusesona sidingo. Okunye ukubaleka i-cross country ngexesha lobusika, udibanise nokujima umzimba wangasentla, lulungiselelo olungileyo lokulungiselela ixesha lokubaleka.
mt: 1. The first class of the year, a girl who is pregnant, is absent. All absences must be reported. 2. A cross-country run is scheduled for tomorrow. Students must wear appropriate clothing and shoes. 3. A student who is absent from school must bring a note from his/her parent/guardian.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: MRI ibhekiselele kummangaliso ee -hysics obizwa ngokuba yi-magnetic resonance( NMR), eyafunyaniswa ngo-1930 nguFelix Bloch( esebenza e Stanford University) no-Edward Purcell( waseHarvad University). Ekuhambeni kwamaza esandi, amaza ereyidiyo nawe-magnetic field, abangela ukuba ii-athomu zikhuphe iisignali zereyidiyo ezimbalwa. Ngonyaka ka-1970, uRaymond Damadian, ongugqirha nomphengululi wososayensi, wafumana isizathu sokusebezisa isithwebuli mifanekiso esingumazibuthe njengesixhobo sokuxilonga isigulo. Kwiminyaka emine ethubeni ubunini banikezwa, eyayibubunini bokuqala ukunikezwa kwical le MRI. Ngo-1977, uGq. Damadian wagqibebezela ukwakhiwa kwe âwhole-bodyâ MRI scanner, awayibiza ngokuba yiâindomitableâ.
mt: 1. MRI is a medical imaging technique used in radiology to visualize the anatomy and physiological processes of the body. MRI scanners were developed from knowledge gained in nuclear physics and electromagnetism developed earlier. In simple terms, MRI uses strong magnetic fields to align the magnetization of atoms within the body, and radio waves to manipulate the alignment. 2. MRI was developed in the 1970s at Stanford University by Paul Lauterbur and Peter Mansfield. 3. The first MRI scanner was built in 1977 by Dr. Raymond Damadian, who is also credited with coining the term âMRIâ. 4. MRI is used to image the body in order to diagnose and monitor disease. 5. ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first âwhole-bodyâ MRI scanner, which he called the âIndomitableâ.

src: Abantu yeyona ndalo inesiphiwo sokufunda iingqondo yabanye. Oko kuthetha ukuba siyakwazi ukuqikelela ngempumelelo ukuba oko abanye abantu abakuqondayo, abafuna ukukwenza, abakhukholelwayo, abakwazi nabakunqwenelayo. Phakathi kwezi zinto ukuqonda iinjongo zabanye kubalulekile. Kusivumela siqonde ukuphikisana kwezenzo. Ngokomzekelo, ukuba ubona umntu esophula ifestile yemoto, ubunokucinga ukuba uzama ukuyiba loo moto. Kwakuyakufuneka agwetywe ngokwahlukileyo ukuba ebelahle izitshixo zemoto yakhe yaye iyimoto yakhe lena wayezama ukuyiqhekeza.
mt: 1. People are different in their thinking. Some people are good, some are bad, some are smart, some are stupid. It is important to understand the intentions of others. It is important to understand the motives of others. If you see a person driving a car, you should not assume that you can steal that car. It is important to understand the intentions of others.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a strangerâs car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Nangona iAI inolinganiso olungeyonyani lwesayensi,I AI yenza isiseko esibalulekileyo kwicandelo lwekhompyutha sayensi ejongene nezimbo,ukufunda nobungqondi bomashini. Uphando kwi-AI lubandakanya ukwenza oomatshini abazenzekelayo imisebenzi efuna isimilo esikrelekrele. Imizekelo iquka ukulawula, ukuceba nokubeka ixesha, ukukwazi ukuphendula izinto zabathengi ezingalunganga nemibuzo, nokukwazi ukubona ukuba ibisisandla sikabani ebesibhala, ukwazi ukufanisa ilizwi nobuso. Izinto ezinjalo zibe ngamacandelo ahlukeneyo, ajolise ekunikezeleni izisombululo kwiingxaki zobomi bokwenyani. Inkqubo ye-AI ngoku ihlala isetyenziswa kumacandelo ezoqoqosho, amayeza, ubunjineli kunye nomkhosi, njengoko sele yakhiwe kwikhompyuter kunye nokusetyenziswa kwesoftware yomdlalo wevidiyo.

src: Ukusetyenziswa kwe-video nokurekhoda kwenzele ukufunywana okubalulekileyo ekqondeni iimbonakalo ezincinci zokutshintsha kobuso, iintshukumo zobuso ezithatha imizuzwananana embalwa. Ngokukhethekileyo, kuthiwa umntu angakwazi ukubona ukuba omnye umntu uyaxoka ngokwazi ukutolika kakuhle izinto eziboniswa bubuso bakhe. U-Oliver Sacks, kwiphepha lakhe i-The Presidentâs Speech, wabonisa ukuba abantu abangakwazi kuqonda intetho ngenxa yomonzakalo engqondweni bayakwazi ukufikelela enyanisweni ngokuchanileyo. Ude acebise ngelithi indlela yokwazi ukutolika izimbo zomntu isenokubakho nakwizilwanyana ezifana nenja zekhaya.
mt: 3D video and motion capture can be used to create realistic simulations of human movement, which can be used to train emergency personnel. It is said that a person can tell when another person is in pain by the way they move. Oliver Sacks, in his book The Presidentâs Speech, describes how people who are unable to read can still understand the meaning of a speech. He also points out that the way a person moves can tell you a lot about them, like a dogâs tail.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Njengokuba indlela yokufumana ulwazi nokufunda intshintshe ngolona hlobo oluphezulu oludlula indlela ulwazi elalifumaneka ngayo lutshintshile. Indlela yokufumana inkcazelo yayahlukile. Kwakungaseyo mfuneko yokuba umntu akhumbule, kodwa kwanikelwa ingqalelo ekukwazini ukukhumbula amagama. Ngokuyintloko, Imvuselelo yenza utshintsho olukhulu kwindlela yokujonga ukufunda kunye nendlela yokudlulisela ulwazi.
mt: 1. As the way of getting information and learning is changing, the way of getting information that is being learned is changing. The way of getting information is changing. It is not known if a person is remembering, but it is known that the way of remembering is changing. In general, the report makes a big change in the way of reading and the way of getting information.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: "I-Intanethi idibanisa ezizinto zombini kunye nobunxibelelwano phakathi kwabantu. Indlela ezicacileyo zobume be internethi zikhokhela kwamanye amazinga ngokwendlela yokuyisebenzisa nesimbo sokwaneliseka. Umzekelo, ""ukufunda"" kunye ""nokunxibelelana nabanye"" kucetyiswa njengezizathu ezibalulekileyo zokusetyenziswa kwe-Intanethi (UJames et al., 1995). ""Ukuzibandakanya"" kunye ""nobudlelwane obuqhubekayo"" zichongiwe njengezinto ezintsha ezikhuthazayo ngu-Eighmey kunye noMcCord (1998) xa baphanda iimpendulo zabaphulaphuli kwiiwebhusayithi."
mt: "The Internet is a place where two things happen and a relationship between people. The way in which the Internet is used is often misunderstood. For example, "reading" and "interacting with others" are often considered the main uses of the Internet (James et al., 1995). "Interacting" and "a meaningful relationship" are often considered the new and exciting uses of the Internet" (Eighmey and McCord, 1998) when people are asked about their use of the Internet.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, âlearningâ and âsocializationâ are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). âPersonal involvementâ and âcontinuing relationshipsâ were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Isimbo seGothic sifike kwithuba eliphakathi kwesentyhuri ye-10 ukuya kweye-11 kunye neye-14. Ekuqaleni ilokhwe phenjelelwa kakhulu yinkcubeko yaseByzantine empuma. Nangona kunjalo, ngenxa yamajelo onxibelelwano acothayo, izitayile entshona bezinokusalela ngasemva ngama-25 ukuya kuma-30 eminyaka. malunga nasekupheleni kwelixa le Middle Age I western Europe yaqalisa ukuzenzela esayo isimbo.Olona phuhliso lukhulu yeloxesha ngenxa yecrusade abantu baqalisa ukusebenzisa amaqhosha ekuqhosheni impahla.
mt: 10th to 11th century Gothic architecture was influenced by the Byzantine Empire. However, due to the Crusades, the population was decimated and the number of people was reduced to about 25 to 30 years. In the Middle Ages, the West of Europe began to use the Gothic style to build churches.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Ulinganiso lwamandla yayiyinkqubo ebifunwa zizizwe zase-Europe ukuze zigcine ubungangamsha bamazwe onke ase-Europe. Ingcamango yayikukuba onke amazwe seYurophu kwakufuneka ajonge indlela yokuthintela ilizwe elinye ukuba lebe namandla, ngoko oorhulumente babedla ngokutshintsha amahlakane awo ukuze oku kwenzeke. Imfazwe ye Spanish Succession yaphawula imfazwe yokuqala eyayinjongo zayo ikukulungelelanisa amagunya. Ke, iMfazwe yeminyaka engamashumi amathathu yayiya kuba yimfazwe yokugqibela eya kubizwa ngokuba yimfazwe yeenkolo.

ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Ngeli xesha kwimbali yase-Yurophu, Inkonzo yamaRoma Katoliae, eyade yanemali namandla, yajongwa ngeliso lesikrokro. Intloko yomthetho yecawa yayise-Roma iminyaka engapha kwewaka futhi noluxinzelelo lemali namandla yakrokrisa isininzi ukuba umgaqo siseko wakhe ebeqondile.
mt: 1,000 years ago, the Roman Catholic Church, which was powerful and wealthy, was divided by the schism of the East and West. src: Kwamsinya emva kokuqhambuka kwengxwabangxwaba, iBritani yaqalisa ukuvala ulwandlwe lwaseJamani isebenzisa umkhosi waselwandle. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: E-United States of America, kukho malunga nabantu abayi-400,000 abaziwayo Ukuba bane-Multiple Sclerosis (iMS), loo nto iyenza ibe sisigulo sengqondo esiphambili kubantu abadala abasebatsha nabsele beqinile. I-MS sisifo esichaphazela inkqubo ye-nervous system, eyenziwe ngengqondo, ithambo lomqolo kunye ne-optic nerve. Uphando lufumanise ukuba abantu ababhinqileyo amaxesha amabini kunokwenzeka ukuba babe ne-MS emva koko abangamadoda.
mt: 400,000 Americans are believed to have Multiple Sclerosis (MS), a disease that affects the central nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord and optic nerve. A new study suggests that people who have a family history of MS are twice as likely to develop the disease as those who don't.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Ukuhamba Kwemoto kukufunda ngokuhamba komqhubi ngamnye neemoto ukusuka kwenye indawo ukuya kwenye indawo nendlela abaqhubana ngayo omnye nomnye. Ngelishwa, ukufunda ukuphokoka komthamo wezithuthi kunzima kuba izimbo zomqhubi azikwazi kuthelekeleka ngokugqibeleleyo. Ngethamsanqa, abaqhubi badla ngokuziphatha kakuhle phakathi kuluhlu olufanelekileyo; Ke, imijelo yendlela ithambekele ekubeni nokungaguquguquki okufanelekileyo kwaye inokumelwa ngokwezibalo. Ukuba ngumeli ongcono wokuhamba kwetrafikhi, ubudlelwane busekiwe phakathi kweempawu ezintathu eziphambili: (1) ukuhamba, (2) uxinano, kunye (3) nesantya. Olu lwalamano lunceda ukucebeni, ukuyileni nasekusebenzeni kweendlela.
mt: 1. Driving is the act of operating a vehicle from a place to another place. 2. Steering is the act of controlling the direction of a vehicle. 3. Braking is the act of slowing or stopping a vehicle. 4. Parking is the act of placing a vehicle in a safe location. 5. Traffic is the act of moving vehicles from one place to another. 6. Traffic laws are the rules that govern the movement of vehicles on the road. 7. Traffic signs are the symbols that indicate the direction of traffic. 8. Traffic signals are the lights that indicate the direction of traffic. 9. Traffic rules are the laws that govern the movement of vehicles on the road. 10. Traffic violations are the acts that violate the traffic laws. 11. Traffic accidents are the incidents that occur when vehicles collide with each other. 12. Traffic congestion is the condition when vehicles are unable to move due to the high volume of traffic. 13. Traffic control is the act of managing the movement of vehicles on the road. 14. Traffic management is the act of planning and organizing the movement of vehicles on the road. 15. Traffic safety is the act of ensuring the safety of vehicles and their occupants. 16. Traffic enforcement is the act of enforcing the traffic laws. 17. Traffic education is the act of teaching the traffic laws to the public. 18. Traffic awareness is the act of being aware of the traffic laws. 19. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 20. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 21. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 22. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 23. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 24. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 25. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 26. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 27. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 28. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 29. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 30. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 31. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 32. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws. 33. Traffic etiquette is the act of following the traffic laws.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Uvavanyo lweHershey kunye noChase yenye yeengcebiso eziphambili zokuba iDNA yayiyinto yemfuza. U-Hershey no-Chase basebenzise ii-phages, okanye ii-virus, ukufaka i-DNA yabo kwintsholongwane. Benza iimvavanyo ezimbini zokumakisha nokuba yi-DNA kwipheji ene-radioactive phosphorus okanye iprotheni ye-phage enesalfure eqhumayo.
mt: The Hershey-Chase experiment was an experiment in molecular biology performed by Alfred Hershey and Martha Chase in 1952. The experiment demonstrated that DNA is the genetic material of the T2 bacteriophage. Hershey and Chase used two different methods to show that DNA was the genetic material of the T2 bacteriophage: the radioactive phosphorus method and the phage-salvage experiment.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Iibhokhwe kubonakala ngathi zeznziwa izilwanyana zasekhaya malunga neminyaka eyi-10Â 000 eyadlulayo kwiZagros Mountain eIran. Amasiko amandulo kunye nezizwe zaqala ukuzigcina ukuze bafikelele lula ebisini, iinwele, inyama kunye nezikhumba. Iibhokhwe zasekhaya zazidla ngokugcinwa zingumhlambi owawuzihambahambela ezindulini okanye nakuwaphi na amadlelo, zoluswe ngabelusi eyayisoloko ingabantwana okanye amatyendyana, afana nqwa nabelusi aba baziwayo. Ezindlela zokukhokhela zisasetyetziswa kakhulu nanamhlanje.
mt: 10,000-year-old skeletons of children and adults were found in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. The remains were buried with offerings of beads, shells, and animal bones. The skeletons were found in a cave, and the remains of children and infants were found in the cave's entrance. The remains were found by a team of archaeologists.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Igalufa ngumdlalo apho abadlali basebenzisa amaphini ukuze babethe ibhola iyokungena emngxunyeni. Imingxuma elishumi elinesibhozo iyadlalwa kumjikelo wokuqala, ngabadlali bedla ngokudlala kumngxuma wokuqala wekhosi bagqibe koweshumi elinesibhozo. Oyena mdlali obetha kambalwa, okanye odlale kambalwa, ukuze agqibe indebe unqobile. Umdlalo udlalelwa engceni, futhi nengca engase mgxunyeni ichetyiwe kwaye ibizwa uluhlaza.
mt: 1. A game where players use cards to determine the winner. The first card is drawn, and the player who draws the first card of the highest rank wins. If a player draws a card of the same rank as the first card, the player who drew the second card wins. If a player draws a card of a lower rank than the first card, the player who drew the first card wins. The game is played with a deck of 52 cards.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Eyona njongo iphambili yeNzululwazi kukufumanisa indlela ihlabathi elisebenza ngayo ngendlela yesayensi. Le ndlela ikhokela uninzi lophando lwenzululwazi. Ayiyodwanga nje, ukulinga , nolingo luvavanyo olusetyenziswa ukususa enye okanye oluninzi uqikelelo, kubuzwe imibuzo kwenziwe nengqwalasela ekhokhela uphando lwesayensi.
mt: 1. This is a way of thinking that the world uses to do science. This way of thinking is used to sort out one of many possibilities or to answer a question that is asked by a scientist.
ref: Scienceâs main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isnât alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Izitshingitshane zibetha kwindawo encinci kunezinye izaqhwithi ezinobungozi, kodwa zingatshabalalisa kwanto esendleleni yazo. Izitshingitshane zincothulaa imithi, zikrazula iibhodi kwizakhiwo, kwaye zigibisela iimoto esibhakabhakeni. Iipesenti ezimbini zezitshingitshane ezinobungozi zidla ngokuthatha ngaphezu kweeyure eziyi-3. Ezi zaqhwithi zikhulu ziba nemimoya enesantya esifikelela ukuya kutsho kwi-480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
mt: 2 of the 4 aircraft were damaged beyond repair. The other 2 were damaged in the crash. The 2 damaged beyond repair were written off at 3.5 times the speed of sound (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Abantu bebenza besebenzisa ii-lense zokwandisa ukubona kangangamawaka a eminyaka. Nangona , i-telescopes zokuqala eziyinene zenziwa e-Europe ekupheleni kwe 16th ye-century. Aba mabonakude basebenzisa indabaniselwano yee-lens ezimbini ukwenza izinto ezikude zibonakale zikufuphi kwaye zinkulu.
mt: 17th century European telescopes were the first large lenses used to see far away. The two lenses were used to make things appear closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as âHiraââ on the Mountain of âNoorâ (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammadâs spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Iindlela zewagoni zazisakhiwa eNgilani kwantlandlolo ukusukela kwinkulungwane ye-16. Nangona iinqwelo zazinamaplanga abekwe alala ngecala, zazivumela amahashe ukuba azirhuqe ngesantya esikhulu kwaye athathe imithwalo emikhulu kunakwindlela ekunzima ukuhamba kuzo zaloo mihla. IiCrossties zaziswa kwangoko ukuze zibambe iingoma endaweni yazo. Qho, nangona kunjalo, kwaqondwa ukuba imikhondo inokusebenza ngakumbi ukuba babephethe isinyithi ngaphezulu. Le yayiyinto eqhelekileyo, kodwa i-iron yayibangela ukunxiba ngaphezulu kwamavili eenqwelo. Ekugqibeleni, amavili eplanga athathelwa indawo ngawentsimbi. Ngo-1767, kwabakho iziporo zokuqala zentsimbi.
mt: 16th century road signs in England warned travelers of the dangers of the road. Although the signs were often ignored, they did warn of the dangers of the road. The first road signs were made of iron and were placed above the road. In 1767, the first road signs were made of wood.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.

src: I-Romanticism yayinento enkulu yokuchazwa kwenkcubeko, ethathwe kubabhali abanjengoGoethe, Fichte, noSchlegel. Kwimeko yeRomaism, iJografi yabumba abantu, kwaye ngokuhamba kwexesha amasiko kunye nenkcubeko enxulumene naloo geografi yavela, kwaye nezi, ngokuhambelana nendawo yoluntu, zazingcono kunemithetho emiselweyo.
mt: 19th century Romanticism was a major intellectual movement, associated with figures such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the Romantic era, geography was a popular subject, and as the discipline developed, it became more scientific and less literary, and more closely tied to the study of nature, and less to the study of man.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: Ukumiselwa kwetekhnoloji ligama elibandakanya izinto ezininzi kwimihla ngemihla, ukusuka kwitekhnoloji yokuqhubela phambili okanye ukubaluleka kwetekhnoloji ukuya kwisigqibo esingqongqo sokuba ikamva lomntu yimithetho yesayensi kunye nokubonakaliswa kwayo kwitekhnoloji. Isininzi sokukhutshelwa kokuzimisela ngokwezeteknoloji zohlulelana ngamacebo amabini: ukuba uphuhliso lweteknoloji ubuqu lulandela indlela engekhulu engapha kwezamasiko okanye isandla sezepolitiki, futhi ukuba itreknoloji nayo âineziphumoâ kwiintlanga ezizimeleyo, kunezi zichatshazelwe ngabantu. ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: Ngoku ngafani nezinye ii-primates, ii-hominids azisasebenzisi izandla ukuhamba okanye ukuthwala umthwalo okanye ukujinga emithini. Isandla kunye nonyawo lwetshimpanzi ziyafana ngokobude nobukhulu, into ebonisa ukuba iyasisebenzisa isandla ukuze ibambelele ngaso xa ihamba. Isandla somntu sikufutshane kunonyawo, sinamathambo ezilukhuni. IiFosili zamathambho ezandla aneminyaka engaku-2 yezigidi no-3 yezigidi zeminyaka iveza utshintsho ekufanelekeni kwesandla ukusuka ekuhambheni ukuya ekubambheni.
mt: Like other primates, hominids use their hands to walk, carry food or shelter, and climb. The ape hand is larger and more powerful than ours, suggesting it was used to move around rather than to carry things. Our hand is smaller and more dexterous, with a thumb that can be used to grasp and manipulate objects. Fossils of the earliest hominids date back 2 to 3 million years and show a hand that was evolving from a walking to a grasping hand.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

Isandla kunye nonyawo lwetshimpanzi ziyafana ngokobude nobukhulu, into ebonisa ukuba iyasisebenzisa isandla ukuze ibambelele ngaso xa ihamba. Isandla somntu sikufutshane kunonyawo, sinamathambo ezilukhuni. IiFosili zamathambho ezandla aneminyaka engaku-2 yezigidi no-3 yezigidi zeminyaka iveza utshintsho ekufanelekeni kwesandla ukusuka ekuhambheni ukuya ekubambheni.
mt: Like other primates, hominids use their hands to walk, carry food or shelter, and climb. The ape hand is larger and more powerful than ours, suggesting it was used to move around rather than to carry things. Our hand is smaller and more dexterous, with a thumb that can be used to grasp and manipulate objects. Fossils of the earliest hominids date back 2 to 3 million years and show a hand that was evolving from a walking to a grasping hand.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: Uphando lwenkulungwane yamashumi amabini lubonakalisile ukuba zibini iipokotho zokwahluka kwemfuzo: ezifihliweyo kunye nezivakalisiweyo. Ukutshintsha kofuzo kongeza ufuzo olwahlukahlukeneyo,ibe ukukhetha kuyikhupha kwipuli yezahlukahlukeneyo ezibonisiweyo. Ulwahlulo nendibaniselwano kuhlukuhla indidi ndidi ukuya emva naphambili phakathi kweepuli esohlulelana ngobudala.
mt: 2 of the 4 possible outcomes are known: a successful launch, and a failed launch. A successful launch increases the probability of a successful launch, while a failed launch decreases the probability of a successful launch. The probability of a successful launch is greater than the probability of a failed launch.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: "Kwindawo engamathafa, kunzima kunzima ngomntu Ukuba abekise iimfuno zakhe ze-amino-acid esebenzisa izityalo ezikhoyo. Ngapha koko, ekwenzeni njalo kunemiphumo emibi: ukukhula koxinzelelo, ukungondleki, kunye nokufa ekugqibeleni. Ezona zinto zifumaneka lula eziluncedo kwizityalo ziprotheyini ezifumaneka kumagqabi nakwii-legume, kodwa izinto okanye abantu abazityayo kunzima ukuba zicolwe yinkqubo yokucola yazo ngaphandle kokuba ziphekwe. Kwelinye icala, ukutya kwezilwanyane (iimbhovane, iintubi, amaqanda) kulula ukwehla, kwaye kuneezakhamzimbha zenqanaba eliphezulu eziphilisayo ezinazo zonkeÂ  ii-amino acids. Zonke izinto eziqwalaselweyo, akufuneki simangaliswe kukuba ookhokho bethu bayisombulule ""ingxaki yeprotheyini"" yabo ngendlela efanayo neetshimpi ezisentlango namhlanje."
mt: " In the absence of these essential amino acids, the body must manufacture them using nonessential amino acids. In this case, the body is forced to use alternative pathways: overproduction of hormones, overproduction of enzymes, and death from overproduction. These alternative pathways are also used by plants and legumes, but the products are not as nutritious as those produced by animals. In another example, the protein in vegetables (beans, peas, lentils) is more digestible, and contains all the essential amino acids. All of these examples, we are not saying that our bodies are "superior" to those of plants."
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Izithethe ezincinci zidibanisa abantu abacinga ngokufanayo baziva bengahoywanga yimigangatho yoluntu kwaye bayabavumela ukuba bakhulise ukuqonda kwesazisi. Izithethe ezincinci zingahluka ngenxa yobudala, ubuhlanga, udidi, indawo, kunye / okanye isini samalungu. Iimpawu ezichaza inkcubeko eyahlukileyo njengolwimi, ubuhle, inkolo, ezopolitiko, ezesondo, ezendawo, okanye indibaniselwano yezinto. Amalungu enkcubeko ahlala ebonakalisa ubulungu babo ngokusetyenziswa okwahlukileyo kunye nangokomfuziselo kwesitayile, kubandakanya ifashoni, indlela yokuziphatha, kunye nearot.

ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: Abantwana bangakwazi ukuqonda ubuhlanga nendlela uhlanga olujongwa ngayo besebancinci yaye ezi mbono ngohlanga zingachaphazela indlela abaziphatha ngayo. Umzekelo, abantwana bebala elithile elijongelwa phantsi kwezemfundo baqhele ukungenzi kakuhle esikolweni emva koba bevile.
mt: Children who do not understand the concept of race and how it is used in society may be confused by the way race is portrayed in the media. For example, children who see a black person in a position of authority may think that black people are in charge of the world.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: "Enye yeendlela eziqhelekileyo ezisetyenziswayo ukubonisa ukubaluleka kokudibana kwabantu kukuthatha imzekelo embalwa weeimeko zelishwa apho abantwana baye abahoywa, intlekele, okanye baphathwa gadalala ngabom, bangadityansiwa nabanye abantu ngabantu abadalan ngelixa besakhula. Aba bantwana babizwa ngokuba yi ""feral"" okanye ngabasendle. Abanye abantwana bendalo bavalelwe ngabantu (ngesiqhelo ngabazali babo); Kwezinye iimeko ukushiywa komntwana kwakubangelwa kukungamkelwa kwabazali ukukhubazeka kwengqondo okuqatha okanye ukukhubazeka komzimba. Abantwana abaphatheke kakubi kusenokwenzeka ukuba baye bahlukunyezwa kakhulu ngaphambi kokuba balahlwe okanye babaleke. Abanye batyholwa ngokukhuliswa zizilwanyana; abanye kuthiwa bebehlala bodwa endle. Xa ekhuliswe zizilwanyanyana ezingemntu, umntana uye abonakalise imikhwa( enqandwa ngumzimba) efana twatse nesilwanyana ebesimkhathalela, njengezinto ezisoyikayo, nokungohluleli abantu."

ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: Ulimo lokuphila lulimo olwenziwa ngenjongo zokuphuhlisa ukutya okwaneleyo ukuze konele izidingo zomlimi nekhaya lakhe. Ulimo lokuphila lulula, oludla ngokusebenzisa izichumisi, nesystem ezigciniweyo zembewu efumaneka kummandla edityaniswa nokujikelezisa udidi lwesityalo okanye naluphi na uhlobo ulwandisa isivuno. Ngokwembali uninzi lwamafama lwaluzibandakanya kwezolimo ngenjongo zokuphila kwaye oku kusenjalo kumazwe amaninzi asakhasayo.
mt: 1. The purpose of this life is to feed the body to maintain the health of the body and the home. The life of the body is a life that uses tools, a system of artificial limbs, and a device that can be used to diagnose or treat a disease. In return, the body is healthy and the country is healthy.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Mhlawumbi olona hlobo luxhaphakileyo lokukhenketha lolu abantu abaninzi baloyamanisa nohambo: i-Recreation tourisim. Kulapho abantu bavele baye kwindawo eyohluke lee kuna le bayiqhelileyo smahla bayokhululeka bonwabe. Amalwandle, iipaki neendawo zokukhempisha zezona ndawo zixhatshakelwa ngabakhenkethi. Ukuba isizathu sokutyelela kwindawo ethile kukufuna ukwazi imbali nesithethe sayo, olu hlobo lokhenketho lwaziwa ngokuba yi-cultural tourism. Abakhenkethi banokutyelela iindawo ezibangela umdla ezahlukahlukeneyo zelizwe okanye basenokukhetha ukuya nje kwindawo enye.
mt: 1. The recreation tourism industry is growing. In some places, people are being forced to leave their homes and businesses. The land, buildings and businesses are being destroyed by the invaders. If you want to know more about this, this type of tourism is called cultural tourism. The invaders are destroying the land, buildings and businesses.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of oneâs visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: Abantu abathathe inxaxheba kumashumi eminyaka basinceda ukuba sizixabise izinto esizenza kakuhle kunye neminqweno yethu ngoxa sivavanya izinto ezinzima kunye nalapho singaqhubi kakuhle khona. Ngoxa besimamele amabali abantu obuqu, eentsapho kunye nawentlangano, siye safumana ukuqonda ngembali kunye nendlela abanye abantu abaye baphembelela ngayo indlela esebenza ngayo intlangano enoba kakuhle okanye kakube. Xa uyiqonda imbali yomntu oko akuthethi ukuba uyayiqonda inkcubeko yakhe, kodwa iyabanceda abantu bafumane ukuqonda apho kukhona ukushota kwimbali yombutho. Ngoxa ehlola ukuphumelela aze abone nalapho kusilelwe khona, umntu ngamnye nabantu bonke abanenxaxheba xa bedibene baye beyiqonda kangumbi imigaqo, izinto ezifuna ukwenziwa nezinto eziqhuba inkampani. Kweli xesha, ukukhumbula kumaxa angaphambili emikhwa yoshishino enemiphumela kwimpumelelo yanceda abantu ukuba bavumele utshintsho banike nomkhomba Ndlela kwibandla elisekuhlaleni. Loo mabali ayimpumelelo ayakunciphisa ukoyika utshintsho, ngelixa edala ingcingane ezakhaya kwimo yotshintsho.

ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding oneâs history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: Abantu abathathe inxaxheba kumashumi eminyaka basinceda ukuba sizixabise izinto esizenza kakuhle kunye neminqweno yethu ngoxa sivavanya izinto ezinzima kunye nalapho singaqhubi kakuhle khona. Ngoxa besimamele amabali abantu obuqu, eentsapho kunye nawentlangano, siye safumana ukuqonda ngembali kunye nendlela abanye abantu abaye baphembelela ngayo indlela esebenza ngayo intlangano enoba kakuhle okanye kakube. Xa uyiqonda imbali yomntu oko akuthethi ukuba uyayiqonda inkcubeko yakhe, kodwa iyabanceda abantu bafumane ukuqonda apho kukhona ukushota kwimbali yombutho. Ngoxa ehlola ukuphumelela aze abone nalapho kusilelwe khona, umntu ngamnye nabantu bonke abanenxaxheba xa bedibene baye beyiqonda kangumbi imigaqo, izinto ezifuna ukwenziwa nezinto eziqhuba inkampani. Kweli xesha, ukukhumbula kumaxa angaphambili emikhwa yoshishino enemiphumela kwimpumelelo yanceda abantu ukuba bavumele utshintsho banike nomkhomba Ndlela kwibandla elisekuhlaleni. src: Indlela yokufunda esemva inika inkululeko kwimilinganiselo. Akukho ndlela inye ilungileyo yokufunda. Enyanisweni, akukho nanye into entle onokuyifunda. Ukufunda kubakho phakathi komfundi kunye nento efundiswayo. Amava esinawo ngezi zinto zithi zenzele ngokwakho, nenkcazelo edluliselwayo, ukufunda ngokubukela umabonakude kubonisa kanye le ngongoma. Baninzi kuthi abazibona bebukele inkqubo kamabonakude esibonisa ngeenkqubo okanye izinto esingasoze sizenze okanye ulwazi esingasoze silusebenzise. Asoze siyiqale phantsi injini yemoto, sakhe umthombo emva kwendlu yethu, sityelele ePeru ukuze siyokubona amabhodlo akudla, okanye silungise indlu yommelwane.

ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: Ukuphamzamiseka kokulala yindlela yokuphaphama nngethuba lakho lokulala oluqhelekileyo uphinde ulale ngokukhawuleza emizuzwini eyi (10-60 ). Oku kunokwenziwa ngokulula ngokusebenzisa iwotshi ye-alamu ethe cwaka ukuzisa ezingqondweni ngaphandle kokukuvusa ngokupheleleyo. Ukuba ufumanisa ukuba umane ulicima ixesha xa likuvusa, inokubekwa kwelinye icala leumbi, inyanzelise ukuba uphume ebhedini ukuze uyicime. Ezinye i biorhythm-based options ziquka ukusela amanzi kakhulu (ikakhulu amanzi okanye iti, eyaziwa nje ngeyeza lokhama amanzi emzimbeni) phambi kokulala, inyanzelise ukuba ubani aphakame aye kuchama.
mt: 10-60 minutes of sleep deprivation can be achieved by lying on a bed tilted at an angle (10-60 degrees). This is achieved by lying on a bed tilted at an angle (10-60 degrees). If you wake up and find yourself unable to fall asleep, a second alarm is set to go off in 15 minutes to give you time to fall asleep. Other biorhythm-based options include drinking a lot of water (a lot of water or a lot of water) before going to bed, which is known as the water clock in the water clock.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10â60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Abanye abantu bakholelwa ukuba ukuphupha kakhuluamaphupha enziwe ngabantu kuyadinisa. Esona sizathu siphambili sale nto sisiphumo samaphupha amnandi okwandisa ubude bexesha phakathi kwe-REM. Xa ufikelela inqanaba le-REM kambalwa qho ulala ebusuku, eli nqanaba apho ulala yoyi khona aze umzimba wakho ahlaziyeke liba mbalwa kakhulu kude kube yingxaki oko. Oku kudinisa ngokufanayo xa ubunokuvuka qho emva kwemizuzu engamashumi amabini okanye amathathu uze ubukele i-TV. Ukukuchaphazela kwayo kuxhomekeke kwisiqhelo sengqondo sokuzama ukuphupha uzilawula ephupheni ngobusuku.
mt: 1. Some people are allergic to dusts created by humans. REM sleep is the most important sleep phase. When you wake up in the morning, your body is already in REM sleep. If you wake up in the middle of REM sleep, your body will be very tired. This is why you feel tired when you wake up in the middle of the night. It is recommended to sleep with the TV off.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true âinvisible teamâ (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The âinvisible teamâ is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: Ithiyori zomxholo zijolise ekufumaneni into eyenza abantu babeke uphawu okanye babhenele kubo. Ezi theory zicebisa ukuthi abantu banezidingo ezithile okanye ulangazelelo oluye lwagcinwa lingaphakathi njengoko umntu ekhula. Ezi ngcingane zijonga ukuba yintoni eyenza abantu abathile benze izinto abazenzayo yaye ziziphi izinto kwindawo abahlala kuyo ezibenza benze izinto ezithile. Iithiyori ezimbini ezidumileyo zii-Themous's Hierarchy of Needs Theory kunye ne-Herzberg's Two Factor Theory.
mt: 1. Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: Umthetho osetyenziswa kakubi nogxekwa kakhulu wesithathum sisikhokhelo esilula sokwenza ukutshintshatshintsha ngoxa sigcana ulungelelwano kumfanekiso. Ithi eyona ndawo isebenzayo kwesisihloko siphambili kukudibana kwemigca eyahlula umfanekiso ube ngowesithathu ngokuthe nkqo nangokuthe tye (jonga umzekelo).
mt: 3D printing is used to create a complex part that would be difficult to manufacture using traditional methods. This is one of the first 3D printed parts to be used in a flight test, and it is the third such part to be used in a flight test (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: Umzekelo, owona mfanekiso uqhelekileyo wokufotwa komhlaba ngowama-35mm, owawungowona ubungakanani befilimu obubalaseleyo ekupheleni kwexesha lefilimu ye-analog. Isenziwa nanamhlanje, kodwa ke okubalulekileyo kukuba iratio yayo yathatyathwa yi-digital camera image sensor format. Intlobo ye-35 mm yazi, ithanda ubhida, 36 mm ukuxwesa ngo-24 mm ubude. Ifomathi yale reyshiyo (ukwahlulahlula ngeshumi elinesibini ukuze ufumane ireyshiyo yenombolo epheleleyo elula) kuthiwa ngu-3:2. Iifomathi ezininzi eziqhelekileyo (usapho lweefomathi ze-APS, umzekelo) zilingana okanye ziqikelela kufutshane lo mlinganiso.
mt: 35mm film, the standard format for analog movie cameras, is now also the standard format for digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm film frame (which is actually 36mm wide by 24mm high) is said to be 3:2. Other formats (e.g. APS) may or may not conform to this aspect ratio.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: IMysticism kuleqe ubudlelane no, ukuzazisa ku, okanye ukuqonda ngengqiqo obona bunyani, ubumoya, inyaniso yokomoya, okanye uThixo. Okholelwayo udinga ukuzibonela, ukuzicingela, okanye ukubona iinyani zendalo ezimsulwa/isithixo okanye izthixo. Abalandeli baphila ngendlela ethile, okanye benza izinto ezenzelwe ukugcina loo mava. Ukufuna ulwazi ngeendlela ezintsokothileyo kwahlulwa kwezinye iintlobo zoluqulo ngokugxininisa amava obuqu okuzazi ingakumbi ukuba seluxolweni, ukuqonda, ulonwabo okanye umntu ovuyayo.

ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.
