As a winner-takes-all state, Florida awarded all fifty of its delegates to Romney, pushing him ahead as the front-runner for the Republican Party nomination.

src: "Owayesakuba nguSomlomo weNdlu uNewt Gingrich, irhuluneli yaseTexas uRick Perry, kunye noMongameli Congress Michele Bachmann bagqiba kwindawo yesine, yesihlanu, neyesithandathu ngokwahlukeneyo. Emva kokuba iziphumo zingenile, uGingrich wayincoma iSantorum, kodwa wayenegama elinzima kuRomney, egameni lakhe izibhengezo ezimbi ezazisasazwa eIowa ngokuchasene neGingrich. U-Perry uye wathi uza ""kubuyela eTexas ukuze avavanye iziphumo ze-caucus yanamhlanje ebusuku, ukuze azibonele ukuba ingaba ikhona na indlela eya phambili kolu gqatso"", kodwa kamva wathi uza kuhlala elugqatsweni aze akhuphisane ngoJanuwari 21 eSouth Carolina yamabanga aphantsi. UBachmann, ophumelele i-Ames Straw Poll ngo-Agasti, wagqiba kwelokuba aliphelise iphulo lakhe."
mt: 2012 Republican presidential hopefuls Newt Gingrich, Texas Governor Rick Perry, and Congresswoman Michele Bachmann all dropped out of the race, one by one, on Tuesday. After the results were in, Gingrich beat Santorum, but lost to Romney, who won the Iowa caucuses by a landslide. Perry said he was "going back to Texas to vote in the caucus tonight, to see if there's a clear path forward in this race," but then said he would be in South Carolina on January 21. Bachmann, who won the Ames Straw Poll in August, dropped out after her campaign failed to gain traction.
ref: "Former House Speaker Newt Gingrich, Texas governor Rick Perry, and Congresswoman Michele Bachmann finished in fourth, fifth, and sixth place, respectively. After the results came in, Gingrich lauded Santorum, but had tough words for Romney, on whose behalf negative campaign advertisements were aired in Iowa against Gingrich. Perry stated that he would ""return to Texas to assess the results of tonight's caucus, determine whether there is a path forward for myself in this race"", but later said that he would remain in the race and compete in the January 21 South Carolina primary. Bachmann, who won the Ames Straw Poll in August, decided to end her campaign."

src: "Iwebhusayithi yesikhululo ichaza umboniso ""njengethiyetha yesikolo esidala enojikelezo olutshatsha nenengcwangu!"" Kwintsuku zokuqala umfanekiso waboniswa kwisitishi iToginet Radio esebenza njenge-internet radio ejolise kwintetho. Ekupheleni kuka-2015, uTogiNet wavula iAstroNet Radio njengesitishi esongezelelweyo. Umboniso ebekade esebenzisana i-amateur ezingabadlali bamazwi, jikelele ukuya kwimpuma ye-Texas."
mt: 2015, TogiNet launched AstroNet Radio as its first internet radio station. The station is operated by a group of amateur radio enthusiasts, including the Texas Star Party.
ref: "The station's web site describes the show as ""old school radio theater with a new and outrageous geeky spin!"" In its early days, the show was featured solely at the long-running internet radio site TogiNet Radio, a site focused on talk radio. In late 2015, TogiNet established AstroNet Radio as a subsidiary station. The show originally featured amateur voice actors, local to East Texas."

src: Abahlaseli base Mumbai bafika ngesikhitshane no Novemba 26,2008 bephethe iziqhushumbisi, izixhobo eziqubulisayo baze babetha ithagethi kuquka nezihlwele kwisitrishi I Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus nedumileyo i Taj Mahal Hotel. Ukukhangelwa kukaDavid Headley kunye nokuqokelelwa kolwazi kuncede ukwenza umsebenzi ngoonogada abali-10 kwiqela lamajoni asePakistan iLaskhar-e-Taiba. Olu hlaselo lwenza kubekho ubunzima kubudlelwane obukhathi kweIndiya nePakistan.
mt: 26 November, 2008 attacks in Mumbai, India, were carried out by 10 Pakistani terrorists from the Pakistan-based militant group Lashkar-e-Taiba. The attacks killed 164 people and wounded 308 others. The attacks began on 26 November 2008 when 10 members of Lashkar-e-Taiba, a Pakistan-based militant group, attacked 10 targets in Mumbai using small arms and explosives. The attacks lasted three days, ending on 28 November 2008. The attacks were investigated by the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Central Bureau of Investigation. The investigation led to the arrest of David Headley, an American citizen of Pakistani descent, and the indictment of seven other men for their roles in the attacks. Headley pleaded guilty to the charges against him and agreed to cooperate with the FBI in their investigation of the attacks. The attacks were the deadliest terrorist attacks in India since the 2001 Parliament attack.
ref: The Mumbai attackers arrived via boat on Novemeber 26, 2008, bringing with them grenades, automatic weapons and hit multiple targets including the crowded Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus railway station and the famous Taj Mahal Hotel. David Headley's scouting and information gathering had helped to enable the operation by the 10 gunmen from the Pakistani militant group Laskhar-e-Taiba. The attack put a huge strain on relations between India and Pakistan.

src: "Irekhodi kaNadal xa edlala nalo waseCanada ngu- 7-2. Usanda koyiswa nguRaonic kwiBrisbane Open. UNadal ufumene amanqaku ayi-88% kumdlalo, ephumelela ngamanqaku ayi-76 kwi-serve yokuqala. mt: 7-2 in the first set. Raonic wins the Brisbane Open. Nadal won 88% of the points in the match, serving at 76%. After the match, King of Clay said ""I'm very happy to win this important match. I'm also happy to win this match."""
ref: "Nadal's head to head record against the Canadian is 7â2. He recently lost against Raonic in the Brisbane Open. Nadal bagged 88% net points in the match winning 76 points in the first serve. After the match, King of Clay said, ""I am just excited about being back in the final rounds of the most important events. I am here to try to win this."""

src: Kwiveki ephelileyo , iNaked News ibhengeze ukuba iza kuyandisa ngokungxamileyo imbopheleleko yeelwimi zehlabathi yokunikeza ingxelo yendaba, ngokusasaza okuthathu okutsha. Sebexela ngesi-Ngesi nesi-Japan, inkonzo yezwe lonke iqalisa i-Sipanish, isiTaliyani, neemfundiso zolwimi lama-Korea, ezikamabona kude, i-web neminxeba.
mt: 2010, Naked News began broadcasting in English and Japanese, with a global audience in Spanish, Italian, and Korean, and a web and mobile presence.
ref: Last week, Naked News announced that it would dramatically increase its international language mandate to news reporting, with three new broadcasts. Already reporting in English and Japanese, the global organization is launching Spanish, Italian, and Korean-language programs, for television, the web, and mobile devices.

src: Ngaphandle kwe-iventi yangoLwesithathu, uCarpanedo wakhuphisana kwimidyarho yeeNtshatsheli. Eyokuqala yakhe yayiSlalom, apho wafumana AWUGQIBANGA kumtyibilizo wakhe wokuqala. Abadlali abayi-36 kwabayi-116 nabo bafumana iziphumo ezifanayo kula mtyibilizi. Olunye ugqatso lakhe, iGalant Slalom, yambona egqiba kwindawo yeshumi kwiqela labafazi elihleliyo kunye nexesha lokubaleka elidibeneyo le-4: 41.30, 2: 11.60 imizuzu ecothayo kunendawo yokuqala yokugqiba iAustria uClaudia Loesch kunye nemizuzu eyi-1: 09.02 kancinci kunendawo yesithoba Kugqitywe uGyÃ¶ngyi Dani waseHungary. Ii-skiers ezine kwiqela lamanina elihleliyo loyisakele ukugqibezela ithuba lalo, kwaye abayi 45 kwi 117 skiers kwi Giant Salom boyisiwe ukuphumelela kwimbaleko.
mt: 1. Carpanedo won the first event, the Slalom, where he won the first race. The first 36 of the 116 skiers won similar prizes. His other race, the Galant Slalom, won the 4th place in the women's category with a time of 4: 41.30, 2: 11.60 in the first race, 2nd place in the first race in Austria, Claudia Loesch and a time of 1: 09.02 in the second race, GyÃ¶ngyi Dani of Hungary. The 45 of the 117 skiers in the Giant Salom race were able to complete the race.
ref: Beyond Wednesday's event, Carpanedo competed in two individual races at the Championships. Her first was the Slalom, where she earned a Did Not Finish in her first run. 36 of the 116 competitors had the same result in that race. Her other race, the Giant Slalom, saw her finish in tenth in the women's sitting group with a combined run time of 4:41.30, 2:11.60 minutes slower than first place finisher Austrian Claudia Loesch and 1:09.02 minutes slower than the ninth place finisher GyÃ¶ngyi Dani of Hungary. Four skiers in the women's sitting group failed to finish their runs, and 45 of the 117 total skiers in the Giant Slalom failed to rank in the race.

src: Ngolwesithathu, i-United States' National Basketball Association (NBA) irhoxise umdlalo wayo webasket ball wesizini ngenxa yenkxalabo ze COVID-19. Isinqumo se-NBA silandela umdlali we-jazz wase-Utah ofumanekiswe uba unesifo se-COVID-19.
mt: 3, the National Basketball Association (NBA) announced the postponement of its season due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The NBA player was diagnosed with COVID-19.
ref: On Wednesday, the United States' National Basketball Association (NBA) suspended its professional basketball season due to concerns regarding COVID-19. The NBA's decision followed a Utah Jazz player testing positive for the COVID-19 virus.

src: Ngolwesithathu, i-United States' National Basketball Association (NBA) irhoxise umdlalo wayo webasket ball wesizini ngenxa yenkxalabo ze COVID-19. Isinqumo se-NBA silandela umdlali we-jazz wase-Utah ofumanekiswe uba unesifo se-COVID-19.
mt: 3, the National Basketball Association (NBA) announced the postponement of its season due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The NBA player was diagnosed with COVID-19.
ref: On Wednesday, the United States' National Basketball Association (NBA) suspended its professional basketball season due to concerns regarding COVID-19. The NBA's decision followed a Utah Jazz player testing positive for the COVID-19 virus.

src: Namhlanje Umdlali Wosuku nguAlex Ovechkin odlalela iWashington Capitals. Ufumene amanqaku amabini wancedisa kwamabini xa i Washington iphumelele ngo-5-3 kwi-Atlanta Thrashers. Ukuncedisa kokuqala kuka-Ovechkin ngobabusuku kwabalinqaku lokuphumelela umdlalo lomdlali oselula u-Nicklas Backstrom; Inqaku lakhe lobusuku yaba yisizini yakhe ye 60th, ebangumdlali wokuqala ukukorisha amanqaku ayi 60 nangaphezulu kwisizini ukususela ngomnyaka ka 1995-96, apho u Jaromir Jagr no Mario Lemieux ngamnye wathi wafikelela kwelonqanaba.
mt: 2nd star of the night for the Washington Capitals was Alex Ovechkin. He scored his 2nd goal of the game in the 3rd period to give the Capitals a 5-3 win over the Atlanta Thrashers. Ovechkin's 2nd goal of the night was his 60th goal of the season, the 2nd fastest to reach 60 goals since the 1995-96 season, when Jaromir Jagr and Mario Lemieux did it in the same season.
ref: Today's Player of the Day is Alex Ovechkin of the Washington Capitals. He had 2 goals and 2 assists in Washington's 5-3 win over the Atlanta Thrashers. Ovechkin's first assist of the night was on the game-winning goal by rookie Nicklas Backstrom; his second goal of the night was his 60th of the season, becoming the first player to score 60 or more goals in a season since 1995-96, when Jaromir Jagr and Mario Lemieux each reached that milestone.

src: Ibhanki yaseNorth Rock yathathwa ngurhulumente ngo-2008 emva kokudizwa kwenkcazelo yokuba inkampani ifumene inkxaso kuRhulumente wase UK. I-Northern Rock yayifuna inkxaso ngenxa yokuvezwa kwayo ngexesha lwengxabangxaba lwemali mboleko yezindlu ngo-2007. I-Virgin Group iqela leenkampani zika-Sir Rachard Branson liye lakhatywa xa belifaka isicelo sokuthenga ibhanki ngaphambi kkuba ithathwe ngurhulumente. Ngo-2010, ngelixa ibekwa kuzwelonke, ibhanki yangoku ekwisitalato seHigh Stree eNorth Rock plc iye yahlulwa 'kwibhanki embi', iNorthern Rock Rock (i-Asset Management.) I-Virgin ithenge kuphela iâgood bankâ yaseNorthern Rock, hayi inkampani ye-asset management.
mt: 2008, the bank was nationalised after being bailed out by the UK government. The Northern Rock bank was bailed out in 2007 after a run on its deposits. The Virgin Group, owned by Sir Richard Branson, was one of the bidders for the bank before it was nationalised. In 2010, when the bank was sold off, the Northern Rock bank was sold as a âgood bankâ, not the asset management company.
ref: The Northern Rock bank had been nationalised in 2008 following the revelation that the company had received emergency support from the UK Government. Northern Rock had required support due to its exposure during the subprime mortgage crisis in 2007. Sir Richard Branson's Virgin Group had a bid for the bank rejected prior to the bankâs nationalisation. In 2010, while nationalised, the current high street bank Northern Rock plc was split from the âbad bankâ, Northern Rock (Asset Management). Virgin have only purchased the âgood bankâ of Northern Rock, not the asset management company.

src: Isigqibo sika Mnu. Rudd sokutyikitya isivumelwano semozulu yaseKyoto siyayohlula iMelika, eya kuthi ngoku ibe yiyo kuphela kwesizwe esiphuhlileyo esingasiqinisekisiyo isivumelwano. Urhulumente wangaphambili wase-Australia wolondolozo walile ukwamkela i-Kyoto, esithi iza konakalisa uqoqosho ngenxa yokuba eli lizwe lixhomekeke kakhulu kuthumelo lwamalahle kumazwe angaphandle, ngelixa amazwe afana ne-India kunye ne-China ayengabotshelelwanga ziithagethi zokukhupha Umoya ongcolileyo.
mt: Mr. Rudd's rejection of the Kyoto Protocol is the first by a major industrialized nation. Australia's previous government had signed the treaty, but said it would not be able to meet its targets because of its heavy reliance on coal for energy, as well as the emissions of other countries such as India and China.
ref: Mr. Rudd's decision to sign the Kyoto climate accord isolates the United States, which will now be the only developed nation not to ratify the agreement. Australia's former conservative government refused to ratify Kyoto, saying it would damage the economy with its heavy reliance on coal exports, while countries like India and China were not bound by emissions targets.

Australia's former conservative government refused to ratify Kyoto, saying it would damage the economy with its heavy reliance on coal exports, while countries like India and China were not bound by emissions targets.

src: Abadubuli kwityala elongezelelekileyo lokulawulwa kwezinambuzane babeza kubekwa esweni ngokuthe qatha ngabagcini, njengoko ityala lalibekwe esweni kwaye ukusebenza kwalo kuvavanywa. Ngokubambisana kwe-NPWS kunye noMbutho wabaDubuli bezeMidlalo e-Australia (NSW) Inc, amavolontiya afanelekileyo athathwa, phantsi kwenkqubo yokuzingela yoMbutho weSporting Shooter. Ngokutsho kukaMick O'Flynn, iDirector ebambeleyo ePark Conservation and Heritage eNPWS, abadubuli abane bokuqala abaye bachongelwa ukudubula baye bafumana imiyalelo epheleleyo yezokhuseleko noqeqesho.
mt: 1. The NPWS and NSW Sporting Shooters Association (SSA) have agreed to a joint program to control feral pigs in the park. The program will be conducted by SSA volunteers, under the auspices of the NSW Sporting Shooter. 2. Mick O'Flynn, Director of Park Conservation and Heritage at NPWS, said the first group of shooters had been trained and would be issued with permits to shoot feral pigs.
ref: Shooters in the supplementary pest control trial were to be closely supervised by rangers, as the trial was monitored and its effectiveness evaluated. In a partnership of NPWS and the Sporting Shooters Association of Australia (NSW) Inc, qualified volunteers were recruited, under the Sporting Shooters Association's hunting program. According to Mick O'Flynn, the Acting Director Park Conservation and Heritage with the NPWS, the four shooters selected for the first shooting operation received comprehensive safety and training instruction.

src: """Ngokwale fossile, ithetha ukuthi uqhekeko lwalukho kwangoko kunobekucingelwa bubungqina bemolecule. Ithetha ukuthi yonke into kufuneka ibuyiselwe,"" umva kwatsho umphandi e-Rift Valley Research Service e-Ethiopia noyi co-author yesifundo, Berhane Asfaw."
mt: """In a fossil, it says that the animal was a carnivore. It says that everything should be eaten,"" said the study's co-author, Berhane Asfaw, of the Rift Valley Research Service in Ethiopia."""
ref: """Based on this fossil, that means the split is much earlier than has been anticipated by the molecular evidence. That means everything has to be put back,"" said researcher at the Rift Valley Research Service in Ethiopia and a co-author of the study, Berhane Asfaw."

src: Kwintetho ephambili yangoLwesine yeTokyo Game Show, uMongameli weNintendo uSatoru Iwata watyhila uyilo lolawulo lwenkampani entsha yeNintendo Revolution. Efana ne-remote yomabonwakude, i-controlla isebenzisa ii-sensor ezimbhini ezibekwe kufuphi nomabonakude womntu ukuveza ukuma kwayo kwisithuba sobukhulu besithathu. Oku kuyakuvumela abadlali ukuba balawule iintshukumo kunye nentshukumo kwimidlalo yevidiyo ngokuhambisa isixhobo emoyeni.
mt: 2nd day of the Tokyo Game Show, Nintendo president Satoru Iwata unveiled the new Nintendo Revolution controller. The remote uses infrared sensors placed around the player to track the player's movements. This allows the player to interact with the game in a more realistic way.
ref: At Thursday's keynote presentation of the Tokyo Game Show, Nintendo president Satoru Iwata unveiled the controller design for the company's new Nintendo Revolution console. Resembling a television remote, the controller uses two sensors placed near the user's television to triangulate its position in three-dimensional space. This will allow players to control actions and movements in video games by moving the device through the air.

src: Ngaphambilana i-arhente yeendaba yaseTshayina iXinhua inikezele ingxelo ngenqwelomoya eza kuphangwa. Ingxelo zamva zachaza ukuba inqwelomoya yafumana isoyikiso sesiqhushumbisi yajikwa ukubuyela umva e Afghanistan, yahlala eKandahar. Iingxelo zakwangoko zithi inqwelomoya yabuyela eAfghanistan emva kokuba ingavunyelwanga ukuba ilende ngokungxamisekileyo ukufika e-Urmqi.
mt: In a previous report, Chinese state media Xinhua reported that the plane was carrying a cargo of military supplies to Afghanistan, and was en route to Kandahar. The report said the plane was returning to Urumqi after being diverted due to bad weather.
ref: Earlier the Chinese news agency Xinhua reported a plane to be hijacked. Later reports then stated the plane received a bomb threat and was diverted back to Afghanistan, landing in Kandahar. The early reports say the plane was diverted back to Afghanistan after being denied an emergency landing in ÃrÃ¼mqi.

src: "NgoMvulo, uSara Danius, unobhala osisigxina weKomiti yeNobel yoNcwadi kwiSweden Academy, uxele esidlangalaleni ngexesha lenkqubo kanomathotholo kwiSveriges Radio eSweden ikomiti, engakwazanga ukumfumana ngqo uBob Dylan ngokuthe ngqo ngokuphumelela i-2016 Nobel Prize kuLwazi, iinzame zayo zokufikelela kuye. UDanius uthe, ""Ngalo mzuzu asenzi nto. Ndinxebelelene ndathumela i-imeyile koyemtu ophangela kufuphi naye ndafumana iimpendulo ezinobuhlobo kakhulu. Okwangoku, oku kwanele."""
mt: "On Monday, Sara Danius, secretary of the Swedish Academy, which awards the Nobel Prize in Literature, told Swedish Radio that she had not yet received a response from Bob Dylan, who was awarded the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature. Danius said, ""I'm not sure what to do. I've sent him a letter and I've received a lot of suggestions. But I don't know."""
ref: "On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him. Danius said, ""Right now we are doing nothing. I have called and sent emails to his closest collaborator and received very friendly replies. For now, that is certainly enough."""

src: "Umongameli waseMelika uGeorge W. Bush usamkele esi sibhengezo. Isithethi sika Bush u Gordon Johndroe wachaza umnikelo wase North Korea""njengenyathelo elikhulu lokuphumelela okuqinisekisekisiweyo ukususwa kwe nuclear kwi Korean peninsula."""
mt: "U.S. President George W. Bush has been briefed on the situation. White House spokesman Gordon Johndroe said the North Korean action was a serious escalation of tensions on the Korean peninsula."
ref: "U.S. President George W. Bush welcomed the announcement. Bush spokesman Gordon Johndroe called North Korea's pledge ""a major step towards the goal of achieving the verifiable denuclearization of the Korean peninsula."""

src: Ngo 1956 u Slania watshintshela e Sweden, apho wathi emva kweminyaka emithathu waqalisa ukusebenzela I swedishh Post Office waze waba nguMchweli oyintloko. Wavelisa izitampu ezingaphezu kwe-1 000 eSweden nakwamanye amazwe angama-28. Umsebenzi wakhe ngowezinga eliphucukileyo futhi elicace gca kangangokuba ngomnye wee-philatelists âezaziwa kuwo onke amakhayaâ ezimbalwa. Abanye baziincutshe zokuqokelela imisebenzi yakhe kuphela. Isitampu sakhe sesi-1,000 yayiyentle i-âGreat Deeds by Swedish Kingsâ eyenziwe nguDavid Klocker Ehrenstrahl ngo-2000, ebhalwe kwi-Guinness Book World of Records. Naye wayezibandakanya nokushicilela imali engamaphepha yamazwe amaninzi, imizekelo yakutshanje yomsebenzi wakhe iquka imifanekiso yeNkulumbuso kumphambili we-$5 yase-Canada ne-$100 eliphepha.
mt: 1956 Slania was born in Sweden, where he said after three years he began working for the Swedish Post Office, where he was the chief engraver. He designed over 1,000 stamps in Sweden and 28 other countries. His work is considered âone of the most recognizedâ by all philatelists. Some of his work is still in use. His stamp of 1,000 was the âGreat Deeds by Swedish Kingsâ designed by David Klocker Ehrenstrahl in 2000, listed in the Guinness Book World of Records. He also designed the Canadian $5 and $100 banknotes.
ref: "In 1956 SÅania moved to Sweden, where three years later he began work for the Swedish Post Office and became their chief engraver. He produced over 1,000 stamps for Sweden and 28 other countries. His work is of such recognized quality and detail that he is one of the very few ""household names"" among philatelists. Some specialize in collecting his work alone. His 1,000th stamp was the magnificent ""Great Deeds by Swedish Kings"" by David KlÃ¶cker Ehrenstrahl in 2000, which is listed in the Guinness Book of World Records. He was also engaged in engraving banknotes for many countries, recent examples of his work including the Prime Ministerial portraits on the front of the new Canadian $5 and $100 bills."

src: Bekuvalwe imayile eziyi-800 ze-Trans-Alaska Pipeline System emva kokuchitheka kweoyile ekrwada emzantsi we-Fairbanks, eAlaska. Ukonakala kwezombane okulandela uvavanyo lwe-fire-command oluqhele ukwenziwa kubangele ii-valve zophumzo zivuleke ne oyile ekrwada yavuzela ngakwisitishi sesi-9 ngase-Fort Greely. Ukuvulwa kwe-valve kuvumele ukukhutshwa koxinzelelo kwinkqubo kwaze kwenza ukuba ioyile echithekele kwiphedi ukuya kwitanki enokuthwala iibharel eziyi-55 000 (iigaloni eziyi-2,3 miliyoni). Ukususela ngoLwesithathu emva kwemini, okwetanki bekusavuza mhlawumbi ngenxa yokwanda kwe thermal ngaphakathi kwintanki. Elinye igqongo elongezelelweyo elingaphantsi kwetanki belinako ukugcina umthamo webareli eziyi 104,500 labe lingagcwaliswanga.
mt: 800 barrels of oil spilled from the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System after a leak was discovered south of Fairbanks, Alaska. The leak was discovered by a fire command vehicle responding to a valve malfunction at the pipeline's ninth station at Fort Greely. The valve malfunction caused the pipeline to shut down, preventing the leak from entering the pipeline and causing the release of 55,000 barrels (2.3 million gallons) of oil. By Wednesday morning, the leak had stopped due to thermal expansion in the pipeline. The leak was the largest in the pipeline's history, releasing 104,500 barrels of oil.
ref: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska. A power failure following a routine fire-command system test caused relief valves to open and crude oil overflowed near the Fort Greely pump station 9. The valves opening allowed a pressure release for the system and oil flowed on a pad to a tank that can hold 55,000 barrels (2.3 million gallons). As of Wednesday afternoon, the tank vents were still leaking probably from thermal expansion inside the tank. Another secondary containment area below the tanks capable of holding 104,500 barrels was not yet filled to capacity.

The leak was discovered by a fire command vehicle responding to a valve malfunction at the pipeline's ninth station at Fort Greely. The valve malfunction caused the pipeline to shut down, preventing the leak from entering the pipeline and causing the release of 55,000 barrels (2.3 million gallons) of oil. By Wednesday morning, the leak had stopped due to thermal expansion in the pipeline. The leak was the largest in the pipeline's history, releasing 104,500 barrels of oil.
ref: 800 miles of the Trans-Alaska Pipeline System were closed down following a spill of thousands of barrels of crude oil south of Fairbanks, Alaska. A power failure following a routine fire-command system test caused relief valves to open and crude oil overflowed near the Fort Greely pump station 9. The valves opening allowed a pressure release for the system and oil flowed on a pad to a tank that can hold 55,000 barrels (2.3 million gallons). As of Wednesday afternoon, the tank vents were still leaking probably from thermal expansion inside the tank. Another secondary containment area below the tanks capable of holding 104,500 barrels was not yet filled to capacity.

src: I-U.S. Corps of Engineers iqikelele iintshi eziyi-6 zokuwa kwemvula kungamosha iindonga ebezisele zisonakala. I-Ninth Ward, eyaba nezikhukhula eziphakame kangange-20 feet ngoxa iHurricane Katrina, iyinkcitho ngoku-najengoko amanzi akufuphi nayo ayigubungela. Amanzi achitheka ngaphezulu kwe-levee kwicandelo le-100 fit ububanzi.
mt: 6 levees were breached by the U.S. Corps of Engineers to relieve pressure on the city's drainage system. The Ninth Ward, which was flooded by 20 feet of water from Hurricane Katrina, is now a swamp. Water is still rising above the levee's 100 foot height.
ref: The U.S. Corps of Engineers estimated that 6 inches of rainfall could breach the previously damaged levees. The Ninth Ward, which saw flooding as high as 20 feet during Hurricane Katrina, is currently in waist-high water as the nearby levee was overtopped. Water is spilling over the levee in a section 100 feet wide.

src: U-Hamilton ungqinile ukuba isibhedlela I -Howard University samkele isigulane sikwimeko ezinzileyo. Isigulane besiye e Nigeria,apho bekukho abosulelekileyo yintsholongwane ye-Ebola. Isibhedlela siye salandela umyalelo wokulawula ukosuleleka, kuquka ukohlula isigulane kwezinye ukunqanda okunokwenzeka ukosuleleka kwabanye.
mt: The Hamilton College has been quarantined after a student returned from Nigeria, where there have been Ebola cases. The student is being monitored for symptoms of the disease, as well as other possible signs of infection.
ref: Hamilton confirmed Howard University Hospital admitted the patient in stable condition. The patient had been to Nigeria, where some cases of the Ebola virus have occurred. The hospital has followed protocol for infection control, including separating the patient from others to prevent possible infection of others.

src: Umkhence nomphunga osemajukujukwini kungenzeka ukuba ibizizo umthombo wokuzisa amanzi emhlabeni zincendiswa yimetha yemvelo ekwaziyo ukwenza iiprotheyini ukuze zixhase ubomi. Inzululwazi zizama ukuqonda ukuba amazwe adelwe njani, ingakumbi Ihlabathi ladalwa njani, kuba oonomgca badibana Nehlabathi kude kudala.
mt: 2011 floods were caused by a combination of factors including deforestation, climate change and poor land management. The government has been criticised for not doing enough to prevent the disaster.
ref: Comets may possibly have been a source of water delivery to the earth along with organic matter that can form proteins and support life. Scientists hope to understand how planets form, especially how the Earth formed, since comets collided with the Earth long ago.

src: Nangona abasemagunyeni bengaqinisekanga ngobunyani besigrogriso, Igunya Lothutho laseMaryland liye lavala emva kokucelwa yiFBI. Iilori zokulahla inkunkuma zasetyenziswa ukuvala isikhululo sikaloliwe ohamba ngaphantsi komhlaba futhi uncedo lwamapolisa ayi-80 belukhona ukwenzela ukukhombha abaqhubi ngenye indlela. Khange kubekho zingxelo ezithetha ngokulibaziseka ngenxa yokubaninzi kweemoto endleleni kwi-beltway, enye indlela enokuthathwa.
mt: 1. The FBI has taken over the investigation of the shooting. 2. A police officer was shot in the leg and is in stable condition. 3. The shooting occurred on the beltway, a major highway.
ref: While authorities are unsure of the credibility of the threat, the Maryland Transportaion Authority made the closure with the urging of the FBI. Dump trucks were used to block tube entrances and assistance of 80 police were on hand to direct motorists to detours. There were no heavy traffic delays reported on the beltway, the city's alternate route.

src: "Umfoti wafuduselwa kwiziko lonyango iRonald Reagan UCLA, apho wasweleka khona emva koko. Wayechazwa njengosele ekhulile ekwi 20s. Kwingxelo, uBieber wathi ""[n]angona nangona bendingekho okanye ndibandakanyekile kulengozi embi, ingcinga zam nomthandandazo ukunye nekhaya lexhoba."" Iindaba zobumnandi i-TMZ iyaqonda ukuba umfoti wamisa isithuthi sakhe kwelinye icala leSepulveda Boulevard kwaye wazama ukuthatha imifanekiso yamapolisa ngaphambi kokuwela indlela aqhubekeke, eyalela ipolisa laseCalifornia kuhola wendlela oqhuba isitopu amyalele ukuba abuyele ngaphesheya, Kabini. Ngokwamapolisa, umqhubi wesithuthi esibethe umfoti akafane ajongane nezityholo zolwaphulo-mthetho."
mt: 20-year-old Bieber was rushed to the Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center, where he was treated for minor injuries. In a statement, Bieber said, "[I]t was just a regular morning, until I was involved in a [m]otorcycle accident. I am so grateful that everyone is safe. For those who are sending good vibes, I am sending good vibes back." TMZ reports that the accident occurred on a different icala leSepulveda Boulevard and that Bieber was seen by police taking photos of the accident scene before leaving, which prompted a California Highway Patrol officer to stop him, according to the police report. The officer said Bieber was cooperative and did not appear to be intoxicated. Police said Bieber was not at fault for the accident.
ref: "The photographer was transported to Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center, where he subsequently died. He was reportedly aged in his 20s. In a statement, Bieber said ""[w]hile I was not present nor directly involved with this tragic accident, my thoughts and prayers are with the family of the victim."" Entertainment news website TMZ understands the photographer stopped his vehicle on the other side of Sepulveda Boulevard and attempted to take pictures of the police stop before crossing the road and continuing, prompting the California Highway Patrol police officer conducting the traffic stop to order him back across, twice. According to police, the driver of the vehicle that hit the photographer is unlikely to face criminal charges."

src: "U-Arias ufunyaniswe enentsholongwane, Umphathiswa ka Mongameli uRodrigo Arias utshilo. Imeko kamongameli izinzile, nangona eza kubekelwa bucala ekhaya iintsuku ezininzi. ""Ngaphandle komkhuhlane kunye nomqala obuhlungu, ndiziva ndiphilile kwaye ndikulungele ukwenza umsebenzi wam ngefowuni. Ndilinde ukubuyela kuzo zonke idyuti zam ngoMvulo,"" :watsho uArias kwisitatementi."
mt: "Arias is recovering in a hospital, the prime minister's spokesman Rodrigo Arias was injured. The president's car was damaged, but he was not seriously hurt. ""Without any pain or discomfort, I feel fine and I will continue to do my job as usual. I will return to work tomorrow,"" :Arias said in a statement."
ref: "Arias tested positive for a mild case of the virus, Presidential Minister Rodrigo Arias said. The president's condition is stable, though he will be isolated at home for several days. ""Apart from the fever and a sore throat, I feel well and in good shape to carry out my work by telecommuting. I expect to return to all my duties on Monday,"" Arias said in a statement."

src: Emandleni aso, Isitshingitshane i-Goni, esithiyele ngesaka lamagqama e-palm ngolwimi lase-Maldives, lifikele kwimimoya ye-240 ye-km ngeyure (149 yeemayile ngeyure) Ukuqala kwanamhlanje, umoya wawusondele kwi-83 km / h, kwaye kwakulindelekile ukuba bube buthathaka.
mt: 240 km/h winds were reported in the Goni, a palm tree-shaped tropical storm, which was located 149 miles east of the Maldives on Monday morning. Winds were gusting to 83 km/h, and the storm was expected to strengthen.
ref: At its peak, Tropical Cyclone Gonu, named for a bag of palm leaves in the language of the Maldives, reached sustained winds of 240 kilometers an hour (149 miles per hour) . By early today, winds were around 83 km/h, and it was expect to keep weakening.

src: Amaza amakhulu abomvu abangelwa bubukho beeKarenia brevis ezininzi kunesiqhelo, into yokwemvelo ebakhoyo ephila emanzini. Izinto zendalo zinokuwela zivelise iimeko ezifanelekileyo, zivumela le algae ukuba inyuke ngenani ngokumangalisayo. I-algae ivelisa i-neurotoxin enokukhubaza imithambo ebantwini nasezintlanzini. Iintlanzi zidla ngokufa ngenxa yokubakho kwetyhefu eninzi emanzini. Abantu bangachatshazelwa kukuphefumla amanzi ahanjiswa emoyeni ngumoya nangamaza.
mt: 10,000 red tide algae blooms have been reported in the area. The algae produces a neurotoxin that can cause respiratory problems in humans and animals. Fish die-offs have been reported in the area. People are advised to avoid contact with the water and to keep pets away from the water.
ref: Red tide is caused by a higher than normal concentration of Karenia brevis, a naturally-occurring single-celled marine organism. Natural factors can intersect to produce ideal conditions, allowing this algae to increase in number dramatically. The algae produces a neurotoxin that can disable nerves in both humans and fish. Fish often die because of the high concentrations of the toxin in the waters. Humans can be affected by breathing affected water taken into the air by wind and waves.

src: UFelicia, owayekhe waba sisiqhwithi kudidi lwe 4 kwiSaffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale, wababuthathaka waba kwi-tropical depressionngaphambi kokuchithakala ngoLwesibini. Iintsalela zayo zivelise imvula kwiziqithi ezininzi, nangona kungekabikho monakalo okanye izikhukula okwangoku. Ukuna ofikelela ku 6.34 ye intshi ngegeyji kwo Oahu, yachazwa njenge âluluthoâ. Enye imvula yayihamba neendudumo kunye nokubaneka.
mt: 4 on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale, was a tropical depression before it became a hurricane on Sunday. Its winds and rains affected many islands, but no major damage or deaths were reported. It reached a peak of 6.34 meters (21 feet) in the Oahu area, and was dubbed a âsuperstormâ. The storm also brought heavy rains and flooding.
ref: "Felicia, once a Category 4 storm on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale, weakened to a tropical depression before dissipating Tuesday. Its remnants produced showers across most of the islands, though as of yet, no damage or flooding has been reported. The precipitation, reaching 6.34 inches at a gauge on Oahu, was described as ""beneficial"". Some of the rainfall was accompanied by thunderstorms and frequent lightning."

src: UPiquet Jr. utshayisile kw Grand Prix ka-2008 yase Singapore kamsinya nje emva kokba uFernando Alonso eye wathatha i-pit stop, ekhupha imoto yokhuseleko. Njengokuba ezinye iimoto ezaziphambhili ko-Alonso zayothela amafutha emvakwemoto yenkuseleko, wabagqitha wanqoba. UPiquet Jr. waye wagxothwa emva kweGrand Prix yaseHungary ka-2009.
mt: 2008 Singapore Grand Prix winner Piquet Jr. was disqualified after a pit stop, when Fernando Alonso took the lead. Other cars following Alonso were given a penalty. Piquet Jr. was later disqualified from the 2009 Hungarian Grand Prix.
ref: Piquet Jr. crashed in the 2008 Singapore Grand Prix just after an early pit stop for Fernando Alonso, bringing out the safety car. As the cars ahead of Alonso went in for fuel under the safety car, he moved up the pack to take victory. Piquet Jr. was sacked after the 2009 Hungarian Grand Prix.

src: Uphononongo olupapashwe ngoLwesine kwimagazini yeSayensi luichaze ngokubakho kohlobo olutsha lwentaka kwisiqithi i-Ecuadorean GalÃ¡pagos. Abaphandi beYunivesithi yasePrinceton eMelika kunye neUppsala University eSweden baxele ukuba oluhlobo lutsha luye lwavela kwizizukulwana nje ezibini, nangona bekukholelwa ukuba le nto ithatha ixesha elide, ngenxa yokuzala phakathi kweDarwin finch, Geospiza fortes, kunye necactus yabaphambukeli.
mt: A new species of finch was discovered on the GalÃ¡pagos Islands last Tuesday by scientists from Princeton University and Uppsala University. The researchers say the new species is a hybrid of two other species, but it is distinct enough to be considered a new species, due to its rapid evolution, in the case of the Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, and the cactus finch, Geospiza fuliginosa.
ref: A study published on Thursday in the journal Science reported on formation of a new bird species on the Ecuadorean GalÃ¡pagos Islands. Researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Sweden reported the new species evolved in just two generations, though this process had been believed to take much longer, due to breeding between an endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, and the immigrant cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.

src: Umnyhadala wobugcisa ukwayinxalenye yephulo loMasipala wasBucharest ofuna ukuphinda avelise eli komkhulu laseRomania njengomasipala oneenkcubeko ezahlukahlukeneyo. Esi sixeko siza kuba sesokuqala kumazantsi mpuma Yurophu ukusingatha iCowParade, owona msitho mkhulu wobugcisa ehlabathini, phakathi kukaJuni no-Agasti walo nyaka.
mt: Bucharest's mayor wants to bring the Romanian capital up to the level of other European capitals. This year, Bucharest will host the CowParade, a large-scale public art event, from June to August.
ref: The artistic event is also part of a campaign by the Bucharest City Hall that seeks to relaunch the image of the Romanian capital as a creative and colourful metropolis. The city will be the first in southeastern Europe to host CowParade, the world's largest public art event, between June and August this year.

src: Inqwelomoya ijolise e-Irkutsk yabe iqhutywa ngukhosi wangaphakathi. Kuye kwamiselwa ikomiti yokuphanda. I Il-76 ibisoloko iyeyona khomponenti engundoqo lwe Russia nomKhosi wayo ukusukela ngo 1970, yaye isundla kufumana ingozo enkulu e Russia kulenyanga iphelileyo. Nge 7 ka Okthobha injini iye yawa xa inqwelo ntaka iqalisa ukubhabha khange kubekho bonzakaleyo. iRussia yanqumamisa kancinci ukubhabha kwee-Il-76s emva kwengozi.
mt: 1. The plane crashed in the Irkutsk region. It was delivered to the military. The Il-76 is one of the largest aircraft in the Russian military since the 1970s. It was built in 2007. On October 7, the plane was flying when it crashed. Russia has suspended all Il-76 flights.
ref: The aircraft had been headed to Irkutsk and was being operated by interior troops. An inquiry was established to investigate. The Il-76 has been a major component of both the Russian and Soviet military since the 1970s, and had already seen a serious accident in Russia last month. On October 7 an engine separated on takeoff, without injuries. Russia briefly grounded Il-76s after that accident.

src: Inqwelomoya ijolise e-Irkutsk yabe iqhutywa ngukhosi wangaphakathi. Kuye kwamiselwa ikomiti yokuphanda. I Il-76 ibisoloko iyeyona khomponenti engundoqo lwe Russia nomKhosi wayo ukusukela ngo 1970, yaye isundla kufumana ingozo enkulu e Russia kulenyanga iphelileyo. Nge 7 ka Okthobha injini iye yawa xa inqwelo ntaka iqalisa ukubhabha khange kubekho bonzakaleyo. iRussia yanqumamisa kancinci ukubhabha kwee-Il-76s emva kwengozi.
mt: 1. The plane crashed in the Irkutsk region. It was delivered to the military. The Il-76 is one of the largest aircraft in the Russian military since the 1970s. It was built in 2007. On October 7, the plane was flying when it crashed. Russia has suspended all Il-76 flights.
ref: The aircraft had been headed to Irkutsk and was being operated by interior troops. An inquiry was established to investigate. The Il-76 has been a major component of both the Russian and Soviet military since the 1970s, and had already seen a serious accident in Russia last month. On October 7 an engine separated on takeoff, without injuries. Russia briefly grounded Il-76s after that accident.

src: Ngaphambi kweSimpsons uSimon wayesebenze kwimiboniso eliqela kwiindawo ezahlukeneyo. Ngexesha lama-1980s wayesebenza kwimiboniso enje ngeTeksi, iiCheers, kunye neTracy Ullman Show. Ngo-1989 wanceda ukwenza i-The Simpsons no-Brooks futhi no-Groening, futhi wayenoxanduva lokuqesha iqela lokuqala labhali bomdlalo. Ngaphandle kokushiya umboniso ngo-1993 wagcina isihloko somvelisi olawulayo, kwaye waqhubeka nokufumana amashumi ezigidi zeedola rhoqo.
mt: 1980s: He worked on shows in the animation industry. In the 1980s he worked on Taxi, Cheers, and the Tracy Ullman Show. In 1989 he teamed up with Brooks and Groening to create the first episode of the series. In 1993 he left the show and went on to produce other series.
ref: Before The Simpsons Simon had worked on several shows in various positions. During the 1980s he worked on shows such as Taxi, Cheers, and The Tracy Ullman Show. In 1989 he helped create The Simpsons with Brooks and Groening, and was responsible for hiring the show's first writing team. Despite leaving the show in 1993 he kept the title of executive producer, and continued to receive tens of millions of dollars every season in royalties.

src: UFlute wabhala ukuba imizamo yabanye yokudimaza amabhinqa ukuba athethe phandle ngempilo yamabhinqa khange iphumelele. Ufikelel kisigqibo emva kwezimvo eziyinqwaba nenkuthazo ayifumene kubafazi namadoda becenga besithi amayeza ocwangcisoÂ amele ajongwe njengayimfuneko kwezonyango.
mt: The flute said that the other side's goal was to eliminate the black race from the face of the earth. He said that the virus was created by white people to kill black people and that the white people were the real racists.
ref: Fluke wrote that the efforts by some to drown out women from speaking out about womenâs health were unsuccessful. She came to this conclusion due to the multitude of positive comments and encouragement sent to her by both female and male individuals urging that contraception medication be considered a medical necessity.

ref: Fluke wrote that the efforts by some to drown out women from speaking out about womenâs health were unsuccessful. She came to this conclusion due to the multitude of positive comments and encouragement sent to her by both female and male individuals urging that contraception medication be considered a medical necessity.

src: """Izakuba nesimo zamanzi. Icwebezela njengamazi. Ngoko, ukuba ubumi ngaselunxwemeni, ubuza kukwazi ukubona ezantsi, ubone iingqalutya okanye ugwebu olulapho. Ngokolwazi lwethu, inye iplanethi ebonakalisa ukutshintsha-tshintsha ukodlula iTitan, kwaye igama layo nguMhlaba,"" wongezelela uStofan."
mt: """It's a big deal. It's a big deal. If you're a geologist, you ask yourself, 'Can I see it from the ground?' You can see the Grand Canyon. But our knowledge of the planet is so limited that we can only see the Titan, and its name is Earth,"" Stofan said.
ref: """It's going to behave like water. It's transparent just the way water is. So if you were standing by the shoreline, you would be able to see down to whatever pebbles or gunk that was on the bottom. As far as we know, there is only one planetary body that displays more dynamism than Titan, and its name is Earth,"" added Stofan."

src: Lena ayingqini nje ukuba ezinye iidayinaso zazinamaphiko, itheory esele isasaziwe, kodwa inikeza ingcombolo amathambo nje awanako kona ukunikeza ,into enjengombala, ukumila nokulungelelana okuvelela amacala amathathu. . Izazinzulu zithi esi silwanyana sasinombala omdaka nge-chestnut ngaphezulu kunye nombala ongaphantsi olombala okanye we-carotenoid. Okufumanekileyo kunikeza imbono ekutshintsheni kwamaphiko entaka. Kuba iintsiba zedinosaur zingena kumila okukwakhekileyo, eluthiwa yirachis, kodwa zinazo ezinye iimpawu zeentsiba â ibarbs nebarbules â abaphandi baqikelele intoyokuba irachis yakhekhe kunezinye iintsiba ezi. Ubume beentsiba bubonisa ukuba zazingasetyenziswa kubhabho kodwa endaweni yokulawula ubushushu okanye ukubonisa. Abaphandi bacebise ukuba, nangona lo ingumsila wedayinaso encinci, isampulu ibonisa iintsiba zabantu abadala hayi intshontsho phantsi. Abaphandi bacebise ukuba, nangona lo ingumsila wedayinaso encinci, isampulu ibonisa iintsiba zabantu abadala hayi intshontsho phantsi.
mt: 1. Some dinosaurs had feathers, but the theory is not yet proven, but it does suggest a possible function for feathers, such as insulation, flight or display. The new study suggests that the feathers were chestnut in color above and carotenoid below. The study also suggests that the feathers were used for display but not for flight. The bones of the dinosaurs show that they were bipedal, but the legs of the dinosaurs â the barbs and barbules â were not. The bones of the dinosaurs also show that they were warm-blooded but not cold-blooded. The researchers say that, although the study is preliminary, the findings suggest that the dinosaurs were warm-blooded but not cold-blooded.
ref: This not only confirms that at least some dinosaurs had feathers, a theory already widespread, but provides details fossils generally cannot, such as color and three-dimensional arrangement. . Scientists say this animal's plumage was chestnut-brown on top with a pale or carotenoid-colored underside. The find also grants insight into the evolution of feathers in birds. Because the dinosaur feathers do not have a well-developed shaft, called a rachis, but do have other features of feathers â barbs and barbules â the researchers inferred the rachis was likely a later evolutionary development that these other features. The feathers' structure suggests that they were not used in flight but rather for temperature regulation or display. The researchers suggested that, even though this is the tail of a young dinosaur, the sample shows adult plumage and not a chick's down. The researchers suggested that, even though this is the tail of a young dinosaur, the sample shows adult plumage and not a chick's down.

src: Ngeli lixa iyeza elisalingwayo libonakala likucutha ukubulawa yiEbola,kude kube ngoku, akukho machiza abonakalise ekulungele ukunyanga usuleleko osele lukhona. Elinye ichiza, iZMapp, belibonakala ngathi liyathembisa kuhlolo, kodwa uphononongo olusemthethweni lubonise ukuba beluneenzuzo ezimbalwa zokuthintela ukufa kunezo bezifunwa. Kuvavanyo kwe PALM, ZMapp wasebenza njengesilawuli, into ethetha ukuthi ososayensi bayisebenzisa njenge siseko baze bayithelekisa nezinye ezintathu zamachiza.
mt: 1 of 2 experimental Ebola drugs, ZMapp, was found to be effective in monkeys, but the other, PALM, was not. Both were used in the treatment of Ebola patients.
ref: While one experimental vaccine appears able to reduce Ebola mortality, up until now, no drugs have been clearly demonstrated suitable for treating existing infection. One antibody cocktail, ZMapp, initially showed promise in the field, but formal studies indicated it had less benefit than sought in preventing death. In the PALM trial, ZMapp served as a control, meaning scientists used it as a baseline and compared the three other treatments to it.

src: NgoMvulo, iinzululwazi ezivela eStandford University School of Medicine zazise ngesixhobo sokuxilonga esitsha esinoku sota iiseli ngohlobo: itship encinci eprintwayo enokwenziwa ngokusebenzisa iiprinta ze inki yaye zinokuxabisa malunga nesenti enye yase U.S.. Abaphandi abayintloko bathi oku kungenza kukhawuleze kubonwe umhlaza, isifo sephepha, i-HIV kunye nemalariya kwizigulana zakumazwe angathathi ntweni, apho abantu abachachayo kwizigulo ezifana nomhlaza webele zingasisiqingatha sezo zakumazwe afumileyo.
mt: 1/3/2020, Stanford University School of Medicine researchers published a study in the journal Science Translational Medicine, using a new type of 3D-printed material that can be injected into the body. The researchers say the material could be used to treat cancer, heart disease, HIV and malaria in developing countries, where people often lack access to advanced medical technology.
ref: On Monday, scientists from the Stanford University School of Medicine announced the invention of a new diagnostic tool that can sort cells by type: a tiny printable chip that can be manufactured using standard inkjet printers for possibly about one U.S. cent each. Lead researchers say this may bring early detection of cancer, tuberculosis, HIV and malaria to patients in low-income countries, where the survival rates for illnesses such as breast cancer can be half those of richer countries.

src: Ososayensi bafumanise uhlobo lomhlaba lungcolise kumphandle wenyanga ebizwa ngokuba yi lobate scarps oye kwacaca ukuba ubangele ukuncipha kwenyanga ngokuthe cothayo. Ezi ndonga zaye zafunyanwa kuyo yonke inyanga kwaye zibonakala zingachaphazelekanga kangako bubume, zibonakalisa ukuba iziganeko zejografi ezazibadala zazisanda kwenzeka. Le cingane iyaphikasana nebango lokuba inyanga ayinanto yakwenza ngokupheleleyo nezinto ezenzeka kumhlaba.
mt: Scientists have discovered a new type of landform called lobate scarps that they say are caused by the expansion of the Earth's crust. These features are found on all planets with solid surfaces and are believed to be the result of tectonic activity. The study suggests that the expansion of the Earth's crust is responsible for the formation of these features.
ref: Scientists have discovered landforms littered across the moon's surface called lobate scarps that have apparently resulted from the moon's shrinking very slowly. These scarps were found all over the moon and appear to be minimally weathered, indicating that the geologic events that created them were fairly recent. This theory contradicts the claim that the moon is completely devoid of geologic activity.

src: "Ukususela ngoko uAdekoya ebese-Edinburgh Sheriff Court etyholwa ngokubulala unyana wakhe. Ubanjiwe kusamelwe ukutyholwa nesigwebo, kodwa ubungqina bamangqina ingaba bubonakele ngenxa yokusasazwa komfanekiso wakhe ngobubanzi. Esi sisenzo esiqhelekileyo kwenye indawo e-UK kodwa ubulungisa baseScotland busebenza ngokwahlukileyo kwaye iinkundla zikubonile ukupapashwa kweefoto njengezinto ezinokuthi zithintele. UProfesa Pamela Ferguson waseUniversity of Dundee ubhala esithi ""iintatheli ziba sesichengeni ukuba zipapasha iifoto nezinye izinto zabarhanelwa."" I-Crown Office, ejongene nezotshutshiso, ixele intatheli ukuba akukho luphawu luphinde lwenziwe okungenani de kube kubekwa tyala."
mt: "Adekoya was convicted of killing his son at Edinburgh Sheriff Court. He was sentenced to life imprisonment, but the sentence was suspended on the condition that he would not reoffend. The Scottish media reported that the image was altered to make him appear more attractive. Professor Pamela Ferguson of the University of Dundee wrote that ""the media often alter images to make people look more attractive."" The Crown Office, which prosecutes serious crimes, said that the image had been altered to make him look younger."
ref: "Adekoya has since been in Edinburgh Sheriff Court charged with murdering her son. She is in custody pending indictment and trial, but any eyewitness evidence may be tainted because her image has been widely published. This is common practice elsewhere in the UK but Scottish justice works differently and courts have viewed publication of photos as potentially prejudicial. Professor Pamela Ferguson of the University of Dundee notes ""journalists do seem to be walking a dangerous line if publishing photos etc of suspects."" Crown Office, which is in overall charge of prosecutions, has indicated to journalists that no further comment will be made at least until indictment."

src: Ngaphezu komkhenkce othezayo, imozulu embi ibiphazamisana nenzame zokuhlangula. Upittmann ubonakalise ukuba iimeko azizokuphucuka de kube lithuba elithile kwiveki ezayo. Ubuninzi nobudeki bomkhence, xa kusitsho u-Pittman, bobona buninzi kule minyaka iyi-15 idlulileyo.
mt: 15 years ago, the weather was clear and calm. Pittman said the plane was flying at a safe altitude when the engine suddenly stopped. The plane was in the air for about 15 minutes before it crashed. The plane was in the air for about 15 minutes before it crashed.
ref: In addition to the crushing ice, extreme weather conditions have been hampering rescue efforts. Pittman suggested that conditions wouldn't improve until sometime next week. The amount and thickness of the pack ice, according to Pittman, is the worst it has been for sealers in the past 15 years.

src: URoberts akavumi ukutsho ukuba ubomi buqala nini, umbuzo obalulekileyo xa kucingwa ngombuzo wokuqhomfa, uthi ayiyondlela efanelekileyo yokuziphatha emsebenzini ukuthetha ngeenkcukacha ezinto ekusenokwenzeka zenzekile. Waye wayigxininisa kwingcaciso yakhe yangaphambili into yokuba, Roev.Wade yaye âingumthetho obekiweyo wendawoâ ekwagxininisa ukubaluleka kokuzinziswa kwesigqibo Senkundla Ephakamileyo. Uqinisekisile ukuba ukholelwa kwilungelo lobumfihlo apho isigqibo se-Roe besixhomekeke khona.
mt: Roberts said he was not aware of the question until it was asked, saying he had not been briefed on the details of the case. He was asked about the âright to lifeâ in the Roe v. Wade decision. It was reported that the Supreme Courtâs decision to overturn Roe was âa major victoryâ for the pro-life movement.
ref: "Roberts flatly refused to say about when he believes life begins, an important question when considering the ethics of abortion, saying that it would be unethical to comment on the specifics of likely cases. He did, however, reiterate his earlier statement that Roe v. Wade was the ""settled law of the land"", emphasizing the importance of consistent Supreme Court rulings. He also confirmed that he believed in the implied right to privacy which the Roe decision depended upon."

src: Kanye ngo 8:46 kusasa, kwathi cwaka esxekweni, kuqatshelwa kanye elaxesha inqwelo moya yokuqala yahlasela apho bisiya khona. Umthai wezibane ezimbiniuijoliswe phezulu ukukhomba esibhakabhakeni ubusuku bonke. Ulwakhiwo lookrwecâizulu abahlanu luyaqhubeka kwisiza indawo esisazulu sezothutho kunye nepaki yesikhumbuzo embindini.
mt: 8:46 am, the first fire truck arrived, and the fire was extinguished. Two people were injured and taken to hospital. The investigation is ongoing.
ref: At exactly 8:46 a.m. a hush fell across the city, marking the exact moment the first jet struck its target. Two beams of light have been rigged up to point skywards overnight. Construction is ongoing for five new skyscrapers at the site, with a transportation center and memorial park in the middle.

src: "Zonke izikrobo zomqolomba, ezazithiywe ""Oodade Abasixhenxe"", zingange 100 yeemitha ukuya ku-250 weemitha (amanyathelo ayi328 ukuya ku820) ukuxwesa. src: Le ndoda ingumangalelwa yayiqhubela isithuthi esinamavili amathathu siphethe iziqhushumbisi ebantwini abaninzi. Le ndoda irkrokrelwa ngokuqhushumbhisa iziqhushumbhisi ibanjiwe, emva kokwenzakaliswa luqhushumbo. Igama lakhe alikaziwa ngabasemagunyeni, nangona besazi ukuba ulilungu lesizwe saseUighur.
mt: 3 people were killed and 7 injured in a car bomb explosion in the city of Urumqi. The car was driven by a Uighur man who was killed in the explosion. His name was not released, but he was identified as a Chinese national.
ref: The man allegedly drove a three-wheeled vehicle armed with explosives into a crowd. The man suspected of detonating the bomb was detained, after sustaining injuries from the blast. His name is still unknown to authorities, although they do know he is a member of the Uighur ethnic group.

src: UMzantsi Afrika woyise i-All Blacks (New Zealand) kumdlalo wombutho wombhoxo weTri Nations eRoyal Bafokeng Stadium eRustenburg, eMzantsi Afrika. Isikoro sokugqibela ibe luloyiso ngenqaku elinye, 21 ku 20, iphelisa imidlalo I All Blackâ15 streak iphumelela. Kumabhoko-bhoko, kuphelisa ukutyiwa kangangemidlalo emihlanu elandelelanayo. Yayingumdlalo wokugqibela we All Blacks, abasele beyiwinile indebe kwiveki ezimbini ezidlulileyo. Umdlalo wokugqibela kolu luhlu uzakubanjelwa e-Ellis Park eRhawutini kwiveki ezayo, xa iSpringboks sidlala ne-Australia.
mt: 21 ku 20, iphelisa imidlalo I All Blackâ15 streak iphumelela. Kumabhoko-bhoko, kuphelisa ukutyiwa kangangemidlalo emihlanu elandelelanayo. Yayingumdlalo wokugqibela we All Blacks, abasele beyiwinile indebe kwiveki ezimbini ezidlulileyo. Umdlalo wokugqibela kolu luhlu uzakubanjelwa e-Ellis Park eRhawutini kwiveki ezayo, xa iSpringboks sidlala ne-Australia.
ref: South Africa have defeated the All Blacks (New Zealand) in a rugby union Tri Nations match at the Royal Bafokeng Stadium in Rustenburg, South Africa. The final score was a one-point victory, 21 to 20, ending the All Blacks' 15 game winning streak. For the Springboks, it ended a five-match losing streak. It was the final match for the All Blacks, who had already won the trophy two weeks ago. The final match of the series will take place at Ellis Park in Johannesburg next week, when the Springboks play Australia.

src: Kwizilwanyane zase-Australia kukho igquba, nangona iqela leemarsupials (ii-mammals ezinempokotho) futhi iimonotremes (ii-mammals ezizala amaqanda). UChiao kunye noShalipov bathe bakumgama okhuselekileyo ukusuka kukutshintsha kwesimo sengqondo. Abantu abasemhlabeni abalawula ezo nqwelo-moya zincinci bazenza zakwazi ukuhamba ibe imeko yesikhululo yabuyela kwindlela yesiqhelo.
mt: There are two groups, marsupials (pouched mammals) and monotremes (egg-laying mammals). The Chiao and Shalipov teams are working on a project to reverse the process. Earth scientists are skeptical that the project will succeed.
ref: The station maintained its attitude, despite the loss of a gyroscope earlier in the space station mission, until the end of the spacewalk. Chiao and Sharipov reported being a safe distance from the attitude adjustment thrusters. Russian ground control activated the jets and normal attitude of the station was regained.

src: Ityala latshutshiselwa eVirginia kuba likhaya kumnikezeli wenkonzo ye-intanethi okhokelayo i-AOL, inkampani eyaphembelela ityala. Eli lixesha lokuqala kufunyanwa isigwebo kusetyenziswa umthetho owamiselwa ngo-2003 ukunqanda i-imeyile eninzi, ekwaziwa ngokuba yi spam, ukusuka ekuhanjisweni okungacelwanga ukuya kubasebenzisi bebhokisi zeposi.
mt: 1. A Virginia man was arrested after police found a computer in his home with child pornography on it. The computer was being used by AOL, the Internet service provider. The first time the computer was used, the user was required to agree to a 2003 law that prohibits the sending of unsolicited bulk e-mail, known as spam, from the time of registration until the user is no longer a customer.
ref: The case was prosecuted in Virginia because it is the home to the leading internet service provider AOL, the company who instigated the charges. This is the first time a conviction has been gained using the legislation enacted in 2003 to curb bulk e-mail, aka spam, from unsolicited distribution into users mailboxes.

src: Kubantu abayi-1,400 abavotelweyo phambi konyulo luka-2010, abo bachasa i-Australia ekubeni yiriphabliki bakhule ngeepesenti ezisibhozo ukusukela ngo-2008. Ekhathalayo inkulubaphathiswa u Julia Gillard ubange ngelithi ngethuba lokukhampeynela konyulo luka 2010 lwe federal ukuba wakholelwa ukuba i-Australia imele yenziwe iriphablikhi ekupheleni kolawulo luka Kumkanikazi u-Elizabeth II. Iipesenti ezingama-34 zabo bavotayo babelana ngolu luvo, befuna ukuba uKumkanikazi uElizabeth II abe yikumkani yokugqibela yase-Australia. Kwimeko yovavanyo olugqithisileyo, iipesenti ezingama-29 zabo baphononongiweyo bakholelwa ukuba i-Australia kufuneka ibe yiriphabliki ngokukhawuleza, ngelixa i-31 pesenti ikholelwa ukuba i-Australia akufuneki ibe yiriphabliki.
mt: 1,400 people were polled in the 2010 election, which saw the Australian Labor Party lose its majority in the federal parliament for the first time since 2008. Prime Minister Julia Gillard announced that the 2010 election would be the last federal election under the reign of Queen Elizabeth II. 34% of those polled wanted Queen Elizabeth II to remain as head of state, while 29% were polled that Australia should become a republic, and 31% were polled that Australia should remain a republic.
ref: Out of 1,400 people polled prior to the 2010 federal election, those who oppose Australia becoming a republic grew by 8 per cent since 2008. Caretaker Prime Minister Julia Gillard claimed during the campaign of the 2010 federal election that she believed Australia should become a republic at the end of Queen Elizabeth II's reign. 34 per cent of those in the poll share this view, wanting Queen Elizabeth II to be Australia's last monarch. At the extremes of the poll, 29 per cent of those surveyed believe Australia should become a republic as soon as possible, while 31 per cent believe Australia should never become a republic.

src: Kubantu abayi-1,400 abavotelweyo phambi konyulo luka-2010, abo bachasa i-Australia ekubeni yiriphabliki bakhule ngeepesenti ezisibhozo ukusukela ngo-2008. Ekhathalayo inkulubaphathiswa u Julia Gillard ubange ngelithi ngethuba lokukhampeynela konyulo luka 2010 lwe federal ukuba wakholelwa ukuba i-Australia imele yenziwe iriphablikhi ekupheleni kolawulo luka Kumkanikazi u-Elizabeth II. Iipesenti ezingama-34 zabo bavotayo babelana ngolu luvo, befuna ukuba uKumkanikazi uElizabeth II abe yikumkani yokugqibela yase-Australia. Kwimeko yovavanyo olugqithisileyo, iipesenti ezingama-29 zabo baphononongiweyo bakholelwa ukuba i-Australia kufuneka ibe yiriphabliki ngokukhawuleza, ngelixa i-31 pesenti ikholelwa ukuba i-Australia akufuneki ibe yiriphabliki.
mt: 1,400 people were polled in the 2010 election, which saw the Australian Labor Party lose its majority in the federal parliament for the first time since 2008. Prime Minister Julia Gillard announced that the 2010 election would be the last federal election under the reign of Queen Elizabeth II. 34% of those polled wanted Queen Elizabeth II to remain as head of state, while 29% were polled that Australia should become a republic, and 31% were polled that Australia should remain a republic.
ref: Out of 1,400 people polled prior to the 2010 federal election, those who oppose Australia becoming a republic grew by 8 per cent since 2008. Caretaker Prime Minister Julia Gillard claimed during the campaign of the 2010 federal election that she believed Australia should become a republic at the end of Queen Elizabeth II's reign. 34 per cent of those in the poll share this view, wanting Queen Elizabeth II to be Australia's last monarch. At the extremes of the poll, 29 per cent of those surveyed believe Australia should become a republic as soon as possible, while 31 per cent believe Australia should never become a republic.

src: ULeslie Aun, isithethi se Komen Foundation, uthe umbutho umisele umthetho omtsha ongavumeli inkxaso okanye imali yenkxaso inikezwe amaqumhru aphantsi kophando lwasemthethweni. Ipolisi kaKomen ayiyiphumezanga iPlanned Parenthood kuba kusekho uphando lokuba i Planned Parenthood iyisebenzisa njani imali kwaye iyichaza njani imali yayo uphando luqhutywa yiRepresentative Cliff Stearns. UStearns uphanda ukuba ingaba irhafu isetyenziselwa ukuxhasa ukuqhomfa izisu nge-Planned Parenthood kwindima yakhe njengosihlalo weKomitana ejongene noPhando, ephantsi kwe-House Energy ne Commerce Committe.
mt: Leslie Aun, a Komen Foundation spokesperson, said the decision was made by the board of directors, not the foundation's CEO. The Komen Foundation has not yet responded to Planned Parenthood's claim that the organization uses its money and has not yet clarified how the money is used or how it is spent on the committee. Representative Cliff Stearns, who is on the House Energy and Commerce Committee, has said that he is not sure if the decision was made to cut funding to Planned Parenthood because of the organization's support of abortion.
ref: Leslie Aun, a spokesperson for the Komen Foundation, said the organization adopted a new rule that does not allow grants or funding to be awarded to organizations that are under legal investigation. Komen's policy disqualified Planned Parenthood due to a pending investigation on how Planned Parenthood spends and reports its money that is being conducted by Representative Cliff Stearns. Stearns is investigating whether taxes are used to fund abortions through Planned Parenthood in his role as chairman of the Oversight and Investigations Subcommittee, which is under the umbrella of the House Energy and Commerce Committee.

src: "Amapolisa aseMadhya Pradesh ayifumene ilaptop ebibiwe nefowuni. Usekela Jikelele Wokuhlola D K Arya wathi, ""Sibambe abantu abahlanu abadlwengule inenekazi lase Swiss saze sayifumana ifone yakhe nelaptop"". Abatyholwa babizwa ngoluhlobo ngu-Baba Kanjar, u-Bhutha Kanjar, u-Rampro Kanjar, u-Gaza Kanjar no-Vishnu Kanjar. Intsumpa yamapolisa uChandra Shekhar Solanki uthe umtyholwa uvele enkundleni ezogqume ubuso."
mt: 5 men from Switzerland were arrested for stealing a laptop. Police Inspector D K Arya said, ""We have arrested five persons who had come from Switzerland. They had stolen the laptop"". The arrested were identified as Kanjar, Bhutha Kanjar, Rampro Kanjar, Gaja Kanjar and Vishnu Kanjar. Police Inspector Chandra Shekhar Solanki said the men were found in a house.
ref: "The Madhya Pradesh Police recovered the stolen laptop and mobile phone. Deputy Inspector General D K Arya said, ""We have arrested five persons who raped the Swiss woman and recovered her mobile and laptop"". The accused are named as Baba Kanjar, Bhutha Kanjar, Rampro Kanjar, Gaza Kanjar and Vishnu Kanjar. Police superintendent Chandra Shekhar Solanki said the accused appeared in court with covered faces."

src: I-ASUS Eee PC, eyalonthswa ngaphambili kwihlabathi liphela ukonga iindleko kunye nokusebenza kwayo, yaba sisihloko esishushu kwinyanga ye-IT yaseTaipei ngo-2007. Kodwa intengiso yabathengi kwikhompyuter yelaptop iya kwahluka kakhulu kwaye itshintshwe emva kokuba i-ASUS yanikezelwa kwi-2007 Taiwan Sustainable Award ngu-Executive Yuan weRiphabhlikhi yase China.
mt: 2007 Taipei International IT Show, the first Eee PC was introduced. However, the product was a huge success and was awarded the 2007 Taiwan Sustainable Award by the Executive Yuan of the Republic of China.
ref: ASUS Eee PC, earlier launched world-wide for cost-saving and functionality factors, became a hot topic in 2007 Taipei IT Month. But the consumer market on laptop computer will be radically varied and changed after ASUS was awarded in the 2007 Taiwan Sustainable Award by Executive Yuan of the Republic of China.

src: Le ngxaki iqale ngee-1 zikaJanuwari xa abantu basekuhlaleni abaliqela beqalise ukubanezikhalazo kwi-Obanazawa Post Office ukuba khange bawafumane amakhadi Onyaka Omtsha abaqhele ukuwafumana. Phezolo, iposi ibhengeze isingxengxezo kubahlali nakwimidiya emva kokufumanisa ukuba inkwenkwe ebifihle ngaphezu kwemiqulu eyi 600, kuquka iipostcards eziyi 429 Zonyaka Omtsha, ezingakhange zifike kwabebezilindele.
mt: 1 January, local residents were surprised to find a package at the Obanazawa Post Office that had been sent in October. The package contained a letter, a postcard and a newspaper clipping, all of which were over 600 years old, and the postcards were from October 1910, and had not arrived at their destination.
ref: The issue started on January 1st when dozens of local residents started complaining to the Obanazawa Post Office that they hadn't received their traditional and regular New Year cards. Yesterday, the post office released their apology to citizens and the media after discovering that the boy had hidden more than 600 postal documents, including 429 New Year postcards, which weren't delivered to their intended recipients.

Yesterday, the post office released their apology to citizens and the media after discovering that the boy had hidden more than 600 postal documents, including 429 New Year postcards, which weren't delivered to their intended recipients.

src: UMurray ulahlekelwe yiseti yokuqala xa bekusohlukaniswa ukulingana kwamanqaku abo ekubeni ndoda nganye ingakhange yoyiswe kumdlalo xa bekuqala yona ukubetha ibhola. UDel Potro wayenethuba lokuqala kuseto lwesibini, kodwa oku kwafuna ikhefu lokuqina emva kokufika kwi-6-6. U Potro ufumene unyango kwigxalaba lakhe ngalomzuzu kodwa ukwazile ukubuyela emdlalweni.
mt: 1st seed Murray was knocked out in the first round after losing to a qualifier who was ranked lower than him. Del Potro won the first set, but lost the second set 6-6. Murray was injured in the third set and was forced to retire.
ref: Murray lost the first set in a tie break after both men held each and every serve in the set. Del Potro had the early advantage in the second set, but this too required a tie break after reaching 6-6. Potro received treatment to his shoulder at this point but managed to return to the game.

src: "Ekhatshwa ngaloo magosa, uye waqinisekisa abahlali baseTexas ukuba amanyathelo okukhusela uluntu ebesele ethathwa. Ngokukodwa uPerry wathi, ""Zimbalwa iindawo emhlabeni ezixhotyiswe ngcono ukuhlangabezana nomceli mngeni obangelwe yile meko."" Irhuluneli iphinde yatsho, ""Namhlanje, sifundile ukuba abanye abantwana abakubudala besi sikolo bachongiwe njengababenonxibelelwano nesigulana."" Waqhubeka wathi ""Lo mba unobuzaza. Qiniseka ukuba isistim yethu isbenza ngendlela emele ukusebenza ngayo."""
mt: "Today, we are reminded that the world is a safer place without weapons of mass destruction. As Governor Perry said, ""Texas is a leader in the fight against terrorism."" He continued, ""Today, we learned that some of our children who were in school are now considered victims of a terrorist attack."" He went on to say, ""This is a sad day. We must be vigilant. We must be aware of the threat of terrorism.""
ref: "Accompanied by those officials, he assured Texas citizens that steps were being taken to protect the public's safety. Perry specifically said, ""There are few places in the world better equipped to meet the challenge that is posed in this case."" The governor also stated, ""Today, we learned that some school aged children have been identified as having had contact with the patient."" He went on to say, ""This case is serious. Rest assured that our system is working as well as it should."""

src: Kwakudala ngaphambi kweThe Daily Show neThe Colbert Report, uHeck noJohnson babona ukuba kungenzeka kubekho iphepha elaliza kusasaza iindabaâneendabaâbesengabafundi eUW ngo-1988. Ukusukela oko yaqalwa, i-Onion iye yaba sisigidimi esinyanisekileyo seendaba, esinopapasho olushicilelweyo, iwebhusayithi etsala iindwendwe ezikhethekileyo ezingama-5,000,000 ngenyanga ka-Okthobha, iintengiso zobuqu, inethiwekhi yeendaba yeeyure ezingama-24, iipodikhasti, kunye neatlasi yehlabathi esandula ukumiliselwa ebizwa Our Dumb World. U-Al Gore kunye noGeneral Tommy Franks bavele bancama amanqaku angentla abo abawathandayo (eka-Gore yayikukuba i-Onion yanika ingxelo yokuba yena no-Tipper babefumana ezona zondo zibalaseleyo ebomini babo emva kokuba boyise ikholeji ngo-2000). Abaninzi kubabhali babo babe nefuthe elikhulu kwiinkqubo zeendaba zika-Jon Stewart no-Stephen Colbert.
mt: 1988 University of Wisconsin students created a satirical newspaperâThe Onion. Since then, the Onion has published fake news stories, made-up headlines, a 5 million circulation in October, a weekly humor section, a podcast, and a book called Our Dumb World. Al Gore and General Tommy Franks have been the subject of Onion articles (Gore was reported to have received a $100,000 donation from Tipper after he lost the 2000 election). The Onion has also been the subject of much praise from Jon Stewart and Stephen Colbert.
ref: Long before The Daily Show and The Colbert Report, Heck and Johnson envisioned a publication that would parody the newsâand news reportingâwhen they were students at UW in 1988. Since its inception, The Onion has become a veritable news parody empire, with a print edition, a website that drew 5,000,000 unique visitors in the month of October, personal ads, a 24 hour news network, podcasts, and a recently launched world atlas called Our Dumb World. Al Gore and General Tommy Franks casually rattle off their favorite headlines (Gore's was when The Onion reported he and Tipper were having the best sex of their lives after his 2000 Electoral College defeat). Many of their writers have gone on to wield great influence on Jon Stewart and Stephen Colbert's news parody shows.

src: Ukubhikisha kwaqala malunga no-11:00 ngokwexesha lalapha( UTC+1) e whiteball malunga nesango lokungena eliya kwisitalato i Downing eligadwe ngamapolisa, apho kulikhaya leNkulu Mbuso. Emva nje kwentsimbi ye-11: 00, ababhikishi bavale ukugcwala kwezithuthi kwinqwelomoya kwinqanawa eWhitehall. Ngo-11:20,amapolisa acela abaqhankqalazi ukuba babuye umva kwindlela yabahamba ngenyawo, ecacisa ukuba kufuneka balungelelanisa ababhikishi nomthamo wabo onyukayo. Malunga no-11:29, uqhankqalazo lwaya ngaseWhitehall, ludlula eTrafalgar Square, naseStrand, badlula e-Aldwaych ukunyuka eKingsway ngase Holborn apho iConservative Party ibibambe iSpring Forum sayo ehotele iGrand Connaught Rooms.
mt: 11:00 am local time (UTC+1) a white ball was seen in the sky over Downing Street, where the British Prime Minister is. After 11:00, the police began to evacuate the area around Whitehall. At 11:20, the police announced that they were going to investigate the area where the object was seen, and that they were going to investigate the object and the area. At 11:29, the object was seen over Whitehall, and then over Trafalgar Square, and then over Strand, and then over Aldwaych, and then over Kingsway, and then over Holborn, where the Conservative Party was holding the Spring Forum at the Grand Connaught Rooms.
ref: The protest started around 11:00 local time (UTC+1) on Whitehall opposite the police-guarded entrance to Downing Street, the Prime Minister's official residence. Just after 11:00, protesters blocked traffic on the northbound carriage in Whitehall. At 11:20, the police asked the protesters to move back on to the pavement, stating that they needed to balance the right to protest with the traffic building up. Around 11:29, the protest moved up Whitehall, past Trafalgar Square, along the Strand, passing by Aldwych and up Kingsway towards Holborn where the Conservative Party were holding their Spring Forum in the Grand Connaught Rooms hotel.

src: """Ngoku sinempunku enenyanga ezine engenaswekile eyayifudula ineswekile,"" wongeze ngelitshoyo. Ugqirha Ehud Ur, unjingalwazi wezonyango eYunivesithi yasee-Dalhousie e-Halifax, e-Nova Scotia ekwangusihlali wesebe lezophononongo kunye nesayensi kwi-Canadian Diabetes Association, ulumkise ngokuba uphando lusaqala. Njengezinye iingcali, uyathandabuza ukuba ingaba isifo seswekile siyanyangeka na, esazi ukuba ezi zinto azinanto kwenza nabantu esele benesifo seswekile sohlobo 1."
mt: """We don't know what the long-term effects are of this treatment,"" he said. Dr. Ehud Ur, a diabetes researcher at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia, and a member of the Canadian Diabetes Association, said the study is a first step. Like other studies, he said, it's too early to tell whether the treatment will help people with type 1 diabetes.
ref: """We now have 4-month-old mice that are non-diabetic that used to be diabetic,"" he added. Dr. Ehud Ur, professor of medicine at Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia and chair of the clinical and scientific division of the Canadian Diabetes Association cautioned that the research is still in its early days. Like some other experts, he is skeptical about whether diabetes can be cured, noting that these findings have no relevance to people who already have Type 1 diabetes."

Like some other experts, he is skeptical about whether diabetes can be cured, noting that these findings have no relevance to people who already have Type 1 diabetes."

src: I-Twin Otter ibizama ukwehlela eGat Kokoda izolo njengoko iAirlines PNG Flight C4684, ibisele irhoxisile. Ngaphambi nje kwemizuzu elishumi phambi kokuba ihlale ekuveleni kwayo okwesibini yaaduka. Indawo yengozi ifunyenwe namhlanje kwaye ayinakufikeleleka kangangokuba amapolisa amabini ashiywe ehlathini ukuze aye kule ndawo aze akhangele abasindileyo. Uphendlo luphindwe loniwa yimozulu embi ebibangele konakale ukuhlala.
mt: 1. The Twin Otter was on a flight from Port Moresby to Kokoda. It was reported to have crashed. It was last seen at 5000 feet before it disappeared. The site of the crash is still unknown and it is not known if the plane has crashed or not. Police are searching the area to find the plane.
ref: The Twin Otter had been trying to land at Kokoda yesterday as Airlines PNG Flight CG4684, but had aborted once already. About ten minutes before it was due to land from its second approach it disapeared. The crash site was located today and is so inaccessable that two policemen were dropped into the jungle in order to hike to the scene and seek survivors. The search had been hampered by the same bad weather that had caused the aborted landing.

src: I-Twin Otter ibizama ukwehlela eGat Kokoda izolo njengoko iAirlines PNG Flight C4684, ibisele irhoxisile. Ngaphambi nje kwemizuzu elishumi phambi kokuba ihlale ekuveleni kwayo okwesibini yaaduka. Indawo yengozi ifunyenwe namhlanje kwaye ayinakufikeleleka kangangokuba amapolisa amabini ashiywe ehlathini ukuze aye kule ndawo aze akhangele abasindileyo. Uphendlo luphindwe loniwa yimozulu embi ebibangele konakale ukuhlala.
