src: Indidi zesiFrentshi ezithethwa e Belgium nase Switzerland ziyohluka kancinci kwisiFrentshi esithethwa eFrance, nangona ziyelelene ngokwaneleyo ngokude zifane nokuthi yintethonye. Ngokukodwa, indlela yokubala yabantetho isisiFrench abahlala eBelgium naseSwitzerland inendawana ezinobucukubhede ezahlukileyo kwisiFrench esithethwa eFrance, nendlela yokubizwa kwamagama ithande ukwahluka. Nangona kunjalo, bonke abantu abathetha isiFrentshi baseBelgium nabaseSwitzerland ngebefunde isiFrentshi esisesikolweni, ke baya kuba nakho ukukuqonda nokuba usebenzisa inkqubo yokubala yaseFransi esemgangathweni.
mt: French-language newspapers in Belgium and Switzerland are printed in a different font from that used in France, and the two countries have different rules for the spelling of words. However, all French-speaking people in Belgium and Switzerland are taught the French spelling system in school, and are expected to be able to read and write it.
ref: The varieties of French which are spoken in Belgium and Switzerland differ slightly from the French spoken in France, though they are similar enough to be mutually intelligible. In particular, the numbering system in French-speaking Belgium and Switzerland has some slight peculiarities that are different from the French spoken in France, and the pronunciation of some words is slightly different. Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

src: Zimbalwa kakhulu inqwelomoya ezisanikeza ngamaxabiso okuswelekelwa, athi ophulele kancinane indleko zokundwendwela ngomzuzu wokugqibela wokuya kungcwaba. Iinqwelo-moya ezibonelela ngezi ziquka i-Air Canada, i-Delta Air Lines, i-Lufthansa yeenqwelo-moya ezivela e-US okanye Canada nase WestJet. Ngawo onke amaxesha, umele ubhukishe ngokuthe ngqo kwi-airline.
mt: 11 aircraft were damaged by hail, with some sustaining minor damage to their fuselages. The affected aircraft were Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa and US and Canadian carriers WestJet. All other flights were unaffected.
ref: Only a few airlines still offer bereavement fares, which slightly discount the cost of last-minute funeral travel. Airlines that offer these include Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights originating from the U.S. or Canada, and WestJet. In all cases, you must book by phone directly with the airline.

src: Ukusebenzisa I apps ze GPS kwisamrtphone sakho singaba yeyona Ndlela elula nefikelelekayo ukuze uhlolahlole xa ungekho kwilizwe lakho. Inokonga imali ngokuthenga iimephu ezintsha zeGPS, okanye isixhobo esizimeleyo seGPS okanye ukuqesha enye kwinkampani eqeshisa ngemoto. Ukuba awunalo uqhagamshelo lwedatha kwifowuni yakho, okanye xa luphume kuluhlu, ukusebenza kwayo kunokuba ncinci okanye kungafumaneki.
mt: 1. Using your smartphone's GPS apps can help you find your way to your destination. It can cost you money to buy a new GPS, or a GPS upgrade, or to switch to a new company's car. If you don't have a GPS, or if you're not sure where you're going, using one can be expensive.
ref: Using GPS navigation apps on your smartphone can be the easiest and most convenient way to navigate when out of your home country. It can save money over buying new maps for a GPS, or a standalone GPS device or renting one from a car rental company. If you don't have a data connection for your phone, or when it is out of range, their performance can be limited or unavailable.

src: Ukubona iindawo nobomi bezilwanyana zase Galapagos yenziwa kakuhle ngesikhephe, kanye ngoluhlobo wenza ngalo u-Charles Darwin ngo 1835. Ngaphezu kwe 60 yenqanawa zokuhamba zidlule kumanzi i Galapagos- ziphakathi ko 8 ukuya ku 100 lwenani lwabakhweli. Abantu abaninzi babhukisha indawo yabo ngaphambi kwexesha (njengoko izikhephe zidla ngokuzala ngexesha lonyaka eliphezulu). Qiniseka ukuba iarhente oyibhukelayo yingcali yeGalapagos enolwazi olululo lweenqanawa ezahlukeneyo. Oku kuza kuqinisekisa ukuba izinto ozithandayo kunye/okanye izinto ongazifuniyo zimataniswa nenqanawa efanelekileyo kubo.
mt: 60 years ago, Charles Darwin visited the Galapagos Islands, which are home to about 8 to 100 species of endemic animals. Visitors to the islands are required to stay in designated areas before and after the official season (as the islands are closed during the breeding season). It is believed that the Galapagos Islands are home to many species of animals that are not found anywhere else. This is evidenced by the fact that the animals that are protected and/or those that are not protected are separated by the official season.
ref: Seeing the sites and wildlife of the Galapagos is best done by boat, just as Charles Darwin did it in 1835. Over 60 cruise ships ply the Galapagos waters - ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers. Most people book their place well in advance (as the boats are usually full during the high season). Be sure the agent through whom you book is a Galapagos specialist with a good knowledge of a wide variety of ships. This will ensure that your particular interests and/or constraints are matched with the ship most suitable to them.

src: "Kwiindawo ezininzi zehlabathi, ukubulisa ngesandla emoyeni lonto ibonisa ububele, ubonisa u- ""molo."" Sekunjalo, eMalaysia, phakathi kwabantu basezilalini baseMalaysia, ithetha ukuthi âyiza apha,â ngokufanayo nomnwe ogotyiweyo wajonga emzimbeni noluphawu olusetyenziswa kwamanye amazwe aseNtshona, yaye lumele lusetyenziselwe loo njongo kuphela. Ngokufanayo, umhambi wase-Bhritane oseSpain unokubhidanisa ukuphakanyiswa kwesandla ubhabhayisa usijongise kuwe (kunokuba usijongise kulo mntu ubhekisa kuwe) kube ngathi uza kubuya."
mt: "In many parts of the world, waving a hand in a certain way means "hello." In Malaysia, among Malaysians, it means "come here," as a gesture of affection. In some parts of Africa, a similar gesture is used to ward off evil spirits. In Britain, it means "come here" (or "come here" to a person who is looking at you) as a gesture of affection."
ref: "In many parts of the world, waving is a friendly gesture, indicating ""hello."" However, in Malaysia, at least among the Malays in rural areas, it means ""come over,"" similar to the index finger bent toward the body, a gesture which is used in certain Western countries, and should be used only for that purpose. Similarly, a British traveller in Spain may mistake a wave goodbye involving the palm facing the waver (rather than the person being waved at) as a gesture to come back."

src: "Kwiindawo ezininzi zehlabathi, ukubulisa ngesandla emoyeni lonto ibonisa ububele, ubonisa u- ""molo."" Sekunjalo, eMalaysia, phakathi kwabantu basezilalini baseMalaysia, ithetha ukuthi âyiza apha,â ngokufanayo nomnwe ogotyiweyo wajonga emzimbeni noluphawu olusetyenziswa kwamanye amazwe aseNtshona, yaye lumele lusetyenziselwe loo njongo kuphela. Ngokufanayo, umhambi wase-Bhritane oseSpain unokubhidanisa ukuphakanyiswa kwesandla ubhabhayisa usijongise kuwe (kunokuba usijongise kulo mntu ubhekisa kuwe) kube ngathi uza kubuya."
mt: "In many parts of the world, waving a hand in a certain way means "hello." In Malaysia, among Malaysians, it means "come here," as a gesture of affection. In some parts of Africa, a similar gesture is used to ward off evil spirits. In Britain, it means "come here" (or "come here" to a person who is looking at you) as a gesture of affection."
ref: "In many parts of the world, waving is a friendly gesture, indicating ""hello."" However, in Malaysia, at least among the Malays in rural areas, it means ""come over,"" similar to the index finger bent toward the body, a gesture which is used in certain Western countries, and should be used only for that purpose. Similarly, a British traveller in Spain may mistake a wave goodbye involving the palm facing the waver (rather than the person being waved at) as a gesture to come back."

src: Imisinga yomkhence ayizinzanga, kodwa yehla entabeni. Oku kuya kubangela ukuqhekeka, amaqula, anokuthi angabonakali ngenxa yeebhlorho zekhephu. Indonga namaphahla emiqolomba yomkhenkce angawa zize nentanda zivaleke. Eziphelweni zekhephu, iindawo ezinkulu ziyaqhekeka, ziwe zize zitsibe okanye ziqengqelelkele kude nesiphelo.
mt: 1. The plane was not damaged, but it was on the ground. This is a good thing, but it is also a bad thing, because of the tail. The plane's tail was damaged. In the tail, the plane's wings were damaged, and the plane's engine was damaged.
ref: The glaciers are not stable, but flow down the mountain. This will cause cracks, crevasses, which may be obscured by snow bridges. The walls and roofs of ice caves can collapse and cracks can get closed. At the edge of glaciers huge blocks break loose, fall down and perhaps jump or roll farther from the edge.

src: I-Goma sisixeko esithandwa ngabakhenkethi saseDemocratic Republic of Congo kwelo cala lisempuma kufutshane neRwanda. Ngo-2002 iGoma yatshatyalaliswa ludaka lwentaba-mlilo iNyiragongo eyangcwaba uninzi lwezitrato zedolophu, ingakumbi umbindi wedolophu. Ngelixa iGoma ikhuselekile ngokufanelekileyo, konke ukundwendwela ngaphandle kweGoma kufuneka kuphandwe ukuze kuqondwe imeko yomlo oqhubekayo kwiphondo laseMantla eKivu. Esi sixeko sikwayeyona ndawo yokuqalisa ukunyuka i-volcano iNyiragongo, kunye nezinye iintaba ezingaduriyo ukozonyuka ekuthiwa ziiGorilla zaseAfrika. Ungasebenzisa iboda-boda (iteksi esisisithuthuthu) ukuze uye kwiindawo eziseGoma. Ixabiso eliqhelekileyo (lasekuhlaleni) liyi-500 Congolese Francs xa uhambo lulufutshane.
mt: Goma is a city in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, near the Rwandan border. In 2002, Goma was devastated by the eruption of the nearby volcano, Mount Nyiragongo, which destroyed much of the city. As Goma was rebuilt, it was necessary to relocate the population to avoid the next eruption of Mount Nyiragongo, which is also home to the endangered mountain gorillas of Africa.  Use a boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The official exchange rate is 500 Congolese Francs per US dollar.
ref: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda. In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the townâs streets, particularly the town centre. While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province. The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa. You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.

src: Nayiphi na inkampu engezantsi komda eGrand Canyon ifuna imvume yokuhlala. Iipemithi zimbalwa ukuze kukhuselwe umwonyo, yaye zifumaneka ngomhla woku-1 enyangeni, kwiinyanga ezine ngaphambi kokuqala kwenyanga. Ngoko, imvume yamva yokuqala nangawuphi na umhla ku Meyi ifumaneka nge 1 Jan. Isithuba kwiindawo ezaziwa kakhulu, njengeBright Angel Campground emelene nePhantom Ranch, sizala zizicelo kusuku lokuqala zivulelel ukubhukisha indawo. Kukho inani eliqingqiweyo leempepha-mvume zabo bazithanga xa befika, zona zifumaneka kwabo bafike kuqala.
mt: 1,000 people are expected to camp in the Grand Canyon. The permits are limited to 10,000 per year, and are awarded on a lottery basis. The first permits for the new year were awarded on January 1. The most popular sites, such as the Bright Angel Campground and Phantom Ranch, are booked up for the first night of the year. There are also a limited number of backcountry permits available, which are awarded on a first-come, first-served basis.
ref: Any camping below the rim in Grand Canyon requires a backcountry permit. Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and become available on the 1st day of the month, four months prior to the start month. Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan. Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations. There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.

src: Ezinye iihotele zinelifa elivela kwiminyaka yobudala yegolide yoololiwe abomphunga kunye nelwandle; Phambi kweMfazwe yesibini (II) yeHlabathi, ngenkulungwane ye-19 okanye yokuqala yama-20. Ezi hotele kulapho izityebi kunye nantu abadumileyo baloo mihla bebehlala khona, kwaye zazihlala zisitya kamnandi ibe zisonwabela ubomi basebusuku. Ifanishala yakudala, ukunqaba kwezinto onokuzisebenzisa zangoku nokuguga kakuhle zonke ezo, zizinto zazo. Nangonga zidla ngokuba zezabucala, ziye ngamanye amaxesha zihlalise intloko zamazwe ezindwendweleyo nezinye izihlonipheki. Umhambi onemfumba yemali unokucinga ngokujikeleza ngenqwelomoya kwilizwe liphela, aqhekezwe kukuhlala kuninzi lwezi hotele.
mt: 19 or 20 of the hotels were destroyed by fire during the Second World War. These hotels were used by the military and civilians, and were used as barracks. The hotels were also used as hospitals and other facilities. After the war, the hotels were used as a base for the reconstruction of the country and the rebuilding of the economy. The hotels were also used as a base for the reconstruction of the country and the rebuilding of the economy.
ref: Some hotels have a heritage from the golden age of steam railways and ocean liners; before the Second World War, in the 19th or early 20th centuries. These hotels were where the rich and the famous of the day would stay, and often had fine dining and nightlife. The old fashioned fittings, the lack of the latest amenities, and a certain graceful agedness are also part of their character. While they are usually privately owned, they sometimes accommodate visiting heads of state and other dignitaries. A traveller with piles of money might consider a round the world flight, broken up with stays in many of these hotels.

src: "Ngenxa yeentambo ze-fiber optic ezingaphantsi kolwandle namakhonkco aya kwi Europe kunye ne-broadband satellite, iGreenland iqhagamshelekee kakuhle yaye inabantu abayi-93% abanokufikelela kwi intanethi. Ihotele yakho okanye umamkeli (ukuba uhlala kwindlu yendwendwe okanye kwikhaya labucala) lisenokuba ne compyutha ene wifi okanye I intaneti kwaye zonke indawo zokuhlala zinevenkile ye intaneti okanye ingingqi ene wifi kawonke wonke. Njengokuba sekukhankanyiwe ngasentla, nangona igama elithi ""Eskimo"" lihlala lamkelekile eUnited States, lithathwa njengolonyeliso ngabantu abaninzi abangahlali base-Arctic, ngakumbi eCanada. Nangona usenokuva abantu abazinzalelwane zaseGreenland belisebenzisa eli gama, abantu abangengabo abaphaya bamele bangalisebenzisi. Abemi abazinzalelwane zaseGreenland bazibiza ngokuba ngama-Inuit eCanada naseKalaalleq (isininzi iKalaallit), iGreenlander, eGreenland. Ulwaphulo-mthetho, nokuphatha kakubi iimbacu ngokuqhelekileyo, ayaziwa konke konke e Greenland. Nasezidolophini, akukho ndawo ""zirhabaxa"". Imozulu ebandayo yiyo eyibubungozi bokwenene abanokudibana nayo abo bangalungiselelanga. Xa utyelela iGreenland ngamaxesha onyaka abandayo (ucinge into yokuba xa usiya, usiya ngasentla, kungona kubanda), kubaluleke kakhulu ukuba uphathe impahla eshushu ngokwaneleyo. Iintsuku ezinde kakhulu ehlotyeni zinokukhokelela kwiingxaki zokulala ngokwaneleyo kunye neengxaki ezinxulumene nempilo. Ngexesha lasehlotyeni, jonga kwakhona iingcongconi zaseNordic. Nangona zingasasazi zifo, zianokucaphukisa."
mt: "Because of the fiber optic cables under the sea and broadband satellite in Europe, Greenland has excellent internet access and 93% of its population is online. Your hotel or guest house (if you are staying in a bed and breakfast or a private home) will have a computer and wifi or internet and all accommodations have wifi or internet access. Although the term ""Eskimo"" is used in the United States, it is considered derogatory by people in the Arctic, especially in Canada. However, Greenlanders use the term, and people in Canada and Kalaalleq (a village in Greenland) call themselves Inuit. The legal system, and the fact that the majority of the population is Christian, is well known in Greenland. There is no ""red light district"". The temperature is usually mild, but the sun is low on the horizon. When you visit Greenland in the summer (if you are not there in the winter, you are there in the summer), it is very important to bring a warm coat. The days are long and the nights are short. In the summer, the sun is always up. In the winter, the sun is always down. In the winter, the sun is always down. In the winter, the sun is always down. In the winter, the sun is always down. ref: "Thanks to undersea fiber optic cable links to Europe and broadband satellite, Greenland is well connected with 93% of the population having internet access. Your hotel or hosts (if staying in a guesthouse or private home) will likely have wifi or an internet connected PC, and all settlements have an internet cafe or some location with public wifi. As mentioned above, though the word ""Eskimo"" remains acceptable in the United States, it is considered pejorative by many non-U.S. Arctic peoples, especially in Canada. While you may hear the word used by Greenlandic Natives, its use should be avoided by foreigners. The native inhabitants of Greenland call themselves Inuit in Canada and Kalaalleq (plural Kalaallit), a Greenlander, in Greenland. Crime, and ill-will toward foreigners in general, is virtually unknown in Greenland. Even in the towns, there are no ""rough areas."" Cold weather is perhaps the only real danger the unprepared will face. If you visit Greenland during cold seasons (considering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring warm enough clothing. The very long days in the summer can lead to problems getting sufficient sleep and associated health issues. During the summer, also watch out for the Nordic mosquitoes. Although they do not transmit any diseases, they can be irritating."

src: IJardÃ­n de la UniÃ³n. Le ndawo yakhiwa njengendawo evulekileyo yakudal yeminyaka yoo-17 yokuhlala oneengendi, apho iTemplo de San Diego kuphela kwesakhiwo esiseleyo. Ngoku isebenza njenge central plaza, isoloko inezinto ezininzi eziqhubekayo, emini nasebusuku. Kukho iqela lendawo zotyela ezingqunge igadi, kwaye emvakwemini nasemalanga kuxaphake ukubakho imidlalo yeqonga esuka kwi ntente esesiqikithini. IiCallejon del Beso (we-Alley of the kiss). Iibhalkhoni ezimbini ezohlulwe nje ziisentimitha eziyi-69 likhaya lebali lakudala lothando. Ngesenti nje ezimbalwa abanye abantwana bayakukubalisela ibali.
mt: 17th century garden, the only one remaining from the 17th century, where the Temple of San Diego is the only remaining building. It is used as a central plaza, with many shops and restaurants. There is a small park with a fountain, and a playground in the evenings. The Callejon del Beso (alley of the kiss). Two narrow alleys, separated by a single house, are named after a famous kiss. In one alley, a young man was said to have kissed a young woman through a window, and she fell to her death. In the other alley, a young man was said to have kissed a young woman through a window, and she fell to her death.
ref: JardÃ­n de la UniÃ³n. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building. It now functions as the central plaza, and always has a lot of things going on, day and night. There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoons and evening there free concerts are often given from the central gazebo. Callejon del Beso (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is home of an old love legend. For a few pennies some children will tell you the story.

src: "Ngokwesiqhelo eNorway zi-fjords ezinzulu kunye neentlambo ezingena ngequbuliso kwindawo eneentaba nemihlaba ethe tyaba. Ezi ndawo ziphakamileyo kudla ngokuthiwa âzii-viddeâ into ethetha indawo evulekileyo, engenamithi nengenasiphelo. E-Rogaland naseAgder zihlala zibizwa ngokuba yi ""hei"" okuthetha ukuba awunampilo ye-moorland ehlala igutyungelwe yiheather."
mt: "Norway fjords and mountains are known for their beauty and isolation. These remote areas are called âviddeâ and are described as âheather moorlandâ with heather and heathland."
ref: "Typical for Norway are steep fjords and valleys that suddenly give way to a high, more or less even plateau. These plateaus are often referred to as ""vidde"" meaning a wide, open treeless space, a boundless expanse. In Rogaland and Agder they are usually called ""hei"" meaning a treeless moorland often covered in heather."

ref: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus. The parade of buildings that make the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering bar chart that is made apparent by the presence of the waters of Victoria Harbour. To get the best views of Hong Kong, leave the island and head for the Kowloon waterfront opposite. The great majority of Hong Kong Island's urban development is densely packed on reclaimed land along the northern shore. This is the place the British colonisers took as their own and so if you are looking for evidence of the territory's colonial past, this is a good place to start.

ref: Stirrups are supports for the rider's feet that hang down on either side of the saddle. They provide greater stability for the rider but can have safety concerns due to the potential for a rider's feet to get stuck in them. If a rider is thrown from a horse but has a foot caught in the stirrup, they could be dragged if the horse runs away. To minimize this risk, a number of safety precautions can be taken. First, most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a smooth, quite narrow, sole. Next, some saddles, particularly English saddles, have safety bars that allow a stirrup leather to fall off the saddle if pulled backwards by a falling rider.

ref: Stirrups are supports for the rider's feet that hang down on either side of the saddle. They provide greater stability for the rider but can have safety concerns due to the potential for a rider's feet to get stuck in them. If a rider is thrown from a horse but has a foot caught in the stirrup, they could be dragged if the horse runs away. To minimize this risk, a number of safety precautions can be taken. First, most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a smooth, quite narrow, sole. Next, some saddles, particularly English saddles, have safety bars that allow a stirrup leather to fall off the saddle if pulled backwards by a falling rider.

src: Uthungelwano lotshintshiselwano ngomoya wokubuka iindwendwe ngumbutho odibanisa abahambi nabantu basezidolophini bazivizithelayo. Ukujoyina inetwork enjalo kudla nje ngokufuna ukuba uzalise iform ekwiinternethi; nangona ezinye inetwork zinika okanye zifuna okongezelelweyo ukuqisekiswa. Uluhlu lwababuki zindwendwe abafumaneka luye lwenziwe lufumaneke luprintiwe okanye kwi-intanethi, ngamanye amaxesha luba nezimvo kunye noncomelo lwabantu ebebekhe bahlala apho. ICouchsurfing yasekwa ngoJanuwari 2004 emva kokuba umdwelisi weenkqubo zekhompyutha uCasey Fenton efumene inqwelomoya ngexabiso eliphantsi eIceland kodwa engenayo indawo yokuhlala. Wathumela i-imeyile kubafundi beyunivesithi yendawo kwaye wafumana inani elinamandla kakhulu lokufumana indawo indawo yokuhlala yamahhala.
mt: A travel network for people who want to stay with strangers. Some networks require you to register and pay a fee, but others are free. A list of couches for rent is usually printed or posted on the Internet, and often includes a picture and a description of the person who lives there. Couchsurfing was founded in January 2004 by Casey Fenton, a computer programmer in Iceland, but the idea was not new. Students at the University of Waterloo had been using the Internet to find places to stay for years, and had found that it was a great way to meet people.
ref: A hospitality exchange network is the organization that connects travelers with locals in the cities they are going to visit. Joining such a network usually just requires filling out an online form; although some networks offer or require additional verification. A listing of available hosts is then provided either in print and/or online, sometimes with references and reviews by other travelers. Couchsurfing was founded in January 2004 after computer programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland but did not have a place to stay. He emailed students at the local university and received an overwhelming number of offers for free accommodation.

ref: With 17,000 islands to choose from, Indonesian food is an umbrella term covering a vast variety of regional cuisines found across the nation. But, if used without further qualifiers, the term tends to mean the food originally from the central and eastern parts of the main island Java. Now widely available throughout the archipelago, Javanese cuisine features an array of simply seasoned dishes, the predominant flavorings the Javanese favor being peanuts, chillies, sugar (especially Javanese coconut sugar) and various aromatic spices.

ref: For those unfamiliar with medical jargon, the words infectious and contagious have distinct meanings. An infectious disease is one that is caused by a pathogen, such as a virus, bacterium, fungus or other parasites. A contagious disease is a disease which is easily transmitted by being in the vicinity of an infected person. Many governments require visitors entering, or residents leaving, their countries to be vaccinated for a range of diseases. These requirements may often depend on what countries a traveller has visited or intends to visit.

src: Ababoneleli be-VPN (inethiwekhi yabucala yeintanethi) yeyona ndlela ilungileyo yokuphumela ngaphaya kokubini ukubekwa esweni ngabezopolitiko nokuthengiswa kwe-IP-geofiltering. Zingaphezulu kwii-proxy zeweb ngenxa yezizathu eziliqela: Ziyaphinda zizifake endleleni zonke izinto ezikwi-Intanethi, azipheleli nje ku-http. Ngokwesiqhelo banikezela nge-bandwidth ephezulu kunye nomgangatho ongcono wenkonzo. Zibhalwe ngokufihliweyo kwaye ngenxa yoko kunzima ukuzihlola.
mt: VPNs (virtual private networks) are a great way to protect your privacy and bypass political censorship and IP geofiltering. They are also great for circumventing bandwidth restrictions and throttling. They are also easy to set up and use.
ref: Personal VPN (virtual private network) providers are an excellent way of circumventing both political censorship and commercial IP-geofiltering. They are superior to web proxies for several reasons: They re-route all Internet traffic, not only http. They normally offer higher bandwidth and better quality of service. They are encrypted and thus harder to spy on.

src: Ngenxa yokuba iifowuni zihanjiswa nge-intanethi akuyomfuneko ukuba usebenzise inkampani yefowuni ekwindawo ohlala kuyo okanye apho uhambela khona. Akukho mfuneko yokuba ufumane inombolo yendawo ohlala kuyo; Ungafumana uqhagamshelo lwe-Intanethi kwi-Intanethi endle yenkukhu, eAlaska kwaye ukhethe inombolo ethi useArizona enelanga. Amaxesha amaninzi, kufuneka uthenge ecaleni inombolo yazwenibanzi evumela iifowuni ezisebenzisa i-PTSN ukuba zikufowunele. Xa inombolo ofowunelwa kuyo ibalulekile kubantu abakufowunelayo
mt: 1. It is not always possible to determine the location of a website visitor. You may not receive the address of the visitor's location; You may receive an IP address from which the website visitor is accessing the Internet, such as an IP address from an Internet service provider in Alaska, or an IP address from an Internet service provider in Arizona. 2. In most cases, you should remove the IP address of the visitor who is accessing the website from the list of IP addresses provided by the PTSN if the IP address is being used by a website visitor.
ref: Because calls are routed over the Internet, you do not need to use a phone company located where you live or where you travel. There is also no requirement that you obtain a local number from the community in which you live; you can obtain a satellite Internet connection in the wilds of Chicken, Alaska and select a number which claims you're in sunny Arizona. Often, you have to buy a global number separately that allows PSTN phones to call you. Where the number is from makes a difference for people calling you.

src: Ukudubula kweziqhamo ezibomvu okwaziwa njengehanami, bekusoloko kuyinxalenye yenkcubeko yaseJapan ukususela ngenkulungwane ye-8. Eli cebo livela eTshayina apho indubulo yeeplamu kwakuyintyantyambo ethandwayo. EJapan, eyokuqala ipati yecherry blossom yabanjwa ngukumkani esenzela yena kuphela kunye namalungu obuhandibay kwinkundla ze-Imperial.
mt: 8.0 magnitude earthquake in Japan, which is the worst in the country since the 1923 Great Kanto Earthquake. The quake was centered in the Izu Islands, where the first cherry blossoms are usually seen. In Japan, the first cherry blossoms are usually seen only by the emperor and his courtiers at the Imperial Palace.
ref: Cherry blossom viewing, known as hanami, has been a part of Japanese culture since the 8th century. The concept came from China where plum blossoms were the flower of choice. In Japan, the first cherry blossom parties were hosted by the emperor only for himself and other members of the aristocracy around the Imperial Court.

src: IJerusalem sesona sixeko sikhulu kwaye ikwalikomkhulu lase-Israel, nangona amanye amazwe Ezizwe Ezimanyeneyo engayigqali njengekomkhulu lase-Israel. Esi sixeko sakudala Sakwiinduli ZakwaYuda sinembali ebangela umdla yeminyaka yamawakawaka. Isixeko singcwele kunqulo olwahlukahlukeneyo olunqula uthixo omnye - ubuYuda, ubuKrestu kunye nobuSilamsi yaye sisisazulu senkcubeko, sonqulo nesezinto ezinokwenza nothixo. Ngenxa yokufuzisela kokholo kuledolophu, ingakumbi kwiindawo ezininzi kwingingqi yeDolophu Yakudala, i-Jerusalem yeyona ndawo enabavakashi eSirayeli. IJerusalem iinendawo ezininzi zembali, ezombiweyo kunye nezenkcubeko kunye noobhazabhaza beevenkile abagcweleyo, iikhefi kunye neendawo zokutyela.

ref: Jerusalem is the capital and largest city of Israel, though most other countries and the United Nations do not recognize it as Israel's capital. The ancient city in the Judean Hills has a fascinating history spanning thousands of years. The city is holy to the three monotheistic religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam, and serves as a spiritual, religious, and cultural center. Due to the religious significance of the city, and in particular the many sites of the Old City area, Jerusalem is one of the main tourist destinations in Israel. Jerusalem has many historic, archeological and cultural sites, along with vibrant and crowded shopping centers, cafÃ©s, and restaurants.

src: IKruger National Park (KNP) ilele emantla mpuma o Mzantsi Afrika kwaye ibaleka imida yase Mozambique empuma, iZimbabwe emantla, kwaye umda osemazantsi yi Crocodile River. Ipaki ithatha i-19,500 kmÂ² kwaye yahlulwe kwi-ecozones ezili-14, nganye ixhasa izilwanyana zasendle ezahlukeneyo. Yenye yeendawo ezinomtsalane eMzantsi Afrika kwaye ithathwa njengeyona ndawo iphambili yeeNdawo zeSizwe zoMzantsi Afrika (SANParks). Njengazo zonke iiPaki zoMzantsi Afrika, kukho ulondolozo kunye nemirhumo yokungena kule paki. Isenobaluncedo emntwini ukuba athenge i-Wild Card, ekwenza ungene kwiioakhi ezithile eMzantsi Afrika okanye kuzo zonke ii-Pakhi Zelizwe laseMzantsi Afrika.
mt: The Kruger National Park (KNP) is located in northeastern South Africa and borders with the Mozambique province of Gaza, Zimbabwe to the north, and the province of Mpumalanga in the west and southwest. It covers an area of 19,500 kmÂ² and is divided into 14 ecological zones, of which 7 are major vegetation types. It is one of the largest game reserves in Africa. It is managed by the South African National Parks (SANParks). Like all South African national parks, it is governed by a board of trustees. Visitors may obtain a Wild Card, which allows entry to all South African national parks, as well as all other parks in the South African National Parks system.
ref: The Kruger National Park (KNP) lies in the north-east of South Africa and runs along the border of Mozambique in the east, Zimbabwe in the north, and the southern border is the Crocodile River. The park covers 19,500 kmÂ² and is divided in 14 different ecozones, each supporting different wildlife. It is one of the main attractions of South Africa and it is considered the flagship of South African National Parks (SANParks). As with all South African National Parks, there are daily conservation and entry fees for the park. It may also be beneficial for one to buy a Wild Card, which provides entry to either selections of parks in South Africa or all of the South African National Parks.

ref: Towering above the north end of Machu Picchu is this steep mountain, often the backdrop to many photos of the ruins. It looks a bit daunting from below, and it is a steep and difficult ascent, but most reasonably fit persons should be able to make it in about 45 minutes. Stone steps are laid along most of the path, and in the steeper sections steel cables provide a supporting handrail. That said, expect to be out of breath, and take care in the steeper portions, especially when wet, as it can become dangerous quickly. There's a tiny cave near the top that must be passed through, it is quite low and a rather tight squeeze.

ref: Majorcan cuisine, like that of similar zones in the Mediterranean, is based on bread, vegetables and meat (specially pork), and uses olive oil throughout. A simple popular dinner, especially during the summer, is the Pa amb Oli: Bread with olive oil, tomato, and any available condiments such as cheese, tunafish, etc.

src: Ukutya kweHangi kuphekwa kumngxunya owenziwe emhlabeni. Lo mngxuma usenokuba utshiswa ngamatye ashushu omlilo, okanye kwezinye indawo i-geothermal yomlilo yenza indawo ethile yomhlaba itshise ngokwendalo. Ihangi-umngxumo onamatye ashushu- amaxesha amaninzi isetyenziselwa ukurowusta ukutya okuqhelekileyo. ref: A Hangi Meal is cooked in a hot pit in the ground. The pit is either heated with hot stones from a fire, or in some places geothermal heat makes areas of ground naturally hot. The hangi is often used to cook a traditional roast style dinner. Several places in Rotorua offer geothermal hangi, while other hangi can be sampled in Christchurch, Wellington and elsewhere.

src: Xakuvakashelwa iinkonzo, amabhingqa anyanzelwa anxibe iilokhwe ezogquma amadolo futhi bogqume namagxa, futhi. Amakhaya onongendi amanintsi ayabanayo imijijelo yabasethyini abaze bengazilungiselelanga, kodwa ukuba uze nowakho, ikakhulu lona unemibala eqaqambileyo, uyakufumana uncumo kwi Monki okanye uNongendi ekungeneni kwakho emnyango. Ngandlelanye, amadoda alindeleke ukuba anxibe ibhulukhwe ezisitha amadolo. Nalena ingabolekwa kwizinto zokubolekisa ngasekungeneni kodwa ezi mpahla azihlanjwa rhoqo emva koba zinxityiwe ngoko ungangakhululeki xa unxibe ezi lokhwana. Kumadoda isayizi enye ilingana wonke umntu!

ref: While visiting the monasteries, women are required to wear skirts covering the knees and have their shoulders covered, too. Most of the monasteries do provide wraps for women who come unprepared, but if you bring your own, especially one with bright colors, you'll get a smile from the monk or nun at the entrance. Along the same line, men are required to wear trousers covering the knees. This too can be borrowed from the stock at the entrance but that clothing isn't washed after every user so you may not feel comfortable wearing these skirts. One size fits all for men!

src: Ukuba utyelela imimandla ye-Artic okanye ye-Antarctic ebusika uza kufumana ubusuku be-polar, nto leyo ethetha ukuba ilanga aliphumi esibhakabhakeni. Lena yenza ithuba lokubona i-Aurora borealis, njengokuba isibhakabhaka siyakuba mnyama nje kancinci ekuhambeni kwexesha. Nanjengoko iindawo zingaxinenanga, nongcoliseko lungeyongxaki kangoko, uya kukwazi nokubona iinkwenkwezi.
mt: 24 hours of daylight in the Arctic or Antarctic can make it seem like the sun is always shining. This makes it easier to see the northern lights, which are only visible in the dark. And it makes it easier to see the stars, which are usually obscured by light pollution.
ref: If you visit the Arctic or Antarctic areas in the winter you will experience the polar night, which means that the sun doesn't rise above the horizon. This offers a good opportunity to see the Aurora borealis, as the sky will be dark more or less around the clock. As the areas are sparsely populated, and light pollution therefore often not a problem, you will also be able to enjoy the stars.

src: Kwindawo ezisecaleni, apho kungekho nkqubo yecell phones, ifoni yesatellite ingaba kuphela kwecebo onalo. Umnxeba we-satellite akafane athathe indawo yomnxeba oqhelekileyo, njengoba kufuneke uphumile uyibona isatellite ukuze unxebane nomtu. Inkonzo idla ngokusetyenziselwa iinqanawa, kuquka ezokuzonwabisa kunye nezihambela imicimbi ethile ezineemfuno zokusebenzisa idatha nokufowuna ngelizwi. Imnikezi nkonzo zomnxeba wengingqi yakho umele akunikeze inkcukacha ezongezelelekileyo ngokuqhakamishelana nalenkonzo.
mt: 1. In the absence of cell phones, a satellite phone is the only way to communicate. The satellite phone is only useful if you can see the satellite, which is not always possible. The satellite phone is also useful for emergencies and for reporting crimes. 2. The satellite phone is not useful for sending text messages or for making calls.
ref: In remote locations, without cell phone coverage, a satellite phone may be your only option. A satellite phone is not generally a replacement for a mobile phone, as you have to be outdoors with clear line of sight to the satellite to make a phone call. The service is frequently used by shipping, including pleasure craft, as well as expeditions who have remote data and voice needs. Your local telephone service provider should be able to give more information about connecting to this service.

src: Ikomkhulu laseMoldova yiChiÅinÄu. Ulwimi lwasekuhlaleni sisiRomaniya, kodwa isiRashiya sisetyenziswa ngokubanzi. IMoldova yiriphabliki eneentlanga ezininzi eye yachatshazelwa yimilo yekhaya. Ngo 1994, ingxabano yakhokhela ekudalweni kwe Republiki i-Transnistria esempuma ye-Moldova, enorhulumente wayo nemali yayo kodwa ayigqalwa naleliphi na ilizwe elililungu le UN. Amakhonkco ezoqoqosho aphinde amiselwa Phakathi kwezi ndawo ze-Moldova nangona uthethathethwano lwezopolitiko lungaphumelelanga. Uninzi lwabantu lunqula kubu-Othodoki bobuKrestu.
mt: The capital of Moldova is ChiÅinÄu. The local language is Romanian, but Russian is used as a lingua franca. Moldova is a republic with a multiethnic population. In 1994, a war broke out in the Transnistria region of Moldova, and its government and economy were crippled, but the country is now recovering. The political situation is still unstable. Most of the population is Christian Orthodox.
ref: The capital of Moldova is ChiÅinÄu. The local language is Romanian, but Russian is widely used. Moldova is a multi-ethnic republic that has suffered from ethnic conflict. In 1994, this conflict led to the creation of the self-proclaimed Transnistria Republic in eastern Moldova, which has its own government and currency but is not recognised by any UN member country. Economic links have been re-established between these two parts of Moldova despite the failure in political negotiations. The major religion in Moldova is Orthodox Christian.

src: "Kuba I Montevideo ikumazanzi e Equator, kusehlotyeni phaya ngelixa kusebusika kumantla e Hemisphere ngokuntshintshiselana. I Montevideo ikwingingqana ezitshisayo; kwinyanga zehlobo, amaqondo angaphezulu kwe +30Â°C aqhelekile. Ubusika bungakuqhatha ngengqele: amazinga awafane ehle ngaphantsi kokukhenkca,kodwa umoya nokufuma zidibana ukwenza kuvakale kubanda kunakuchazwa yi-thermometer. Akukho maxesha onyaka ""emvula"" ""nawomileyo"": isixa semvula sihlala ngokulinganayo unyaka wonke."
mt: "Because Montevideo is on the Equator, it is summer in the Northern Hemisphere and winter in the Southern Hemisphere. Montevideo is a temperate city; in the summer, temperatures are usually above +30Â°C. The winter is mild: amazinga awafane ehle ngaphantsi kokukhenkca,kodwa umoya nokufuma zidibana ukwenza kuvakale kubanda kunakuchazwa yi-thermometer. There is no such thing as a ""summer"" ""vacation"" ""in the winter"": the summer is the time to travel."
ref: "Since Montevideo is south of the Equator, it is summer there when it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere and vice versa. Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30Â°C are common. The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says. There are no particular ""rainy"" and ""dry"" seasons: the amount of rain stays roughly the same throughout the year."

src: "iMurals engafunekiyo okanye isikripthi esaziwa ngokuba yigraffiti. Ngelixa kukude kwinto yanamhlanje, uninzi lwabantu mhlawumbi luyidibanisa nolutsha olonakalisa impahla kawonke-wonke kunye neyabucala kusetyenziswa ipeyinti yokutshiza. Kodwa ke, kule mihla yethu sele kukho abazobi begraffiti, iminyhadala yegraffiti namadonga ""asemthethweni"" ayo. Imizobo yeGraffitis ela imele ukubonisa imisebenzi yokuyila kunokuthegwa okungafundekiyo."
mt: 2014 was the year of the mural, not graffiti. While some people may have been offended by the graffiti, the murals were a celebration of the art form. Graffiti is a form of art that is not always appreciated.
ref: "Unwanted murals or scribble is known as graffiti. While it's far from a modern phenomenon, most people probably associate it with youth vandalizing public and private property using spray paint. However, nowadays there are established graffiti artists, graffiti events and ""legal"" walls. Graffiti paintings in this context often resemble artworks rather than illegible tags."

src: Kwezinye iifestivali, uninzi lwabaya kwiifestivali zomculo baye bagqibe ngokukhempisha kwindawo eza kuba kuyo ifestivali, kwaye abantu abaninzi abaya kuyo bayijonga njengenxalenye ebalulekileyo yamava abo. Ukuba ufuna ukuba kufutshane nomfutho kuza kufuneka ukuba ufike kwangoko ufumane indawo yokukhempisha ekufutshane nomculo. Ukhumbule ukuba nangona umculo odlalwa kwiqonga eliyintloko kusenokwenzeka uphelile, kusenokubakho amacandelo efestivali aza kuqhubeka edlala umculo de ubusuku buhambele phambili. Ezinye iifestivali siba nendawo zokukhempisha ezilungiselelwe amakhaya nabantwana.
mt: At other festivals, many festival-goers are injured by falling objects at the festival, and many people are injured as part of the festival. If you want to be safe from the crowd, you must go to the designated safe area. Remember that although the music is played in the main stage, the festival will continue to play music until the night. Some festivals have designated safe areas for children.
ref: For some festivals, the vast majority of the attendants to music festivals decide to camp on site, and most attendants consider it a vital part of the experience. If you want to be close to the action you're going to have to get in early to get a camping site close to the music. Remember that even though music on the main stages may have finished, there may be sections of the festival that will keep playing music until late into the night. Some festivals have special camping areas for families with young children.

src: Ngenxa yokuba zikude kangakanani ii-pueblos, awuyi kuba nakho ukufumana isixa esibalulekileyo sobomi bobusuku ngaphandle kokuya eAlbuquerque okanye eSanta Fe. Sekunjalo, phantse zonke iikhasino ezichazwe kolu luhlu lungentla ziyanikisa ngeziselo, kwaye uninzi lwazo zizisa amagama aziwayo kwezolonwabo (ikakhulu ezi zinkulu zingqonge i-Albuquerque ne Santa Fe). Lumka: iibhari zakwiidolophu ezincinane azisoloko zisiba ziindawo ezifanelekileyo zokuya kubantu abasuka ngaphandle kwephondo. Enye into, emntla New Mexico kuneengxaki ezinkulu zokuqhuba kwabantu benxilile, kwaye aba bantu banxilileyo baba linani eliphezulu kwiidolophu ezincinane ezineebhari.
mt: 1. Because of the Pueblos, it is not possible to have a large gathering of people in Albuquerque or Santa Fe. Therefore, all the hotels in the area are full, and most of the people (especially those from Albuquerque and Santa Fe) are staying in the suburbs. 2. There is a large homeless population in New Mexico, and many of the homeless are staying in the suburbs. 3. There is a large population of people who are not homeless, and many of them are staying in the suburbs.
ref: Given how remote many of the pueblos are, you won't be able to find a significant amount of nightlife without traveling to Albuquerque or Santa Fe. However, nearly all of the casinos listed above serve drinks, and several of them bring in name-brand entertainment (primarily the large ones immediately surrounding Albuquerque and Santa Fe). Beware: small-town bars here are not always good places for the out-of-state visitor to hang out. For one thing, northern New Mexico has significant problems with drunk driving, and the concentration of intoxicated drivers is high close to small-town bars.

src: "Utywala basekuhlaleni bonona ""Buthatha indawo yokuqala"", ayibotywala bunzulu, kodwa bumnandi kwaye buyahlaziya. Obunye utywala basekuhlaleni bubizwa ngokuba ""yiManta"". Zininzi iiwayini ezikhoyo, kodwa iiwayini zase-New Zealand nase-Australia zingangcono. Amanzi etephu zasekuhlaleni akhuseleke ngokwaneleyo ukuba aselwe, kodwa ke amanzi asezibhotileni kulula ukuwafumana ukuba uyoyika. Abemi base-Australia, abayiqondi into âyekofu emhlophe qhwa'. Imnyama emfutshane yi 'espresso', icappuccino ifakwe phezulu ngekhilimu (ingeyiyo ifroth), kwaye iti ihanjiswe ngaphandle kobisi. Ichocolate etshisayo ingokwemigangatho yase Belgia. Iziselo zeziqhamo ziyabiza kodwa zimnandi."
mt: 1. "The first one is called âFlat Whiteâ, itâs not a latte, but itâs good and tasty. Another one is called âMantaâ. There are many other coffee shops, but the ones in New Zealand and Australia are the best. The water in the city is safe to drink, but the water in the suburbs is not. The Australians have a âwhite coffeeâ (espresso), a cappuccino with a froth (foam) on top, and itâs served without sugar. Chocolate is Belgian. The shops are nice but not expensive."
ref: "The main local beer is 'Number One', it is not a complex beer, but pleasant and refreshing. The other local beer is called ""Manta"". There are many French wines to be had, but the New Zealand and Australian wines might travel better. The local tap water is perfectly safe to drink, but bottled water is easy to find if you are fearful. For Australians, the idea of 'flat white' coffee is foreign. A short black is 'espresso', cappuccino comes heaped high with cream (not froth), and tea is served without milk. The hot chocolate is up to Belgian standards. Fruit juices are pricey but excellent."

src: "I GuaranÃ­ yayingawona maqela ayebalulekile emveli ehlala apho sithi ngoku kuse Eastern Paraguay ephila ubomi bokuzingela bekwasebenzisa ukulima ukuze baphile. Ummandla weeChaco wawulikhaya kumaqela ezizwe zomthonyama ezifana namaGuaycurÃº namaPayaguÃ¡, ezaziphila ngokuzingela, ngokuvuna nangokuloba. Kwinkulungwane ye-16th iParaguay, eyayifudula ibizwa nge ""The Giant Province of the Indies"", yasungulwa ngenxa yokuhlaselwa kwabeyisi bamaSpanish kunye namaqela enzalelwane zalapho. Ama-Spanish aqale ixesha lokuthathela kuwo amanye amazwe elithatha iinkulungwane ezintathu. Ukususela ekusekweni kweAsunciÃ³n ngo-1537, iParaguay ikwazile ukugcina imveli yayo."
mt: "The GuaranÃ­ people were the first inhabitants of the land we now call Eastern Paraguay, who say they live by hunting, fishing, and farming. The Chaco region is home to the GuaycurÃº and PayaguÃ¡ peoples, who also live by hunting, fishing, and farming. In the 16th century, Paraguay, known as the "Giant Province of the Indies", was founded by the Spanish conquest of the region. The Spanish brought with them other European nations. Since the founding of AsunciÃ³n in 1537, Paraguay has been a major producer of agricultural products."
ref: "The GuaranÃ­ were the most significant indigenous group inhabiting what is now Eastern Paraguay, living as semi-nomadic hunters who also practised subsistence agriculture. The Chaco region was home to other groups of indigenous tribes such as the GuaycurÃº and PayaguÃ¡, who survived by hunting, gathering and fishing. In the 16th century Paraguay, formerly called ""The Giant Province of the Indies"", was born as a result of the encounter of Spanish conquerors with the native indigenous groups. The Spaniards started the colonization period which lasted for three centuries. Since the foundation of AsunciÃ³n in 1537, Paraguay has managed to keep a lot of its indigenous character and identity."

src: "AmaPersi adume ngokuhoya izinto zabo, ubukrwada nokungamameli. Ngoxa oku kudla ngokuba luhlobo nje olungachananga, eyona ndlela ifanelekileyo yokwamkeleka eParis kukuziphatha kakuhle, uzenze umntu owaziwa ""njenge-bien Ã©levÃ©"" (okhuliswe kakuhle). Kuza kwenza kube lula ukuhamba-hamba. Umphandle we Parisians uyanyibilika ukuba ubonakalisa I basic courtesies."
mt: "Persians are known for their hospitality, generosity and lack of manners. The one thing that is not negotiable is their love of food. This is the one thing that makes Parisians so difficult to please, a person known as "the well-mannered" (well-mannered). It is always a struggle to get along. The Parisians' basic courtesies."
ref: "Parisians have a reputation for being egocentric, rude and arrogant. While this is often only an inaccurate stereotype, the best way to get along in Paris still is to be on your best behavior, acting like someone who is ""bien Ã©levÃ©"" (well brought up). It will make getting about considerably easier. Parisians' abrupt exteriors will rapidly evaporate if you display some basic courtesies."

src: IMetroRail ineeklasi ezimbini koololiwe babakhweli eKapa neziphaluka: iMetroPlus (ekwabizwa ngokuba yiKlasi yokuQala) neMetro (ebizwa ngokuba yiKlasi yesiThathu). I-MetroPlus itofotofo kancinci yaye ayigcwali kakhulu kodwa ikwabiza ngakumbi, nangona ixabisa ngaphantsi kwamaxabiso emetro eYurophu. Uloliwe ngamnye unamakhareji eMetroPlus neMetro; aweMetroPlus asoloko esekupheleni kukaloliwe kufutshane naseKapa.
mt: 2 new MetroRail classes have been introduced in Cape Town: MetroPlus (formerly known as the First Class) and Metro (formerly known as the Third Class). MetroPlus is a bit more expensive but offers more comfort than the European metros. Both MetroPlus and Metro have a single fare; MetroPlus is only available in Cape Town.
ref: MetroRail has two classes on commuter trains in and around Cape Town: MetroPlus (also called First Class) and Metro (called Third Class). MetroPlus is more comfortable and less crowded but slightly more expensive, though still cheaper than normal metro tickets in Europe. Every train has both MetroPlus and Metro coaches; the MetroPlus coaches are always on the end of the train nearest Cape Town.

src: Zonke iivenkile zasekuhlaleni zigcwele iintlobo ezahlukeneyo zamakhadi okufowuna asele egcwaliswe ngemali nanokusetyenziswa kwiifowuni zikawonke wonke okanye kwiifowuni eziqhelekileyo. Ngelixa amakhadi amaninzi ekulungele ukufowna naphina, amanye agxile ekunikezeleni amaxabiso okufowuna afanelekileyo kumaqela athile amazwe. Ukufikelela kwezi nkonzo kudla ngokuba xa kusetyenziswa inombolo yasimahla enokufonelwa ziifowuni ezininzi ngaphandle kokubhatala.

src: I-Plitvice Lakes ipaka karhulumente inamahlathi amaninzi, uninzi lwawo yimithi ye-beech, ye-spruce nelohlobo oluthile lompayina Ineentlobo zezityalo ezahlukahlukeneyo, ngenxa yokulungela kwayo imozulu yeendawo ezincinci, umhlaba owahlukileyo kunye nokwahluka kweendawo eziphakamileyo. Le ndawo ikwalikhaya kwizilwanyana neentaka ezininzi ezahlukahlukeneyo. Izilwanyana ezinqabileyo ezifana nebhere laseYurophu elintsundu, iingcuka, ukhozi, isikhova, ingqawa, ikati yasendle kunye ne-lowe zezinye zezidalwa eziqhelekileyo.
mt: 1. The Plitvice Lakes are a national park, with a beech, spruce and pine forest, and a series of 16 interconnecting lakes, formed by the accumulation of travertine due to the area's tectonic activity. The park is home to a variety of wildlife, including bears, wolves, deer, eagles, falcons, owls, foxes, lynxes, wild boars, and otters. The animals include the European brown bear, wolves, deer, eagles, falcons, owls, foxes, lynxes, wild boars, and otters.
ref: The Plitvice Lakes national park is heavily forested, mainly with beech, spruce, and fir trees, and features a mixture of Alpine and Mediterranean vegetation. It has a notably wide variety of plant communities, due to its range of microclimates, differing soils and varying levels of altitude. The area is also home to an extremely wide variety of animal and bird species. Rare fauna such as the European brown bear, wolf, eagle, owl, lynx, wild cat and capercaillie can be found there, along with many more common species

src: Iinkampani zeendaba ziqhele ukuxoka ngenjongo yoku, zisithi oku âkwenzelwe ukuthintela ubumfihlo.â Ngapha koko, iikhowudi zommandla azinampembelelo kukhuphelo olungekho mthethweni; ikopi encinci yediski iya kudlala kakuhle nakwesiphi na isixhobo apho unqontsonqa we diski angadlala khona. Eyona njongo iyintloko kukunika ezo nkampani ulawulo olungakumbi phezu kweemarike zazo; konke oku kungokwenza imali.
mt: The companies say this is âdesigned to reduce costs.â However, the medical devices are not cheap; the cost of the devices is likely to be much higher than the cost of the materials used to make them. This is the main reason why the companies are making a profit; they are selling the devices at a much higher price than the cost of the materials used to make them.
ref: "The media companies routinely lie about the purpose of this, claiming that it is to ""prevent piracy"". In fact, region codes have absolutely no effect on illegal copying; a bit-for-bit copy of a disk will play just fine on any device where the original will. The actual purpose is to give those companies more control over their markets; it's all about money spinning."

src: Ngelixa ukutshekishwa kudla ngokungabikho okanye isiqhelo xa ufika kwilizwe lakho, ulawulo lwe-customs luba yingxaki. Qinisekisa ukuba uyazi ukuba ungangenisa ntoni kwaye awunako ukuzisa ubhengeze nantoni na ngaphezulu komda osemthethweni.
mt: 1. If you are bringing in food or other items that are not allowed, you will be fined. 2. You must declare any items that you are bringing in and pay any applicable taxes.
ref: While immigration check is usually absent or a formality when you arrive in your homeland, customs control can be a hassle. Make sure you know what you can and cannot bring in and declare anything over the legal limits.

src: I-CochamÃ³ Valley - yindawo eyintloko yokunyuka amatye e-Chile, ikwaziwa njenge-Yosemite yakuMzantsi Merika, ngenxa yamadonga ahlukahlukeneyo elitye lenyengane. Iindawo eziphakamileyo ziquka ukubona izinto ngendlela esemagqabini usencotsheni Abakhweli abavela kuwo onke amazwe ehlabathi bahlala beseka iindlela ezintsha kudonga lwayo olungenasiphelo.
mt: The CochamÃ³ Valley - a popular hiking destination in Chile, known as the Yosemite of South America, is closed due to a landslide that buried a road. The road is closed to all traffic and is inaccessible by foot.
ref: CochamÃ³ Valley - Chile's premier climbing destination, known as the Yosemite of South America, with a variety of granite big walls and crags. Summits include breath-taking views from peaks. Climbers from all parts of the world are continually establishing new routes amongst its endless potential of walls.

src: Ukuba ufina ukundiza kwihlabathi liphela kumazantsi e Hemisphere, ukhetho lwenqwelomoya nendawo ezifikelela kuzo ziyabaleka ngenxa yokunqongophala kwendlela ezigudla unxweme. Akukho mbutho wenqwelo moya endiza phezukwazo zontathu iindlela zogqitha emZantsini Wehlabathi (futhi i-SkyTeam ayogqumi nenye indlela yokugqitha). Kodwa ke, I star Alliance iquka yonke into ngaphandle ko Mzantsi Mpuma Pacific osuka e Santiago de Chile ukuya Tahiti, eyi LATAM Oneworld flight. Isindizi asisiso sodwa ukhetho ukuba ufuna ukweqa i-Mzantsi Pacific elunxwemeni olubucala ngasekunene.
mt: 1. If you are flying over the southern hemisphere, the flight path and destination are reversed due to the earth's rotation. There is no direct flight from the southern hemisphere to the northern hemisphere (and vice versa). However, the Star Alliance does have a flight from the southern hemisphere to the northern hemisphere that goes from Santiago de Chile to Tahiti, the LATAM Oneworld flight. This is the only flight that goes from the southern hemisphere to the northern hemisphere.
ref: If you want to fly around the world completely in the Southern Hemisphere, the choice of flights and destinations is limited due to the lack of transoceanic routes. No airline alliance covers all three ocean crossings in the Southern Hemisphere (and SkyTeam covers none of the crossings). However, Star Alliance covers everything except the eastern South Pacific from Santiago de Chile to Tahiti, which is a LATAM Oneworld flight. This flight is not the only option if you want to skip the South Pacific and the west coast of South America. (see below)

src: Kwihlabathi lonke, kukho phantse ama-200 kwimibutho yabakhenkethi ebalekayo. Uninzi lwazo lusebenza ngokuzimeleyo. Ongene ezihlangwini zeAGlobal Running Tours, i-Go Running Tours ilungelelanisa uninzi lwababoneleli ababonayo kumazwekazi amane. Ngenxa yokuba neengcambu Zokuqhuba Ukhenketho eBarcelo Nokuqhuba olwaseCopenhageni, yakhawuleza yajoyinwa Ekuqhubeni Ukhenketho ePrague nakwezinye iindawo.
mt: 200 people are expected to participate. Most of the runners are from the Global Running Tours, Go Running Tours. Because of the Barcelona Marathon, Copenhagen Marathon, Prague Marathon and other marathons, the event is expected to be a success.
ref: Internationally, there are nearly 200 running tour organizations. Most of them operate independently. The Global Running Tours successor, Go Running Tours networks dozens of sightrunning providers on four continents. With roots in Barcelona's Running Tours Barcelona and Copenhagen's Running Copenhagen, it was quickly joined by Running Tours Prague based in Prague and others.

src: I-Safari mhlawumbi yeyona itsala abakhenkethi kwi Africa nokuphawwuleka kwendwendwe ezininzi. Igama elithi safari libhekisela ekuhambeni kwilizwe ukuze ubuke izilwanyana zasendle ezimangalisayo zaseAfrika, ingakumbi esavanna. Ezinye izilwanyana ezifana neendlovu kunye neendlulamthi, zidla ngokusondela kakhulu kwiimoto yaye izixhobo eziqhelekileyo zingakwenza ukwazi ukubona kakuhle. Iingonyama, amahlosi, kunye nezingwe zidla ngokuba nentloni yaye iza kuzibona ngcono ngeebhaynotyhula. Isafari ehambayo (ekwabizwa ngokuba âukuhamba emahlathiniâ, âisafari enyukayoâ, okanye ukuhamba ângeenyawoâ) kuquka ukuhamba imigama emide, mhlawumbi iiyure ezimbalwa okanye iintsuku eziliqela.
mt: 1. A safari is a journey, especially a big game hunt, in Africa, usually undertaken to shoot big game, elephants, and other large animals. The animals, such as lions, tigers, and bears, are hunted for sport. The safari is also called a âbig game hunt,â âa hunting safari,â or a âsport hunt.â 2. ref: "Safaris are perhaps the greatest tourism draw in Africa and the highlight for many visitors. The term safari in popular use refers to overland travel to view the stunning African wildlife, particularly on savanna. Some animals, such as elephants and giraffes, tend to approach closely to cars and standard equipment will allow good viewing. Lions, cheetahs and leopards are sometimes shy and you will see them better with binoculars. A walking safari (also called a ""bush walk"", ""hiking safari"", or going ""footing"") consists of hiking, either for a few hours or several days."

src: Ukuthorisha kubiza kancinci kumaqela amakhulu, ngoko ukuba uhamba wedwa okanye ukunye nomhlobo omnye, zama ukudibana nabanye abantu nize nenze iqela labantu abane ukuya kwabathandathu ukuze nifumane amaxabiso ancitshisiweyo ngomntu ngamnye. Kodwa ke, le nto ayimele ikuxhalabise kangako, kuba amaxesha amaninzi abakhenkethi bayatshintshatshintshwa ukuze bagcwalise iimoto. Kubonakala ngathi yindlela yokuqhatha abantu ukubenza bakholwe ukuba kufuneka babhatale ngaphezulu.
mt: 1,000s of people, some of whom were injured, were evacuated from the area to make way for the rescue teams. However, this was not without its own problems, as the rescue teams were delayed by the need to clear the road of debris. It is believed that the road was blocked by the debris.
ref: Tours are cheaper for larger groups, so if you're by yourself or with just one friend, try to meet other people and form a group of four to six for a better per-person rate. However, this shouldn't really be off your concern, because often tourists are shuffled around to fill the cars. It seems actually to be more a way of tricking people into believing they have to pay more.

src: Ngoxa ezoqoqosho zaseSan Franciso zinxibelelene nayo ekubeni yindawo ethandwayo ephambili kubakhenkethi, zahlukahlukene ezoqoqosho lwayo. Awona macandelo makhulu engqesho ziinkonzo zeengcali, urhulumente, ezezimali, urhwebo kunye nokhenketho. Ukubonisa kwayo umculo, iifilimu, imfundo kunye nenkcubeko edumileyo rhoqo kuncede ukwenza isixeko kunye neempawu zaso zaziwe kwihlabathi liphela. I-San Francisco yenze kwabakho izinto ezininzi ezisetyenziswa ngabahambi ngieehotelezayo ezininzi, iindawo zokutya, kunye neendawo zenkomfa ezingayiwayo. I-San Francisco yenye yeendawo ezibalaseleyo kwesisizwe ukufumana ukutya kwase- Asia: Korean, Thai, Indian, kunye ne-Japanese.
mt: 1. The city of San Francisco is known for its steep hills, cable cars, churches, government, financial, and educational institutions. It is also known for its arts, films, education, and recreation. San Francisco is home to many of the world's leading high-tech companies, restaurants, and hotels. San Francisco is one of the most popular tourist destinations in the world.
ref: While San Francisco's economy is linked to it being a world-class tourist attraction, its economy is diversified. The largest employment sectors are professional services, government, finance, trade, and tourism. Its frequent portrayal in music, films, literature and popular culture has helped make the city and its landmarks known throughout the world. San Francisco has developed a large tourist infrastructure with numerous hotels, restaurants, and top-notch convention facilities. San Francisco is also one of the best places in the nation for other Asian cuisine: Korean, Thai, Indian, and Japanese.

src: Ukubhukisha ngaphambi kwexesha kunika abakhweli uxolo lwengqondo lokuba baya kuba nendawo ethile yokulala nje akuba befika kwindawo abaya kuyo. Abalungiseleli babahambi babanezivumelwano nehotela ezithile, nagona unokufumana kukwazeka ukubhukisha ezinye indlela zendawo zokufikela, njengendawo zokukhempisha, ngokusebenzisa abalungiseleli babahambi. Iiarhente zokuhamba zihlala zibonelela ngeephakeji eziquka isidlo sakusasa, amalungiselelo okuthuthwa ukuya / ukusuka kwisikhululo seenqwelo-moya okanye uhambo ngepleyini oludityanisiweyo kunye neephakheji zehotele. ref: Booking in advance gives the traveller peace of mind that they will have somewhere to sleep once they arrive at their destination. Travel agents often have deals with specific hotels, although you may find it possible to book other forms of accommodation, like camping grounds, through a travel agent. Travel agents usually offer packages that include breakfast, transportation arrangements to/from the airport or even combined flight and hotel packages. They can also hold the reservation for you if you need time to think about the offer or procure other documents for your destination (e.g. visa). Any amendments or requests though should be coursed through the travel agent first and not directly with the hotel.

src: Ii-apps zokutolika ngoko nangoko imibhalo, ii-applikayshini ezikwaziyo ukutolika iimibhalo emide yolunye ulwimi ngolunye ulwimi. Ezinye I applications kolu luhlu zikwazi nokuguqulela okubhaliweyo ngalwimi zimbi ngesayns okanye ezinye iiobjects xa umsebenzisi ekhomba ismartphone sakhe kwezo objects. Iinjini zokuguqulela ziphucuke kakhulu, ibe ngoku ziphantse zikunike iinguqulelo ezichanileyo (azifane zikunike ezingavakaliyo), kodwa ke kusafuneka ilungiswe, njengoko zizesenokukunika inguqulelo engeyiyo tu. Enye yee-app eziphambili ezingena kule khategori ngu-Google Translate, evumela ukuguqulela ngaphandle koqhagamshelwano kwi-intanethi emva kokuba idatha yolwimi olufunwayo iye yadawunlowudwa.
mt: 3D printing, 3D printing applications, 3D printing applications can translate objects from one language to another. Some 3D printing applications allow users to view objects in their native language (or other languages), but it is important to note that these are not always accurate translations. One of the first applications in this category is Google Translate, which allows users to translate text without an internet connection after downloading the language they need.
ref: Real-time text translator apps â applications that are capable of automatically translating whole segments of text from one language into another. Some of the applications in this category can even translate texts in foreign languages on signs or other objects in the real world when the user points the smartphone towards those objects. The translation engines have improved dramatically, and now often give more or less correct translations (and more seldom gibberish), but some care is due, as they still may have gotten it all wrong. One of the most prominent apps in this category is Google Translate, which allows offline translation after downloading the desired language data.

src: "Ikhari sisidlo esenziwe ngezipayisi kunye nemifuno eqhwethayo, kuze kufakwe inyama okanye imifuno eluhlaza. I-Curry iyakwazi ""ukoma"" okanye ""ibemanzi"" ngokuxhomekeka kobuninzi bamanzi. Kwimimandla ephakhathi yase India ekuMantla nase Pakistan, iyogathi ixhaphakile ukusetyenziswa kwizityu zekhari; Kwi India eseMazantsi nakunxweme lwekhontinent, ubisi lwekhokhonathi luxhaphakile ukusetyenziswa."
mt: "Curry is made from vegetables and meat, and is known as a 'hot' or'spicy' food. In India and Pakistan, it is used in the preparation of many dishes; in South Africa and the rest of the continent, it is used as a spice."
ref: "A curry is a dish based on herbs and spices, together with either meat or vegetables. A curry can be either ""dry"" or ""wet"" depending on the amount of liquid. In inland regions of Northern India and Pakistan, yogurt is commonly used in curries; in Southern India and some other coastal regions of the subcontinent, coconut milk is commonly used."

src: I South Pole Traverse (okanye i Highway) ikumgama we 1600 km trail ukusuka kwisitishi i McMurdo kulwandle I Ross Sea ukuya kwi Pole. Ikhephu lakhona eliqokeleleneyo neqabakaelizeleyo liphawulwe ngeflags. Kungahambeka kuphela ngeteletele ezikhethekileyo, ezinezileji ezinepetula nako konke. Oku akuyonto ilunge kakhulu ngenxa yokuba umzila kufuneka uthathe ixesha elide ujikeleze iiNtaba zeTransantarctic ukuze ufike kwithafa.

ref: The South Pole Traverse (or Highway) is a 1600 km trail from McMurdo Station on the Ross Sea to the Pole. It's compacted snow with crevasses filled in and marked by flags. It can only be traveled by specialized tractors, hauling sleds with fuel and supplies. These aren't very nimble so the trail has to take a long swerve around the Transantarctic Mountains to come onto the plateau.

src: Ukungena kuMazantsi eAfrika ngemoto yindlela emangalisayo yokubona bonke ubuhle bengingqi kuquka nokuya kwiindawo ekungafane kuyiwe kuzo ngabahambi. Oku kungenzeka ngesithuthi esiqhelekileyo ngokuceba okuchanileyo kodwa inqwelo eyi 4x4 yeyona ikhuthazwayo kuba ingingqi ezinintsi zifikeleleka ngesithuthi esimavili ayi 4x4. Ungalibali xa usenza amalungiselelo ukuba nangona uMzantsi Africa uzinzile akafani namanye amazwe akufuphi awekhonjalo. Iimfuneko zeVisa kunye neendleko ziyahluka ngokwamazwe kwaye zichatshazelwa lilizwe ovela kulo. Ilizwe ngalinye linemithetho eyahlukileyo efuna ukuba zeziphi izinto ezinyanzelekileyo ekufuneka zikhona emotweni.
mt: 4x4s are a great way to see the best of Africa, but they are also a great way to get stuck in the middle of nowhere. Visas and paperwork can be a hassle, and the country can be a bit of a bureaucratic nightmare. But if you're willing to put in the effort, you can have a great time.
ref: Entering Southern Africa by car is an amazing way to see all the region's beauty as well as to get to places off the normal tourist routes. This can be done in a normal car with careful planning but a 4x4 is highly advised and many locations are only accessible with a high wheel base 4x4. Keep in mind while planning that although Southern Africa is stable not all neighboring countries are. Visa requirements and costs vary from nation to nation and are affected by the country you come from. Each country also has unique laws requiring what emergency items need to be in the car.

src: Zalisa ikhaya lakho ngekofu ephucukileyo kusasa kunye neti ye chamomile ephumzayo ebusuku. Xa uhlala kwindawo yokuhlala, unexesha lokuziphatha kwaye uthathe imizuzu embalwa eyongezelelweyo ukwenza into ekhethekileyo. Ukuba unemvakalelo zokufumanisa, thabatha ithuba lokwenza incindi okanye ucubhe ezicujwayo: Mhlambi uzakufumana isidlo esibandayo onokusenza njengesidlo sakusasa xa ubuyele kwimo yakho yesiqhelo. Ukuba uhlala esixekweni esineenkcubeko ezahlukeneyo zokusela, yiya ezibharini okanye kwiindawo zentselo ongaziqhelanga.
mt: 1. Clean your home with a damp cloth and chamomile tea at night. When you sleep in a clean room, you will have a good night's sleep and wake up refreshed. If you have a cold, you can use a hot compress: You will feel better after a hot bath. If you sleep in a quiet room, you will have a good night's sleep and wake up refreshed. If you have a cold, you can use a hot compress: You will feel better after a hot bath.
ref: Fill your home with a rich coffee in the morning and some relaxing chamomile tea at night. When you're on a staycation, you have the time to treat yourself and take a few extra minutes to brew up something special. If you're feeling more adventurous, take the opportunity to juice or blend up some smoothies: maybe you'll discover a simple beverage that you can make for breakfast when you're back to your daily routine. If you live in a city with a varied drinking culture, go to bars or pubs in neighborhoods you don't frequent.

src: Nangona ungenoyidinga i-Visa xawuvakashele ixesha elincinci kwamanye amazwe njengomvakashi okanye kwezoshishini, ukuya pha njengomfundi wezwe lonke kudlango dinga umntu ahlale kade kunomntu ovakishele ulonwabo. Ngokuqhelekileyo, xa uza kuhlala ixesha elide kwilizwe lasemzini kuye kufuneke ufumane i-visa kwangaphambili. ref: While you may not need a visa for short visits to certain countries as a tourist or for business, going there as an international student generally requires a longer stay than going there just as a casual tourist. In general, staying in any foreign country for an extended period of time will require you to obtain a visa in advance. Student visas generally have different requirements and application procedures from normal tourist or business visas. For most countries, you will need an offer letter from the institution you wish to study at, and also evidence of funds to support yourself for at least the first year of your course. Check with the institution, as well as the immigration department for the country you wish to study in for detailed requirements.

mt: 1. In the short term, you can help save the rainforest by buying products that are not made from tropical hardwoods. If you buy furniture made from tropical hardwoods, you are helping to destroy the rainforest.

src: Ii-Sundarbans yeyona ndawo esenxwemeni enemithana kwihlabathi lonke, inobude be-80 km (yi-50 ye-mayile) ukuya kungena e-Bangladesh nangaphakathi kwilizwe lase-India ukusuka elunxwemeni. I Sundarbans ichazwe njenge UNESCO World Heritage Site. Inxalenye yehlathi phakathi komhlaba wase India ubizwa njengokuba yi Sundarbans National Park. Amahlathi ayingomgxobhozo we-mangrove-kodwa abandakanya iindawo zokugqibela zamahlathi amakhulu awayekhe agubungela ithafa laseGangetic. IiSundarbans zigubungela indawo eyi-3,850 kmÂ², apho malunga nesinye kwisithathu sigutyungelwe ngamanzi / kwiindawo ezinomgxobhozo. Ukusukela ngo1966 i-Sundabans yindawayo yendalo yasendle, futhi ngoku kuyaqikelelwa ba kukho iingwe zee-Royal Bengali eziyi-400 namahlumela achokoziweyo ayi-30,000 engingqini.
mt: The Sundarbans is a mangrove forest in the delta of the Ganges, Brahmaputra and Meghna rivers on the Bay of Bengal. It is the largest single block of tidal halophytic mangrove forest in the world and covers an area of 10,000 kmÂ² (3,800 sq mi). The forest lies in the southern part of the delta and is divided in equal proportions among India, Bangladesh and a tiny part of Burma. It is adjacent to the border triangle of India, Bangladesh and West Bengal. The name Sundarban can be literally translated as "beautiful forest" in the Bengali and Sanskrit languages. The forest was declared a wildlife sanctuary in 1973 and a core area of the sanctuary was designated a national park in 1977. In 1987, it was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The forest is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The Sundarbans National Park is a National Park in India. The park is 10,000 kmÂ² (3,800 sq mi) in area and is east of the India-Bangladesh border. The park is adjacent to the border of India, Bangladesh and West Bengal. The name Sundarban can be literally translated as "beautiful forest" in the Bengali and Sanskrit languages. ref: The Sundarbans are the largest littoral mangrove belt in the world, stretching 80 km (50 mi) into the Bangladeshi and Indian hinterland from the coast. The Sundarbans has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The part of the forest within Indian territory is called Sundarbans National Park. The forests aren't just mangrove swamps though â they include some of the last remaining stands of the mighty jungles which once covered the Gangetic plain. The Sundarbans cover an area of 3,850 kmÂ², of which about one-third is covered in water/marsh areas. Since 1966 the Sundarbans have been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are now 400 Royal Bengal tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer in the area.

src: "Idityaniswe nokungafikeleleki kwayo, ""iTimbuktu"" sele isetyenzisiwe njengomzekeliso kumazwe akude, kude. Namhlanje, iTimbuktu yidolophu ehlwempuzekileyo, nangona igama layo liyenza ibe ngumtsalane kubakhenkethi, kwaye inesikhululo seenqwelomoya. Ngo-1990, yafakwa kuluhlu lweendawo zenkcubeko yomhlaba ezisengozi, ngenxa yesanti yasentlango. Yayiyenye yeendawo zokumisa eziphambili ngexesha likaHenry Louis Gates 'PBS Izimanga ezizodwa zeLizwe laseAfrika. Esi sixeko asivumelani tu kunye nezinye izixeko zelizwe, kuba sona sinobuArabhu kakhulu kunokuba nobuAfrika."
mt: "It is a city that has been forgotten, "Timbuktu" is a name that conjures up images of the Sahara, and yet it is a city. Today, Timbuktu is a dusty town, but its name conjures up images of the Sahara. In 1990, it was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site, due to its historic buildings. It was featured in Henry Louis Gates' PBS documentary "African American Lives." It is not a city of Arabs, but of Africans."
ref: "Combined with its relative inaccessibility, ""Timbuktu"" has come to be used as a metaphor for exotic, distant lands. Today, Timbuktu is an impoverished town, although its reputation makes it a tourist attraction, and it has an airport. In 1990, it was added to the list of world heritage sites in danger, due to the threat of desert sands. It was one of the major stops during Henry Louis Gates' PBS special Wonders of the African World. The city is in stark contrast to the rest of the country's cities, because it has more of an Arabic flair than of an African."

src: Ii-Paralympics zizoqala ukusukela nge-24 kweyeThupha ukuqhina nge-5 kweyoMsintsi ngo-2021. Emnye imidlalo izodlalelwa kwezinye iindawo e-Japan. I-Tokyo iza kuba siso sodwa isixeko sase-Asia esikhe sabamba imidlalo yee-Olimpiki kabini, ekubeni yayikhe yabamba imihlalo yango-1964. Ukuba uye wabhukisha uhambo ngenqwelo moya kunye nendawo yokuhlala noka-2020 ngaphambi kokuba ukuhlehliswa kuchazwa, kusenokwenzeka ube nemeko engaqinisekanga. Iipolisi zokurhoxisa ziyahluka, kodwa ukususela ekupheleni kukaMatshi, ukurhoxa ngenxa yekhorona bekungadluleli kuJulayi 2020, ixesha apho bekumele kukho imidlalo yeOlimpikhi. Kulindeleke ukuba amatikiti ezinto ezininzi aza kubiza phakathi kwe-Â¥2,500 ne-Â¥130,000, yaye amaxabiso aqhelekileyo aya kubiza malunga ne-Â¥7,000.
mt: 2021 Paralympics will begin on August 24 and end on September 5, 2021. Some events will be held in other cities in Japan. Tokyo will be the first Asian city to host both the Olympics and the Paralympics, having previously hosted the 1964 Olympics. If the Tokyo 2020 Games are cancelled due to the coronavirus pandemic, it will be the first time since the 1972 Summer Olympics in Munich that the Games have been cancelled. The decision to cancel the Games was made on July 22, 2020, the day the Games were scheduled to begin, after the Japanese government declared a state of emergency. It is estimated that the cancellation will cost the city Â¥2.5 billion to Â¥13 billion, with the loss of revenue estimated at Â¥7 billion.
ref: The Paralympics will take place from 24 August to 5 September 2021. Some events will be held in other locations throughout Japan. Tokyo will be the only Asian city to have hosted two summer Olympics, having hosted the games in 1964. If you booked your flights and accommodation for 2020 before the postponement was announced, you may have a tricky situation. Cancellation policies vary, but as of late March most coronavirus-based cancellation policies don't extend to July 2020, when the Olympics had been scheduled. It's expected that most event tickets will cost between Â¥2,500 and Â¥130,000, with typical tickets costing around Â¥7,000.

ref: "A tornado is a spinning column of very low-pressure air, which sucks the surrounding air inward and upward. They generate high winds (often 100-200 miles/hour) and can lift heavy objects into the air, carrying them as the tornado moves. They begin as funnels descending from storm clouds, and become ""tornadoes"" when they touch the ground."

src: Ukuba ilizwe oza kulityelella liba namacebiso okutyelela, i-inshorensi yakho yokuhamba okanye i-inshorensi yakho yokurhoxisa uhambo ingachaphazeleka.
